67.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for controlling access to an aerostat. In one implementation, a method includes receiving, by a computing device associated with an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) that is configured to be coupled to an aerostat, authentication information from a user; comparing, by the computing device, the authentication information to at least one pre-determined security protocol; in response to determining that the authentication information matches the at least one pre-determined security protocol, authorizing, by the computing device, coupling of the UAV to the aerostat; and transmitting, by the computing device, instructions to the UAV instructing the UAV to couple to the aerostat.

68.content: “This stuff is discriminating too!” Judge Fang said. “It is Confucian toner,” Chang said, finally choking down his noodles. “It has a passion for books.” The Judge smiled tolerantly and looked to Miss Pao for an explanation. “You have examined this new species of mite, I take it?” “It is more interesting than that,” Miss Pao said. “Within the last week, not one but two new species of mite have appeared in the Leased Territories—both programmed to seek out anything that looks like a book.” She reached into her bag again and handed her master a rolled-up piece of mediatronic paper.
68.title: Methods and compositions for controlling bookworm mites
68.abstract: The present invention relates to methods of controlling pests, such as the red flour beetle Tribolium castaneum (Herbst) or the lesser grain borer Oryzaephilus surinamensis (Linnaeus), by administering one or more strains of Bacillus thuringiensis.

69.content: A chorus of excited squeaking came from the mice as commands were relayed and issued. The carpet went into violent but highly organized motion as the mice drew themselves up into platoons, companies, battalions, and regiments, each of them commanded by an officer. One mouse clambered up the leg of Princess Nell's table, bowed low to her, and then began to squeak commands from on high. The mice executed a close-order drill, withdrew to the edges of the room, and arrayed themselves in an empty box shape, leaving a large open rectangle in the middle of the floor. The mouse up on the table, whom Nell had dubbed the Generalissima, issued a lengthy series of orders, running to each of the four edges of the table to address different contingents of the Mouse Army. When the Generalissima was finished, very high piping music could be heard as the mouse pipers played their bagpipes and the drummers beat their drums. Small groups of mice began to encroach on the empty space, each group moving toward a different spot. Once each group had reached its assigned position, the individual mice arranged themselves in such a way that the group as a whole described a letter. In this way, the following message was written across the floor of the library: WE ARE ENCHANTED REQUEST ASSISTANCE REFER TO BOOKS “I shall bend all my efforts toward your disenchantment,” Princess Nell said, and a tremendous, earsplitting scream of gratitude rose from the tiny throats of the Mouse Army. Finding the required book did not take long. The Mouse Army split itself up into small detachments, each of which wrestled a different book from the shelf, opened it up on the floor, and scampered through it one page at a time, looking for relevant spells. Within the hour, Princess Nell noted that a broad open corridor had developed in the Mouse Army, and that a book was making its way toward her, seeming to float an inch above the floor. She lifted the book carefully from the backs of the mice who were bearing it and flipped through it until she found a spell for the disenchantment of mice.
69.title: Method and apparatus for disenchanting mice
69.abstract: A method of disenchanting a mouse includes providing the mouse to a user, wherein the mouse is enchanted with one or more spells. The method also includes detecting an action performed by the user in relation to the mouse while the mouse is provided to the user. In addition, the method includes determining that the action performed by the user corresponds to at least one of the one or more spells associated with the mouse. Further, the method includes decreasing a number of remaining uses of the at least one of the one or more spells upon determining that the action performed by the user corresponds to the at least one of the one or more spells. Lastly, the method includes preventing use of the at least one of the one or more spells after the number of remaining uses of the at least one of the one or more spells has been decreased to zero.

70.content: “Miss Pao, do you have anything to add?” The tiny woman in the spectacles looked at Bud and said, in Texan-accented English, “From this man's forehead I removed a voice-activated nanoprojectile launcher, colloquially known as a skull gun, loaded with three types of ammunition, including so-called Crippler rounds of the type used against Mr. Kwamina. Nanopresence examination of the serial numbers on those rounds, and comparison of the same with fragments removed from Mr. Kwamina's wound, indicated that the round used on Mr. Kwamina was fired from the gun embedded in the suspect's forehead.”
70.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a perpetrator of a homicide using nanotechnology
70.abstract: A method is disclosed for identifying a perpetrator of a homicide. The method comprises the steps of: (a) obtaining at least one biological sample from an individual suspected of committing the homicide; (b) extracting nucleic acids from the at least one biological sample; (c) synthesising oligonucleotides that are complementary to the extracted nucleic acids, wherein the oligonucleotides have covalently-attached functionalised gold nanoparticles; (d) hybridising the oligonucleotides with the extracted nucleic acids so as to attach the functionalised gold nanoparticles to the extracted nucleic acids; (e) analysing the attachment of the functionalised gold nanoparticles to the extracted nucleic acids in order to identify genetic markers indicative of the identity of the perpetrator of the hom

71.content: “What sort of a person is he? I haven't been afforded many clues, unfortunately. I've tried to draw some deductions from the sorts of people who are looking for him, and the sort of person I am.” “Pardon me, Father, but what bearing does your own nature have on that of the Alchemist?” “More than one knowledgeable sort has arrived at the conclusion that I'm just the right man to find this fellow, even though I know nothing of criminals and espionage and so forth. I'm just a nanotechnological engineer.”
71.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for managing an alchemist's apprentice. In some implementations, a method includes receiving, from a first user device of a first user,
71.abstract: a request to provide the first user with access to one or more second user devices associated with a second user; determining that the first user is not authorized to have access to the one or more second user devices; in response to determining that the first user is not authorized to have access to the one or more second user devices, causing presentation of a notification indicating that the first user is not authorized to have access to the one or more second user devices.

72.content: He took out a piece of jewelry swinging ponderously at the end of a gold chain. It was circular, smooth gold on one side and white on the other. The white side was protected under a flattened glass dome. It had numbers written around the edge, and a couple of slender metal things like daggers, one longer than the other, joined at their hilts in the center.
72.title: Jewelry box
72.abstract: A jewelry box includes a main body, a lid and a locking mechanism. The lid is pivotally connected to the main body for covering an opening of the main body. The locking mechanism is disposed between the lid and the main body when the lid covers the opening of the main body so as to prevent the lid from being pivoted away from the main body.

73.content: “They are introduced through the blood, of course—the hæmocules circulate through the bloodstream until they find themselves passing through capillaries in the brain, at which point they cut through the blood/brain barrier and fasten themselves to a nearby axon. They can monitor activity in the axon or trigger it. These 'sites all talk to each other with visible light.” “So when I was on my own, my 'sites just talked to themselves,” Hackworth said, “but when I came into close proximity with other people who had these things in their brains—” “It didn't matter which brain a 'site was in. They all talked to one another indiscriminately, forming a network. Get some Drummers together in a dark room, and they become a gestalt society.” “But the interface between these nanosites and the brain itself—” “Yes, I admit that a few million of these things piggybacking on randomly chosen neurons is only a feeble interface to something as complicated as the human brain,” Napier said. “We're not claiming that you shared one brain with these people.” “So what did I share with them exactly?” Hackworth said. “Food. Air. Companionship. Body fluids. Perhaps emotions or general emotional states.
73.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with an organism using a plurality of hæmocules implanted in the organism
73.abstract: A method, system and apparatus for communicating with an organism comprising a plurality of hæmocules. Each hæmocule is configured to receive at least one communication signal from another hæmocule; each hæmocule is further configured to transmit said at least one communication signal received by that hæmocule to all other hæmocules within range of that hæmocule so as to form a mesh network whereby any hæmocule can communicate with any other hæmocule via the mesh network.

74.content: This section of the script never changed, and Nell had been over it a hundred times trying to troubleshoot it. The client went through a little speech in which he informed Mrs. Braithwaite that her son Richard had been killed in action, displaying great heroism in the process, and that he was recommending him for a posthumous Victoria Cross. Nell had already done the obvious, going back through the Times archives to see whether this was a reconstruction of an actual event in the client's life. As far as she could determine, it was more like a composite of many similar events, perhaps with a dollop of fantasy thrown in.
74.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for posthumous Victoria Crosses. In some implementations, a method includes determining that a recipient of a Victoria Cross is deceased;
74.abstract: obtaining information associated with an event in which the recipient received the Victoria Cross; obtaining information associated with one or more actions performed by the recipient during the event; analyzing the information associated with the event and the information associated with the one or more actions to determine whether the recipient displayed bravery above and beyond the call of duty while performing the one or more actions; responsive to determining that the recipient displayed bravery above and beyond the call of duty while performing the one or more actions, awarding the recipient a posthumous Victoria Cross.

75.content: “Nell was putting her children to bed and decided to read them some stories,” said the book's voice. Nell looked at the book, which had flopped itself open again, this time to an illustration showing a girl who looked much like Nell, except that she was wearing a beautiful flowing dress and had ribbons in her hair. She was sitting next to a miniature bed with four children tucked beneath its flowered coverlet: a dinosaur, a duck, a bunny, and a baby with purple hair.
75.title: Method and apparatus for reading a book to a child
75.abstract: A method of reading a book to a child, the method comprising: (a) obtaining an electronic version of the book; (b) identifying one or more words in the electronic version of the book that are likely to be unfamiliar to the child; (c) generating at least one audio file corresponding to each word identified in step (b), wherein each audio file is configured to read aloud the corresponding word from the electronic version of the book; and (d) storing the at least one audio file generated in step (c) as metadata associated with the electronic version of the book.

76.content: Judge Fang unrolled the page and anchored it with various small items of faience. The paper was divided into two panes, each containing a magnified view of a microscopic device. Judge Fang could see that both were made to navigate through the air, but beyond that, they could hardly have been more different. One of them looked like a work of nature; it had several bizarre and elaborate arms and sported four enormous, wildly involuted, scooplike devices, arranged ninety degrees apart. “The ears of a bat!” Chang exclaimed, tracing their impossibly complex whorls with the tip of a chopstick.
76.title: Bat-winged flying machine from the Han Dynasty (206 B.C.-A.D. 220) excavated from a tomb at Mawangdui in Changsha, Hunan Province
76.abstract: The present invention relates to a bat-winged flying machine from the Han Dynasty (206 B.C.-A.D. 220) excavated from a tomb at Mawangdui in Changsha, Hunan Province.

77.content: “Ritual is a good description,” Hackworth said. “Earlier today, that man and that woman were both visited by messengers who gave them a place and time—nothing else. In this case, the woman's job was to jump off that cliff at the given time. The man's job was to tie the end of the rope before she jumped. A very simple job—” “But if he had failed to do it, she'd be dead,” Fiona said. “Precisely. The names are pulled out of a hat.
77.title: Method and apparatus for conducting a ritual
77.abstract: A method of conducting a ritual is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) obtaining, by an electronic device, at least one image; (b) determining whether the at least one image depicts a first object or a second object; (c) in response to determining that the at least one image depicts the first object, causing the electronic device to perform a first set of actions associated with the first object; and (d) in response to determining that the at least one image depicts the second object, causing the electronic device to perform a second set of actions associated with the second object.

78.content: Since she had been very small, she had made up stories and recited them to the Primer, which were often digested and incorporated into the Primer's stories. It had come naturally to Nell to do the same work for Madame Ping. But now her boss was calling it a performance, and Nell had to admit that it was, in a way. Her stories were being digested, not by the Primer, but by another human being, becoming a part of that person's mind. That seemed simple enough, but the notion troubled her for a reason that did not become clear until she had lain half-asleep and fretted over it for several hours.
78.title: Method and apparatus for storytelling
78.abstract: A computer-implemented method is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (i) receiving an input from a user; (ii) identifying one or more stories associated with the received input; (iii) determining, using at least one machine learning model, whether each of the identified one or more stories relates to the received input; and (iv) in response to determining that none of the identified one or more stories relates to the received input, providing feedback to the user indicating that there are no relevant stories related to the received input.

79.content: “And so some people come here because they are on a quest of some sort—trying to find a lost lover, let's say, or to understand why something terrible happened in their lives, or why there is cruelty in the world, or why they aren't satisfied with their career. Society has never been good at answering these questions—the sorts of questions you can't just look up in a reference database.” “But the dynamic theatre allows one to interface with the universe of data in a more intuitive way,” Hackworth said. “That is precisely it,” the woman said.
79.title: Method and apparatus for presenting a dynamic theatrical performance
79.abstract: A method of controlling an entertainment system is provided. The method includes receiving, by one or more processing devices associated with the entertainment system, a plurality of sensor signals from a plurality of sensors positioned at a venue; determining, by the one or more processing devices, whether any of the plurality of sensor signals satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that none of the plurality of sensor signals satisfies the predetermined criterion, identifying, by the one or more processing devices, a subset of the plurality of sensors satisfying the predetermined criterion; transmitting, by the one or more processing devices, data indicative of the subset of the plurality of sensors identified as satisfying the predetermined criterion to a control device operatively connected to the entertainment system; and controlling, by the control device, the entertainment

80.content: “Typically such commitments are superfluous, as in most cases the party has very little choice in the matter.” “Yes,” Hackworth said, “I see what you mean.” “The commitment is a moral one, a question of honour,” Finkle-McGraw said. “That such an engineer falls into trouble is evidence of mere hypocrisy on his part.
80.title: Method and apparatus for committing to a course of action
80.abstract: A method includes receiving, by a computing device from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), an indication that the user desires to commit to a course of action. The GUI comprises one or more selectable options associated with the course of action. Responsive to receiving the indication, the computing device commits to the course of action in accordance with at least one of the one or more selectable options associated with the course of action. In response to committing to the course of action, the computing device performs an action corresponding to the course of action.

81.content: He ran out of the room and stormed through the ship for some distance, going up several stairways, past several decks. He stepped into another room, chosen at random, and found the floor covered with cribs, evenly spaced in rows and columns, each one containing a sleeping one-year-old, dressed in fuzzy pink jammies with a hood and a set of mouse ears, each one clutching an identical white security blanket and nestled up with a stuffed animal.
81.title: Methods, systems, and devices for securely storing one-year-olds and security blankets aboard the USS Enterprise (NCC-1701)
81.abstract: A method of securing an infant in a spacecraft is provided. The method comprises providing a child restraint apparatus configured to be attached to a surface of the spacecraft; attaching the child restraint apparatus to the surface of the spacecraft such that the child restraint apparatus extends outward from the surface of the spacecraft at least partially along a longitudinal axis of the spacecraft; positioning an infant within the child restraint apparatus; and fastening the child restraint apparatus to the surface of the spacecraft so as to prevent movement of the child restraint apparatus relative to the surface of the spacecraft.

82.content: This promiscuous denial of boundaries was everywhere on the totem poles and on the woman's tattoo: The staring eyes of a bear were also the faces of some other sort of creature. The woman's navel was also the mouth of a human face, much like the orca's blowhole, and sometimes that face became the mouth of a larger face whose eyes were her nipples and whose goatee was her pubic hair. But as soon as he'd made out one pattern, it would change into something else, because unlike the totem poles the tattoo was dynamic and played with images in time the same way that the totem poles did in space.
82.title: Totem pole tattoo
82.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems, methods, and computer-readable storage media configured to generate a three-dimensional (3D) model of a totum pole tattoo. In some implementations, an electronic device may receive one or more images depicting a user wearing a body art design comprising a plurality of polygons arranged in a geometric pattern. The electronic device may process the one or more images to extract pixel data associated with each polygon of the plurality of polygons. The electronic device may analyze the extracted pixel data to determine at least one attribute for each polygon of the plurality of polygons. Based on the at least one attribute determined for each polygon of the plurality of polygons, the electronic device may generate a 3D model of the body art design that corresponds to the plurality of polygons. Numerous other aspects are contemplated.

83.content: It is a racial thing, Mr. PhyrePhox. That a European man is smuggling Han babies to the Leased Territories—and thence, I would assume, out to the world beyond—triggers profound, I might even say primal emotions within me and many other Chinese persons. “During the Boxer Rebellion, the rumor was spread that the orphanages run by European missionaries were in fact abattoirs where white doctors scooped the eyes out of the heads of Han babies to make medicine for European consumption.
83.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for determining whether a baby is a Han baby or a non-Han baby. In some implementations, a method includes obtaining a plurality of
83.abstract: images associated with the baby; processing each image in the plurality of images to generate one or more feature vectors that are indicative of at least one facial characteristic of the baby depicted in the corresponding image from the plurality of images; providing the one or more feature vectors to a machine learning model configured to classify the baby as a Han baby or a non-Han baby using the one or more feature vectors; receiving an output generated by the machine learning model indicating whether the baby is a Han baby or a non-Han baby; and presenting the output via a graphical user interface (GUI).

84.content: It could mean a trickster who broke into things—but it could also mean an especially skilled coder.” “The ambiguity is common in post-Neolithic cultures,” Hackworth said. “As technology became more important, the Trickster underwent a shift in character and became the god of crafts—of technology, if you will—while retaining the underlying roguish qualities.
84.title: Methods, systems, and devices for presenting trickster gods and goddesses in mythology and folklore
84.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure provide methods, systems, and devices for presenting trickster gods and goddesses in mythology and folklore. In one implementation, an apparatus includes processing circuitry configured to receive user input corresponding to a selection of a deity from a plurality of deities; determine that the selected deity is a trickster god or goddess among the plurality of deities; cause presentation of information about the selected deity via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the presented information comprises at least one attribute associated with the selected deity as a trickster god or goddess; receive additional user input corresponding to a selection of another deity from the plurality of deities; and responsive to determining that the selected other deity is different than the selected deity, cause presentation of information about the selected other deity via the GUI. Other implementations are also described herein.

85.content: Four-year-old Elizabeth Finkle-McGraw would receive the Young Lady's Illustrated Primer from her grandfather. Fiona Hackworth would be getting a copy of the Illustrated Primer too, for this had been John Percival Hackworth's crime: He had programmed the matter compiler to place the cockleburs on the outside of Elizabeth's book. He had paid Dr. X to extract a terabyte of data from one of the cockleburs. That data was, in fact, an encrypted copy of the matter compiler program that had generated the Young Lady's Illustrated Primer. He had paid Dr. X for the use of one of his matter compilers, which was connected to private Sources owned by Dr. X and not connected to any Feed. He had generated a second, secret copy of the Primer.
85.title: Young lady's illustrated primer
85.abstract: A method of making a young lady's illustrated primer is disclosed. The method includes the steps of (1) obtaining a plurality of illustrations, wherein each illustration in the plurality of illustrations depicts at least one aspect of being a young lady; and (2) assembling the plurality of illustrations into an electronic book file that can be read by a computing device.

86.content: It's not that the thing has threads in it—it is threads. Threads going under and over each other. If you pulled out all of the threads, nothing would be left.”
86.title: Apparatus and method for securing a threaded fastener
86.abstract: A device for tightening a screw or bolt into a pre-drilled hole in a workpiece is disclosed. The device comprises an elongated shaft having a proximal end and a distal end opposite the proximal end; a handle coupled to the proximal end of the shaft, the handle being configured to be gripped by a user during operation of the device; at least one rotatable spindle extending through the shaft from the proximal end to the distal end, the at least one rotatable spindle operable to rotate relative to the shaft about an axis that is substantially perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the shaft such that rotation of the handle moves the at least one rotatable spindle along the longitudinal axis of the shaft towards the distal end of the shaft; wherein the at least one rotatable spindle carries a removable cartridge

87.content: Harv was lying on the top of a three-layer bunkbed on the twentieth floor, sharing a small room and a supply of purified air with a dozen other chronic asthma sufferers. His face was goggled into a phantascope, and his lips were wrapped around a thick tube plugged into a nebulizer socket on the wall. Vaporized drugs, straight from the matter compiler, were flowing down that tube and into his lungs, working to keep his bronchi from spasming shut.
87.title: Method and apparatus for treating an asthma attack
87.abstract: A method of treating an asthma attack includes administering to a patient suffering from the asthma attack at least one dose of beclomethasone dipropionate inhalation powder.

88.content: By the time she had descended perhaps fifty or sixty floors, the building had come awake; all of the cars were in constant motion, and when they went past her, she could hear men talking excitedly inside them. Light flooded into the shaft several floors below.
88.title: Method and apparatus for transporting objects between floors of a multi-story building
88.abstract: A method, system, and computer program product for transporting an object from a first floor to a second floor of a multi-story building. The method includes determining that the object should be transported from the first floor to the second floor; identifying one or more unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) capable of transporting the object from the first floor to the second floor; selecting at least one UAV from the identified one or more UAVs as a selected UAV; transmitting instructions to the selected UAV instructing the selected UAV to transport the object from the first floor to the second floor; receiving information indicating that the object has been successfully transported from the first floor to the second floor by the selected UAV; and providing confirmation that the object has been successfully transported from the first floor to the second floor. Various other methods, systems, and computer program products are also disclosed herein.

89.content: Another man was on guard in the elevator lobby, and as he came to investigate the sounds, she ran him through several times quickly, taking a page from Napier's book this time. The elevators were now under some kind of central control and probably subject to surveillance; rather than press the button in the lobby, she cut a hole in the doors, sheathed her sword, and clambered out onto a ladder that ran down the shaft.
89.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an elevator
89.abstract: A method of controlling an elevator includes determining, by a processor, whether the elevator is to be stopped at a predetermined position. When it is determined that the elevator is to be stopped at the predetermined position, the processor stops the elevator from moving upward or downward in response to receipt of a call signal requesting movement of the elevator upward or downward. In addition, when it is determined that the elevator is not to be stopped at the predetermined position, the processor does not stop the elevator from moving upward or downward in response to receipt of the call signal requesting movement of the elevator upward or downward.

90.content: The umbrellas could be programmed to dangle in different ways—always maintaining the same collective shape, like a fencing mask, or rippling like a sheet of fine silk, depending on the current mode. The veil offered Nell protection from unwanted scrutiny. Many New Atlantis career women also used the veil as a way of meeting the world on their own terms, ensuring that they were judged on their own merits and not on their appearance. It served a protective function as well, bouncing back the harmful rays of the sun and intercepting many deleterious nanosites that might otherwise slip unhindered into the nose and mouth. The latter function was of particular concern to Constable Moore on this morning.
90.title: Umbrella
90.abstract: An umbrella includes a shaft, a canopy connected to the shaft, and a support structure. The support structure is disposed underneath the canopy when the umbrella is in an open position. The support structure may include one or more ribs that are configured to provide structural support for the canopy during use of the umbrella.

91.content: They came to the center of the rocky outcropping and laid the bundle on the ground, then turned and walked away. Judge Fang turned away from the mediatron and dismissed it with a wave of the hand; he did not have to see it to know that the bundle was a baby, probably female.
91.title: Method and apparatus for determining the sex of a fetus in utero
91.abstract: A method is disclosed for determining the sex of a fetus in utero. The method includes obtaining ultrasound data from an ultrasound examination of a pregnant woman, wherein the ultrasound data comprises at least one two-dimensional (2D) or three-dimensional (3D) image; analyzing the ultrasound data to identify features within the at least one 2D or 3D image that are indicative of the sex of the fetus in utero; classifying the identified features as being either male or female; and outputting information relating to the sex of the fetus in utero.

92.content: The world had been such a quiet and dead place for so long that we were startled by any noise or movement, and now it seemed that the air and ground had come alive once more, just as in the old days before the comet. The noise in the air was caused by a great flock of teensy-tiny Pteranodons, though instead of smooth reptilian skin their wings were covered with oversize scales, and they had toothless, bony beaks instead of proper mouths. These miserable things— these airborne crumbs—were swarming all around Pteranodon, getting in his eyes, pecking at his wings, and it was all he could do to keep airborne. As I mentioned, I was keeping one eye on Utahraptor as always, and to my surprise he suddenly turned away and ran up onto the north slope, with an eagerness that could be explained only by the availability of food.
92.title: Pteranodon (Pteranodon longiceps), a new species of pterosaur from the Upper Cretaceous (Maastrichtian) Hell Creek Formation of Montana, U.S.A.
92.abstract: (a) a first body portion; and(b) a second body portion coupled to the first body portion, wherein at least one of the first body portion or the second body portion comprises a plurality of elongated ribs that extend longitudinally along an anterior-posterior axis of the vertebral column between two adjacent vertebrae in each of the first body portion and the second body portion when the vertebral column is positioned in a neutral orientation with respect to a sagittal plane defined perpendicular to the anterior-posterior axis such that both the first body portion and the second body portion are substantially aligned with the anterior-posterior axis for support of the vertebral column during locomotion while permitting lateral flexion of the vertebral column relative to the anterior-posterior axis as well as rotation of the vertebral column relative to the anterior-posterior axis about a

93.content: The boat was basically a large flat open tub, not much more than a life raft, with some controls in the bow and some sort of modern and hence negligibly small propulsion system built into the stern. As their eyes adjusted to the dim light scattering through the fog, they could see perhaps a dozen other passengers around the edge of the boat, seated so that wakes from passing vessels would not upset them. Seeing wisdom in this, John led Fiona to the only remaining open space, and they sat down between two other groups: a trio of young Nipponese men forcing cigarettes on one another, and a man and woman in bohemian-but-expensive clothes, sipping lager from cans and conversing in Canadian accents.
93.title: Boat ride to nowhere
93.abstract: A boat ride to nowhere is provided. The boat ride to nowhere comprises an inflatable inner tube having a first end and a second end opposite the first end. A plurality of air chambers are disposed within the inflatable inner tube, wherein at least one of the plurality of air chambers is in fluid communication with both the first end and the second end of the inflatable inner tube. Each of the plurality of air chambers may be selectively pressurized or depressurized so as to cause the inflatable inner tube to bend upwardly toward either the first end or the second end of the inflatable inner tube. In addition, each of the plurality of air chambers may be selectively pressurized or depressurized so as to change the curvature of the inflatable inner tube.

94.content: The system included larger aerostats called nurse drones that would cruise around dumping large amounts of power into randomly selected pods all over the grid, which would then distribute it to their neighbors. If a pod thought it was having mechanical trouble, it would send out a message, and a fresh pod would fly out from the Royal Security installation beneath Source Victoria and relieve it so that it could fly home to be decompiled.
94.title: Aerostat-based power distribution system
94.abstract: An aerostat-based power distribution system includes an aerostat, a plurality of wind turbines coupled to the aerostat, and at least one generator. The aerostat is configured to move in response to air currents. The plurality of wind turbines are configured to generate electrical energy from the air currents. The at least one generator is configured to convert the electrical energy generated by the plurality of wind turbines into alternating current (AC) electricity.

95.content: “You wish to secure a line of credit,” he said, as if he were pleasantly surprised, which was not terribly likely. “I guess you could say that,” Bud allowed, wishing he'd known to put it in such fine-sounding terminology. The banker reached inside his jacket and withdrew a piece of paper, folded in thirds, from his breast pocket. “You may wish to peruse this brochure,” he said to Bud, and to the brochure itself he rattled off something in an unfamiliar tongue. As Bud took it from the banker's hand, the blank page generated a nice animated color logo and music. The logo developed into a peacock. Beneath it, a video presentation commenced, hosted by a similar-looking gent—sort of Indian looking but sort of Arab too.
95.title: Method and apparatus for securing a line of credit
95.abstract: A method includes receiving, by a computing device from a user via a communication network, a request to establish a line of credit; determining, by the computing device in response to receipt of the request, one or more terms associated with the line of credit; transmitting, by the computing device to the user via the communication network, the one or more terms associated with the line of credit; receiving, by the computing device from the user via the communication network, an acceptance of the one or more terms associated with the line of credit; providing, by the computing device to at least one financial institution via the communication network, access to the line of credit responsive to the acceptance of the one or more terms associated with the line of credit; and monitoring, by the computing device over time, usage of the line of credit. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

96.content: The charge was repeated, somewhat more elaborately. The woman stepped forward and introduced evidence: a cine record that was played on a large mediatron covering the back wall of the stage. It was a film of the suspect, John Percival Hackworth, slicing a bit of skin from his hand and giving it to (the innocent) Dr. X, who (not knowing that he was being gulled into committing a theft) extracted a terabyte of hot data from a cocklebur-shaped mite, and so on, and so on. “The only thing that remains is to prove that this information was, indeed, stolen—though this is strongly implied by the suspect's behavior,” Judge Fang said. In support of this assertion, Constable Chang stepped forward and told the story of his visit to Hackworth's flat. “Mr. Hackworth,” said Judge Fang, “would you like to dispute that this property was stolen? If so, we will hold you here while a copy of the information is supplied to Her Majesty's Police; they can confer with your employer to determine whether you did anything dishonest.
96.title: Method and apparatus for determining guilt or innocence
96.abstract: A method of determining whether an individual is guilty or innocent of committing a crime. The method comprises the steps of (a) collecting data from one or more witnesses to the crime; (b) analyzing the data collected in step (a) using at least one machine-learning algorithm, wherein the analysis includes identifying statements made by the witnesses that are inconsistent with other statements made by the witnesses; (c) comparing the results of the analysis performed in step (b) against predetermined thresholds associated with different levels of guilt or innocence; and (d) assigning a level of guilt or innocence to the individual based on the results of the comparison between the results of the analysis performed in step (b) and the predetermined thresholds as determined in step (c). Related methods and systems are also disclosed.

97.content: Examining the market stalls in more detail, she saw that each one included a man who did nothing but sit at a table and decipher books, writing them out on long sheets of foolscap and handing them over to other people, who would read through the contents, consult rule-books, and dictate responses to the man with the quill pen, who enciphered them and wrote them out in books that were then tossed out into the marketplace for delivery. The men with the quill pens, she noticed, always wore jeweled keys on chains around their necks; the key was apparently the badge of the cipherers' guild.
97.title: Ciphers, cryptography, and code-breaking in the Middle Ages
97.abstract: A cipher is disclosed that can be used to encrypt or decrypt data. The cipher includes an encryption table comprising a plurality of entries wherein each entry corresponds to one of a plurality of alphabetic characters; at least one key value corresponding to at least one character from among the plurality of alphabetic characters; and for each entry in the encryption table, a respective numerical value determined by multiplying the numerical value associated with the key value having the same position as the alphabetical character represented by said entry.

98.content: The facing page had a little picture in the upper left, consisting of more vines and flowers wrapped around a giant egg-shaped letter. But the rest of that page was nothing but tiny black letters without decoration. Nell turned it and found two more pages of letters, though a couple of them were big ones with pictures drawn around them. She turned another page and found another picture. In this one, the little girl had set aside her book and was talking to a big black bird that had apparently gotten its foot tangled up in the vines overhead. She flipped another page.
98.title: Method and apparatus for reading a book to a child
98.abstract: A method of reading a book to a child includes receiving, by a computing device from a parent or caregiver associated with the child, a request to read a book to the child. Responsive to receipt of the request, the computing device identifies one or more words in the book that are likely to be unfamiliar to the child. The computing device also determines an age-appropriate pronunciation of each of the one or more words identified as being likely to be unfamiliar to the child. Based on the determined age-appropriate pronunciations, the computing device generates at least one audio file comprising phonetic representations of the one or more words included in the book. The computing device transmits the at least one audio file to the parent or caregiver's computing device so that the parent or caregiver can use the at least one audio file to teach the child how to pronounce the one

99.content: Toward the end, smoke or steam or something begins to spiral up from the middle of the orgy. The last participant grimaces even more than the average person who's having an orgasm, and yanks himself back from the woman, grabbing his dick and hopping up and down and hollering in what looks like pain. That's the signal for all of the dancers to jump back away from the woman, who is now kind of hard to make out, just a fuzzy motionless package wrapped in steam. Flames erupt from several locations, all over her body, at once, seams of lava splitting open along her veins and the heart itself erupting from her chest like ball lightning. Her body becomes a burning cross spread out on the floor, the bright apex of an inverted cone of turbulent steam and smoke.
99.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for steampunk orgy
99.abstract: Steampunk orgy methods may include receiving an input from a user. The method may also include determining whether the received input satisfies one or more predetermined criteria. In response to determining that the received input satisfies the one or more predetermined criteria, the method may further include causing presentation of at least one augmented reality (AR) object in a vicinity of the user. The AR object may be configured to guide the user toward another user who is interested in participating in a steampunk orgy with the user. Other embodiments are disclosed herein.

100.content: Three-quarters of the Mouse Army evacuated itself through the technique of stripping naked and walking into the ocean en masse, linked arm-in-arm into a flexible and unsinkable raft that gradually, slowly, exhaustingly paddled across the sea to New Chusan. Rumors spread rapidly up and down the length of the coast; the tribal borders seemed to accelerate rather than hinder this process as interfaces between languages and cultures spawned new variants of each rumor, tailored to the local fears and prejudices. The most popular rumor was that the Celestials planned to give everyone safe passage and that the attacks were being carried out by intelligent mines that had run out of control or, at worst, by a few fanatical commanders who were defying orders and who would soon be brought to heel. There was a second, stranger rumor that gave some people an incentive to remain on the shore and not entrust themselves to the evacuation ships: A young woman with a book and a sword was creating magical tunnels from out of the deep that would carry them all away to safety. Such ideas were naturally met with skepticism among more rational cultures, but on the morning of the sixth day of the siege, the neap tide carried a peculiar omen up onto the sand: a harvest of translucent eggs the size of beach balls. When their fragile shells were torn open, they were found to contain sculpted backpacks pierced with a fractal pattern of delicate louvers. A stiff hose extended from the top and connected to a facemask. Under the circumstances, it was not difficult to divine the use of these objects. People strapped the packs onto their backs, slipped on the facemasks, and plunged into the water. The backpacks acted like the gills of a fish and provided a steady supply of oxygen.
100.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for evacuating New Chusan
100.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle (AV) is provided. The method includes determining that the AV is to be relocated from a first location to a second location in response to one or more hazards at the first location. The method also includes identifying a route between the first location and the second location. The method additionally includes causing the AV to travel along the identified route such that the AV arrives at the second location prior to arrival of any other AVs at the second location.

101.content: It sounds ingenious, Hackworth had said, startled by Finkle-McGraw's offhanded naughtiness. But what is that ingredient? I don't exactly know, Finkle-McGraw had said, but as a starting-point, I would like you to go home and ponder the meaning of the word subversive. Hackworth didn't have to ponder it for long, perhaps because he'd been toying with these ideas so long himself. The seed of this idea had been germinating in his mind for some months now but had not bloomed, for the same reason that none of Hackworth's ideas had ever developed into companies. He lacked an ingredient somewhere, and as he now realized, that ingredient was subversiveness. Lord Alexander Chung-Sik Finkle-McGraw, the embodiment of the Victorian establishment, was a subversive.
101.title: Systems and methods for using subversives to improve the quality of life of human beings
101.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for improving the quality of life of human beings. In one implementation, a system includes a plurality of subversive robots that are programmed to interact with each other in order to achieve an overall goal. Each subversive robot is capable of communicating with at least one other subversive robot via a wireless communication network. A first subversive robot may communicate with a second subversive robot when the first subversive robot encounters the second subversive robot while traveling along a pre-determined path. The first subversive robot may then instruct the second subversive robot to change its own pre-determined path so that the two subversive robots can work together to achieve the overall goal. Other implementations are also disclosed herein.

102.content: The practice of infanticide is at an all-time high.” “Your next goal in life,” Judge Fang said, “will be to prove all of this to my satisfaction.” The door opened. One of Judge Fang's constables entered the room and bowed deeply to apologize for the interruption, then stepped forward and handed the magistrate a scroll. The Judge examined the seal; it bore the chop of Dr. X. He carried it to his office and unrolled it on his desk. It was the real thing, written on rice paper in real ink, not the mediatronic stuff. It occurred to the Judge, before he even read this document, that he could take it to an art dealer on Nanjing Road and sell it for a year's wages. Dr. X, assuming it was really he who had brushed these characters, was the most impressive living calligrapher whose work Judge Fang had ever seen. His hand betrayed a rigorous Confucian grounding—many decades more study than Judge Fang could ever aspire to—but upon this foundation the Doctor had developed a distinctive style, highly expressive without being sloppy. It was the hand of an elder who understood the importance of gravity above all else, and who, having first established his dignity, conveyed most of his message through nuances. Beyond that, the structure of the inscription was exactly right, a perfect balance of large characters and small, hung on the page just so, as if inviting analysis by legions of future graduate students. Judge Fang knew that Dr. X controlled legions of criminals ranging from spankable delinquents up to international crime lords; that half of the Coastal Republic officials in Shanghai were in his pocket; that within the limited boundaries of the Celestial Kingdom, he was a figure of considerable importance, probably a blue-button Mandarin of the third or fourth rank; that his business connections ran to most of the continents and phyles of the wide world and that he had accumulated tremendous wealth. All of these things paled in comparison with the demonstration of power represented by this scroll.
102.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and preventing infanticide
102.abstract: A method of detecting and preventing infanticide is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (a) determining an infant's heart rate; (b) comparing the determined heart rate with one or more predetermined thresholds, wherein each threshold corresponds to at least one physiological condition associated with fetal viability; and (c) in response to step (b), providing information indicative of whether the infant is likely to be alive or dead. An apparatus for carrying out the method is also disclosed.

103.content: Her remains tumble into the center, powdery ash flies, flecks of red-hot coals spark. The skeleton men carry the remains over to a fifty-five-gallon steel drum and dump it in. There is a burst of steam and lots of sizzling noises as the hot coals contact some kind of liquid that was in the drum. One of the skeleton men picks up a long spoon and gives the mix a stir, then dips a cracked and spalled University of Michigan coffee mug into it and takes a long drink.
103.title: Apparatus and method for disposing of human remains
103.abstract: An apparatus for disposing of human remains is disclosed.

104.content: After her death, he moved to Minneapolis and took a job with a company founded by one of his former professors, making scanning tunneling microscopes, which at that time were newish devices capable of seeing and manipulating individual atoms. The field was an obscure one then, the clients tended to be large research institutions, and practical applications seemed far away. But it was perfect for a man who wanted to study nanotechnology, and McGraw began doing so, working late at night on his own time. Given his diligence, his self-confidence, his intelligence (“adaptable, relentless, but not really brilliant”), and the basic grasp of business he'd picked up on the farm, it was inevitable that he would become one of the few hundred pioneers of nanotechnological revolution; that his own company, which he founded five years after he moved to Minneapolis, would survive
104.title: Apparatuses, systems, methods, and computer-readable mediums for nanotechnology are disclosed herein. In one aspect, an apparatus for nanotechnology is disclosed. The apparatus includes a substrate
104.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include various electronic devices that may be configured to perform operations described herein. In an example, an electronic device comprises a housing, at least one input/output (I/O) component positioned within the housing, wherein the at least one I/O component comprises at least one light emitting diode (LED), and circuitry communicatively coupled to the at least one I/O component. The circuitry is configured to cause the at least one I/O component to illuminate in response to detecting a user gesture directed toward the at least one I/O component.

105.content: Within a week she was teaching this girl how to read. They'd work on letters for a while and then wander off into more stories about Princess Nell, stop in the middle for a quick practical demonstration of basic math, return to the story, and then get sidetracked with an endless chain of “why this?” and “why that?” Miranda had spent a lot of time with kiddie ractives, both as a child and as a governess, and the superiority of this thing was palpable—like hefting an antique silver fork when you'd been eating with plastic utensils for twenty years, or slithering into a tailor-made evening gown when you were used to jeans. These and other associations came into Miranda's mind on any of the rare moments when she came into contact with something of Quality, and if she didn't make a conscious effort to stop the process, she would end up remembering just about everything that had happened to her during the first years of her life—the Mercedes taking her to private school, the crystal chandelier that would ring like fairy bells when she climbed up on the huge mahogany dinner table to tickle it, her paneled bedroom with the four-poster bed with the silk-and-goosedown duvet . For reasons still unspecified, Mother had moved them far away from all of that, into what passed for poverty these days. Miranda only remembered that, when she had been physically close to Father, Mother had watched them with more vigilance than seemed warranted.
105.title: Apparatuses, systems, methods, and computer-readable mediums for providing a princess and the ractive. A princess and the ractive apparatus includes a princess module and a ractive module. The
105.abstract: princess module is configured to receive input from a user regarding an attribute of the princess; and the ractive module is configured to receive input from the user regarding an attribute of the ractive. In some embodiments, the princess module may be further configured to determine that the attributes of the princess and the ractive satisfy one or more predetermined compatibility criteria; and in response to determining that the attributes of the princess and the ractive satisfy the one or more predetermined compatibility criteria, cause generation of at least one output indicating satisfaction of the one or more predetermined compatibility criteria by the attributes of the princess and the ractive satisfying the one or more predetermined compatibility criteria.

106.content: Fred Epidermis was exclaiming, watching her on a second monitor outside the stage. “It's a Jodie,” she said, but she stumbled over the words as the field of stars moved, tracking the displacements of her jaw and lips. Outside, Fred Epidermis was wielding the editing controls, zooming in on her face, which was dense as a galactic core. By comparison, her arms and legs were wispy nebulas and the back of her head nearly invisible, with a grand total of maybe a hundred 'sites placed around her scalp like the vertices of a geodesic dome. The eyes were empty holes, except (she imagined) when she closed her eyes. Just to check it out, she winked into the mediatron. The 'sites on her eyelids were dense as grass blades on a putting green, but accordioned together except when the lid expanded over the eye. Fred Epidermis recognized the move and zoomed in so violently on her winking eye that she nearly threw herself back on her ass.
106.title: Method and apparatus for generating an image of a person's epidermis
106.abstract: A method is disclosed for generating an image of a person's epidermis, the method comprising obtaining (S10) one or more images of at least a portion of the person's epidermis. The method further comprises determining (S20), from the one or more images obtained in step S10, information relating to features of the person's epidermis; storing (S30) the information determined in step S20 as metadata associated with each of the one or more images obtained in step S10; and displaying (S40) the one or more images obtained in step S10 together with the metadata associated with each of the one or more images obtained in step S10.

107.content: It reminded him of pouring a jet of heavy cream into coffee, watching it rebound from the bottom of the cup in a turbulent fractal bloom that solidified just as it dashed against the surface. The speed of this process was a carefully planned sleight-of-hand; the smart coral had actually been growing down on the bottom of the ocean for the last three months, drawing its energy from a supercon that they'd grown across the seafloor for the occasion, extracting the necessary atoms directly from the seawater and the gases dissolved therein. The process happening below looked chaotic, and in a way it was; but each lithocule knew exactly where it was supposed to go and what it was supposed to do. They were tetrahedral building blocks of calcium and carbon, the size of poppyseeds, each equipped with a power source, a brain, and a navigational system. They rose from the bottom of the sea at a signal given by Princess Charlotte; she had awakened to find a small present under her pillow, unwrapped it to find a golden whistle on a chain, stood out on her balcony, and blown the whistle. The coral was converging on the site of the island from all directions, some of the lithocules traveling several kilometers to reach their assigned positions. They displaced a volume of water equal to the island itself, several cubic kilometers in all. The result was furious turbulence, an up-swelling in the surface of the ocean that made some of the children scream, thinking it might rise up and snatch the airship out of the sky; and indeed a few drops pelted the ship's diamond belly, prompting the pilot to give her a little more altitude.
107.title: Apparatus and method for growing coral
107.abstract: An apparatus for growing coral includes a base, a plurality of support members extending upwardly from the base, wherein at least one of the plurality of support members is movable relative to another of the plurality of support members. The apparatus may further include an actuator coupled to at least one of the plurality of support members such that rotation of the actuator causes movement of the at least one of the plurality of support members with respect to another of the plurality of support members.

108.content: They headed toward the main street of Lazy Bay Towne, which was the Leased Territory into which the pod had ejected them. The main street curved along the waterfront, separating a beach from a very large number of drinking establishments fronted with lurid, bawdy mediatrons.
108.title: Lazy bay towne
108.abstract: A lazy bay towne is disclosed. The lazy bay towne includes a base, a plurality of posts extending upwardly from the base, and a plurality of deck boards positioned between adjacent ones of the plurality of posts. At least some of the plurality of deck boards are removably coupled to at least one of the plurality of posts.

109.content: Castle Turing had been a fair sample of King Coyote's domain: a place with few human beings, albeit filled with fascinating places and situations. She made her lonesome way across the domain of King Coyote, visiting one castle after another, and encountering a different conundrum in each one. The second castle (after Castle Turing) was built on the slope of a mountain and had an elaborate irrigation system in which water from a bubbling spring was routed through a system of gates. There were many thousands of these gates, and they were connected to each other in small groups, so that one gate's opening or closing would, in some way, affect that of the others in its group. This castle grew its own food and was suffering a terrible famine because the arrangement of gates had in some way become fubared. A dark, mysterious knight had come to visit the place and apparently sneaked out of his bedroom in the middle of the night and fiddled with connections between some gates in such a way that water no longer flowed to the fields. Then he had disappeared, leaving behind a note stating that he would fix the problem in exchange for a large ransom in gold and jewels. Princess Nell spent some time studying the problem and eventually noticed that the system of gates was actually a very sophisticated version of one of the Duke of Turing's machines. Once she understood that the behavior of the water-gates was orderly and predictable, it was not long before she was able to program their behavior and locate the bugs that the dark knight had introduced into the system. Soon water was flowing through the irrigation system again, and the famine was relieved.
109.title: Systems and methods for detecting and mitigating conundrums in the domain of king coyote
109.abstract: Implementations include systems, devices, and methods for identifying an occurrence of one or more predator-prey interactions. An example method includes obtaining sensor data associated with at least one prey animal; determining whether the sensor data indicates that the at least one prey animal has been killed by a predator; responsive to determining that the sensor data indicates that the at least one prey animal has been killed by the predator, transmitting location information associated with the at least one prey animal immediately prior to the at least one prey animal being killed by the predator; receiving additional sensor data subsequent to transmission of the location information; analyzing the additional sensor data to determine whether the additional sensor data is indicative of consumption of the at least one prey animal by the predator; and responsive to determining that the additional sensor data is indicative of consumption of the at least one prey animal by the predator, transmitting identification information associated with

110.content: Their accents marked them as belonging to an ethnic subgroup, common in the Southeast, that lived almost entirely on the water; but even if they had not spoken, Judge Fang would have inferred this from their nimble handling of the boat. Within a few minutes, Dr. X and Judge Fang had been conveyed aboard the giant vessel through a hatch set into the hull near the waterline. Judge Fang noted that this was not an old-fashioned steel vessel; it was made of nanotechnological substances, infinitely lighter and stronger. No matter compiler in the world was large enough to compile a ship, so the shipyards in Hong Kong had compiled the pieces one by one, bonded them together, and slid them down the ways into the sea, much as their pre–Diamond Age predecessors had done. Judge Fang had been expecting that the ship would be some kind of bulk carrier, consisting almost entirely of huge compartments, but the first thing he saw was a long corridor running parallel to the keel, seemingly the length of the entire ship. Young women in white, pink, or occasionally blue dresses and sensible shoes bustled back and forth along this corridor entering into and emerging from its innumerable doors.
110.title: Method and apparatus for compiling a ship
110.abstract: A method of compiling a ship is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication to compile a ship; determining, by the computing device, a plurality of components associated with the ship; generating, by the computing device, a three-dimensional (3D) model of the ship from the plurality of components; storing, by the computing device, the 3D model of the ship in a database; retrieving, by the computing device, the 3D model of the ship from the database; displaying, by the computing device, the 3D model of the ship on a graphical user interface (GUI); and transmitting, by the computing device, the 3D model of the ship to at least one other computing device connected to the computing device via a network. An apparatus for compiling a ship is also disclosed.

111.content: “As we discussed, it sees and hears everything in its vicinity,” Hackworth said. “At the moment, it's looking for a small female. As soon as a little girl picks it up and opens the front cover for the first time, it will imprint that child's face and voice into its memory—” “Bonding with her. Yes, I see.” “And thenceforth it will see all events and persons in relation to that girl, using her as a datum from which to chart a psychological terrain, as it were. Maintenance of that terrain is one of the book's primary processes. Whenever the child uses the book, then, it will perform a sort of dynamic mapping from the database onto her particular terrain.” “You mean the database of folklore.”
111.title: Method and apparatus for creating and maintaining a psychological bond between caregiver and child through the use of an interactive children's book
111.abstract: A method, system and apparatus are disclosed to create and maintain a psychological bond between a caregiver and a child through the use of an interactive children's book.

112.content: He nodded to the other. “Mrs. Hackworth.” Then his eyes returned to his father's face and followed the Equity Lord's gaze downward to the book. “She was rude to the servants, Father, and so we have confiscated the book for the rest of the afternoon. It's the only punishment that seems to sink in—we employ it with some frequency.”
112.title: Apparatus, system, and method for providing an equity lord's daughter
112.abstract: A computer-implemented method of determining whether to provide an equity lord's daughter is provided. The method comprises the steps of (i) obtaining historical data relating to one or more previous transactions in which at least one property was sold; (ii) extracting from the historical data information indicative of how many properties were sold as part of each such transaction during a given time period; (iii) calculating a ratio between the number of properties that were sold as part of each such transaction during the given time period and the total number of properties that were sold during the given time period; (iv) comparing the calculated ratio with a predetermined threshold value; and (v) if the calculated ratio exceeds the predetermined threshold value, indicating that it is desirable to provide the equity lord's daughter. A corresponding apparatus, system, and computer program product are also provided.

113.content: “We cannot come to an agreement as to which of you should be the King of the Reptiles, so each of our nations, Birds, Mammals, and Ants, will put each of you to a trial, and then we will gather again and put it to a vote. If the vote results in a tie, we will eat all four of you and bring the Kingdom of Reptiles to an end.”
113.title: Method and apparatus for determining the identity of a reptile
113.abstract: A method is provided for determining the identity of a reptile. The method includes obtaining an image of at least a portion of the reptile, extracting one or more features from the image, comparing the one or more extracted features with feature data stored in a database to determine whether the reptile belongs to a predetermined group of reptiles, and upon determining that the reptile belongs to the predetermined group of reptiles, outputting information identifying the reptile as belonging to the predetermined group of reptiles.

114.content: “It was all because of moral relativism. You see, in that sort of a climate, you are not allowed to criticise others—after all, if there is no absolute right and wrong, then what grounds is there for criticism?” Finkle-McGraw paused, knowing that he had the full attention of his audience, and began to withdraw a calabash pipe and various related supplies and implements from his pockets. As he continued, he charged the calabash with a blend of leather-brown tobacco so redolent that it made Hackworth's mouth water.
114.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and mitigating moral relativism
114.abstract: An apparatus is disclosed for detecting and mitigating moral relativism, the apparatus comprising at least one processor configured to execute computer executable instructions stored in at least one non-transitory computer readable medium that when executed by the at least one processor causes the at least one processor to perform operations comprising obtaining information associated with an individual; determining whether the individual exhibits characteristics indicative of moral relativism; responsive to determining that the individual exhibits characteristics indicative of moral relativism, providing feedback to the individual indicating that the individual exhibits characteristics indicative of moral relativism. Various other aspects are contemplated.

115.content: “We are tied in to everything here—plugged into the whole universe of information. Really, it's a virtual theatre. Instead of being hardwired, the stage, sets, cast, and script are all soft—they can be reconfigured simply by shifting bits about.” “Oh. So the show—or interlaced set of shows—can be different each night?”
115.title: Systems and methods for generating and presenting personalized entertainment
115.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for generating and presenting personalized entertainment. In one implementation, a method is performed at an electronic device with one or more processors coupled with non-transitory memory. The method comprises receiving user input associated with selection of content from a plurality of pieces of content; determining that the received user input does not satisfy a predetermined threshold level of similarity between the selected piece of content and other pieces of content in the plurality of pieces of content; and responsive to determining that the received user input satisfies the predetermined threshold level of similarity between the selected piece of content and other pieces of content in the plurality of pieces of content, causing presentation of the selected piece of content among the plurality of pieces of content.

116.content: “You can remove the glasses at any time by securing a standing ovation from not less than ninety percent of the audience.” Then the lights and curtain vanished, and Hackworth was left with what he had seen before, namely, a cybernetically enhanced night-vision rendering of the deck of the ship. He tried a few more commands. Most phenomenoscopes had a transparent mode, or at least translucent, that allowed the wearer to view what was really there. But these ones were doggedly opaque and would only show him a mediatronic rendering of the scene. The strolling and chatting theatregoers were represented by preposterously oversimplified wire-frames, a display technology unused these eighty years or so, clearly intended to irritate Hackworth. Each figure had a large placard strapped to its chest: JARED MASON GRIFFIN III, aged 35 (too late to become an interesting character like you!) Nephew of an earl-level Equity Lord (don't you envy him?) Married to that sunken bitch on his right They go on these little escapades to escape their own crippled lives. (why are you here?)
116.title: Method and apparatus for simulating a virtual reality environment in which a participant is able to see through the eyes of a character in the virtual reality environment
116.abstract: A method, computer program product, and computer system for simulating a virtual reality (VR) environment in which a participant is able to see through the eyes of a character in the VR environment. In one embodiment, the method comprises obtaining an image captured by a head-mounted display (HMD), wherein the HMD includes at least one camera that captures images from both eyes of a user wearing the HMD; determining whether the image corresponds to a left eye view or a right eye view; processing the image corresponding to either the left eye view or the right eye view into a three-dimensional (3D) model; and displaying the 3D model as part of the VR environment.

117.content: This teahouse was fully integrated into the worldwide media network, and so the pages automatically jacked themselves in. Under Carl Hollywood's murmured commands they began to fill themselves with columns of animated text and windows bearing images and cine feeds. He took his first sip of tea—always the best one—withdrew his big fountain pen from his pocket, removed the lid, and touched it to the paper. He began to inscribe commands onto the page, in words and drawings. As he finished the words, they were enacted before him, and as he drew the lines between the boxes and circles, links were made and information flowed. At the bottom of the page he wrote the word MIRANDA and drew a circle around it. It was not connected to anything else in the diagram yet. He hoped that before long it would be. Carl Hollywood worked on his papers late into the night, and Mrs. Kwan continued to replenish his teapot and to bring him little sweets and decorated the edge of his table with candles as night fell and the teahouse darkened, for she remembered that he liked to work by candlelight. The Chinese people outside, separated from him by half an inch of crosslinked diamond, watched with their noses making white ellipses against the pane, their faces glowing in the candlelight like ripe peaches hanging in dark lush foliage. The Hackworths in transit, and in London; the East End; a remarkable boatride; Dramatis Personae; a night at the theatre. Smooth, fine-grained arctic clouds undulated slowly like snow drifts into the distance, a thousand miles looking like the width of a front yard, lit but not warmed by a low apricot sun that never quite went down. Fiona lay on her stomach on the top bunk, looking out the window, watching her breath condense on the pane and then evaporate in the parched air.
117.title: Teahouse at the edge of the world or, you can't always get what you want
117.abstract: A teahouse at the edge of the world.

118.content: You are a clever girl, Nell, and good with letters,” the book said. “What is this letter?” and it pointed to the second one.
118.title: Apparatus and method for teaching children to read
118.abstract: A reading apparatus is disclosed. The reading apparatus comprises at least one light emitting diode (LED) configured to emit light in response to an electrical current being applied thereto, wherein each LED of the at least one LED is positioned within a respective cavity defined by a plurality of sidewalls extending from a top surface to a bottom surface of the reading apparatus. A lens is affixed to the top surface of the reading apparatus facing away from the at least one LED such that light emitted from the at least one LED passes through the lens prior to exiting the reading apparatus.

119.content: And then Carl Hollywood knew that Princess Nell was searching for Miranda too. He threw his long coat down on the sand and sloshed out into the Pacific, accompanied by the officer, and remained at a judicious distance, partly to show due respect, and partly because Nell had a sword in her waistband. Her face was inclined over the pages of her book like a focusing lens, and he half expected the pages to curl and smoke under her gaze. She looked up from the book after some time.
119.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining whether a user is a princess or a pirate are disclosed herein. In one embodiment, a method includes receiving, from a user device of a user, a
119.abstract: The present disclosure relates to a pre-5th-Generation (5G) or 5G communication system to be provided for supporting higher data rates beyond 4th-Generation (4G) communication system such as long-term evolution (LTE). The present disclosure can be applied to intelligent services based on the 5G communication system and can be applied to various services beyond the 5G communication system. A terminal receives a physical downlink control channel (PDCCH) from a base station through a first component carrier (CC), obtains information related to scheduling an uplink control channel (Uplink Control Channel; UCCH) from the PDCCH, and transmits the UCCH using a second CC different from the first CC.

120.content: Staying well clear of the high road taken by the messengers from the Cipherers' Market, she made camp under an overhanging rock along a river, sheltered from the chill wet wind and safe from the eyes of the raven sentinels, and lit a tiny fire where she made some tea and porridge. She napped until the middle of the afternoon, then rose, bathed in the bitter water of the stream, and untied the oilcloth packet she had brought with her. It contained one of the costumes worn by the messengers who galloped to and from the Cipherers' Market. It also contained a few books containing enciphered messages—authentic ones dispatched from various stalls in the market addressed to King Coyote's castle. As she made her way through the woods toward the high road, she heard massed hoofbeats rolling by and knew that the first contingent of messengers had just come over the pass after waiting for the storm to pass.
120.title: Cipherers' market
120.abstract: A cipherers' market is disclosed. The cipherers' market comprises a plurality of buyers and a plurality of sellers, wherein at least one seller has an item for sale to at least one buyer via the cipherers' market.

121.content: Nell had managed to detach several yards of chain from the one that she was using to converse with the Duke, and so she was able to feed different messages into the lock and see what result they had. The number on the top changed with every link that went into the machine, and it seemed to determine, in a limited way, what the machine would do next; for example, she had learned that the number happened to be 09, and if the next link in the chain was in the vertical position (which the Duke referred to as a one), the drums would spin around and change the number to 23. But if the next link was, instead, a zero (as the Duke referred to links with horizontal toggles), the number drums would change to 03. But that wasn't all: In this case, the machine would, for some reason, reverse the direction in which the chain was moving through the machine, and also flick the toggle from zero to one. That is, the machine could write on the chain as well as read from it. From idle chitchat with the Duke she learned that the numbers on the drums were referred to as states. At first she did not know which states led to other states, and so she wandered aimlessly from one state to the next, recording the connections on scratch paper. This soon grew to a table listing some thirty-two different states and how the lock would respond to a one or a zero when it was in each of those states.
