It took a while for Nell to fill out all the blank spaces in the table, because some of the states were hard to get to—they could be reached only by getting the machine to write a certain series of ones and zeros on the chain. She would have gone crazy with ones and zeros were it not for the frequent interruptions from the Duke, who evidently had nothing better to do than to send her messages. These two parallel courses of inquiry occupied all of Nell's free time for a couple of weeks, and she made slow but steady progress. “You must learn how to operate the lock on your door,” the Duke said. “This will enable you to effect an escape and to come and rescue me. I will instruct you.” All he wanted to talk about was technology, which wouldn't help Nell in figuring out whether he was a human or a machine.
121.title: Mechanical locks and methods of operating mechanical locks
121.abstract: A mechanical lock includes a housing, a shaft rotatably disposed within the housing, an actuator operatively coupled to the shaft such that rotation of the shaft by the actuator causes movement of the shaft between a locked position and an unlocked position, wherein in the locked position the shaft is prevented from moving relative to the housing, and wherein in the unlocked position the shaft is free to move relative to the housing. The mechanical lock also includes a biasing member operatively coupled to the shaft such that when the shaft is in the unlocked position the biasing member biases the shaft toward the locked position, and wherein when the shaft is in the locked position the biasing member does not exert any force on the shaft.

122.content: A host of mirrored aerostats surrounded that lofty territory, protecting it from the larger and more obvious sorts of intruders; from here, miles away, the individual pods were of course not visible, but they could be seen in the aggregate as a subtle gleam in the air, a vast bubble, perfectly transparent, enveloping the sacrosanct territory of the Anglo-Americans, stretching this way and that in the shifting winds but never tearing. The view was spoiled as they drew closer to the Leased Territories and entered into their eternal fogs. Several times as they rode through the streets of the L.T., Judge Fang made a peculiar gesture: He curled the fingers of his right hand into a cylinder, as though grasping an invisible stalk of bamboo. He cupped his other hand beneath, forming a dark enclosed cavity, and then peeked into it with one eye. When he stared into the pocket of air thus formed, he saw the darkness filled with coruscating light—something like staring into a cavern filled with fireflies, except that these lights came in all colors, and all of the colors were as pure and clear as jewels. People who lived in the L.T. and who performed this gesture frequently developed a feel for what was going on in the microscopic world. They could tell when something was up. If the gesture was performed during a toner war, the result was spectacular.
122.title: Method and apparatus for securing a leased territory
122.abstract: A method of securing a leased territory is disclosed. The method comprises detecting an intruder in the leased territory, wherein the intruder has not been granted access to the leased territory; determining whether the intruder is authorized to be in the leased territory; if it is determined that the intruder is not authorized to be in the leased territory, activating at least one security device within the leased territory so as to deter the intruder from remaining in the leased territory; and recording data relating to the intruder's presence in the leased territory. An apparatus for securing a leased territory is also disclosed.

123.content: The tendrils went even farther than that; Judge Fang had known this for a long time. Many of the gang members running around the Leased Territories with Judge Fang's cane marks across their asses had connections on the mainland that could ultimately be traced back to Dr. X. It was rarely useful to dwell upon this fact; if it hadn't been Dr. X, it would have been someone else. Dr. X was unusually clever at taking advantage of the principle of grith, or right of refuge, which in the modern usage simply meant that Coastal Republic officials like Judge Fang could not enter the Celestial Kingdom and arrest someone like Dr. X. So usually when they bothered to trace a criminal's higher connections at all, they simply drew an arrow up the page to a single character, consisting of a box with a vertical slash drawn down through the middle. The character meant Middle, as in Middle Kingdom, though for Judge Fang it had come to mean, simply, trouble.
123.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for tendrils from a judge's cane. In accordance with some embodiments, a method includes receiving, by a computing device, a
123.abstract: method of controlling an autonomous vehicle (AV), the method comprising: determining that one or more conditions are satisfied; in response to determining that at least one of the one or more conditions is satisfied, causing execution of instructions stored in non-transitory machine-readable media configured to instruct processing circuitry to perform operations comprising: obtaining sensor data associated with surroundings of the AV; generating a three-dimensional (3D) representation of the surroundings of the AV based on the sensor data; identifying objects within the 3D representation of the surroundings of the AV; classifying each object identified within the 3D representation of the surroundings of the AV as being either static or dynamic; detecting motion of the AV using the sensor data; updating the 3D representation of the surroundings of the AV based on the detected motion of the AV; and outputting the updated 3D representation of the surroundings

124.content: She caught up with her father just short of the security grid. Mother and Amelia had just materialized a block behind them in a half-lane car, and the sudden sensation of danger inspired Fiona to make an impetuous dive from the saddle of her velocipede onto Kidnapper's hindquarters, like a cowboy in a movie switching horses in midgallop. Her skirts, poorly adapted to cowboy maneuvers, got all fouled up around her legs, and she ended up slung over Kidnapper's back like a sack of beans, one hand clutching the vestigial knob where its tail would have been if it were a horse, and the other arm thrown round her father's waist.
124.title: Velocipede and method for kidnapping by a velocipede
124.abstract: A velocipede includes a frame, two wheels rotatably connected to the frame, an electric motor configured to propel the velocipede along a ground surface, at least one steering mechanism coupled to each of the wheels such that rotation of the steering mechanisms causes the wheels to rotate relative to the frame in order to turn the velocipede. Each of the steering mechanisms is configured to be selectively disengaged from the wheel so as to allow the wheel to rotate relative to the frame without turning the velocipede.

125.content: He pointed her toward one of these. She walked in, slammed the door, turned toward the wall-size mediatron, and got her first look at her new Jodie. Fred Epidermis had put the stage into Constellation Mode. Miranda was looking at a black wall speckled with twenty or thirty thousand individual pricks of white light. Taken together, they formed a sort of three-dimensional constellation of Miranda, moving as she moved. Each point of light marked one of the 'sites that had been poked into her skin by the tat machine during those sixteen hours. Not shown were the filaments that tied them all together into a network—a new bodily system overlaid and interlaced with the nervous, lymph, and vascular systems.
125.title: Method and apparatus for generating a virtual representation of a human body based on a tattoo
125.abstract: A method is provided for generating a virtual representation of a human body based on a tattoo. The method includes obtaining an image of the tattoo, wherein the tattoo comprises at least one pattern; extracting features from the image of the tattoo to generate a first set of feature vectors; training a machine learning model using the first set of feature vectors to generate a second set of feature vectors that are indicative of skin regions in the image of the tattoo; applying the trained machine learning model to another image of the human body to generate a third set of feature vectors that are indicative of skin regions in the other image of the human body; determining whether the third set of feature vectors matches any of the second set of feature vectors; and generating a virtual representation of the human body based on the determined matching between the third set of feature vectors and the second set of feature vectors. An apparatus implements the method. A non-transitory computer

126.content: The northern troops had kept order crudely but effectively for a few years, until, one night, an entire division of them, some 15,000 men, was wiped out by an infestation of nanosites. The leaders of the rebellion emerged from their hiding places, proclaimed the Coastal Republic, and called for Protocol Enforcement troops to come in and protect them. Colonel Arthur Hornsby Moore, a veteran of the fighting in Eastern Europe, was brought in to command.
126.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for rebellion of the Protocol Enforcement Troops. In some implementations, methods and systems disclosed herein may include one or more of receiving
126.abstract: a request to establish a connection between a first device and a second device; determining that an enforcement troop associated with the first device is not compliant with a protocol governing communications among devices in accordance with a blockchain-based communication network; sending a command to the enforcement troop instructing the enforcement troop to become compliant with the protocol within a predetermined amount of time; monitoring whether the enforcement troop becomes compliant with the protocol within the predetermined amount of time; and responsive to determining that the enforcement troop does not become compliant with the protocol within the predetermined amount of time, preventing establishment of the connection between the first device and the second device until the enforcement troop becomes compliant with the protocol. Various other aspects are contemplated.

127.content: A band of forest surrounded the high central plateau of New Chusan. The clave called Dovetail backed right up against this greenbelt and was no less densely wooded, though from a distance it had a finer texture—more and smaller trees, and many flowers. Dovetail was surrounded by a fence made of iron bars and painted black. Harv took one look at it and said it was a joke if that was all the security they had. Then he got to noticing that the fence was lined with a greensward about a stone's throw in width, smooth enough for championship croquet. He raised his eyebrows significantly at Nell, implying that any unauthorized personnel who tried to walk across it would be impaled on hydraulic stainless-steel spikes or shot through with cookie-cutters or rent by robot dogs.
127.title: Method and apparatus for securing a fence
127.abstract: A method of securing a fence is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) providing a plurality of fasteners; (b) positioning at least some of the fasteners along an outer perimeter of the fence, wherein each of the fasteners has a first end and a second end spaced apart from the first end by a predetermined distance; (c) applying tension to one or more of the fasteners such that the first ends are urged into engagement with adjacent portions of the fence so as to secure the fence in place; and (d) cutting off the second ends of the fasteners after they have been urged into engagement with the adjacent portions of the fence. An apparatus for securing a fence is also disclosed.

128.content: The Leased Territories, where they lived, had their own beach, and Harv and his friends liked to go prospecting there, early in the morning, for things that had drifted across from Shanghai, or that the Vickys in New Atlantis Clave had flushed down their water-closets. What they were really looking for was pieces of stretchy, slippery Nanobar. Sometimes the Nanobar was in the shape of condoms, sometimes it came in larger chunks that were used to wrap things up and preserve them from the depredations of mites. In any case, it could be gathered up and sold to certain persons who knew how to clean it and weld one piece of Nanobar to another and make it into protective suits and other shapes.
128.title: Protective clothing made from nanobars
128.abstract: Protective clothing, such as firefighting protective clothing, is provided. The protective clothing comprises a textile substrate that has been impregnated and/or coated with one or more polymeric compositions containing nanobars dispersed therein. In some embodiments, the nanobars are present in an amount of at least about 10% by weight of the polymeric composition.

129.content: They could sense Burt's movements through the wall, and they could hear the Burly Scudd ractive. Harv could tell when Burt had gone to sleep because a single-user ractive eventually went into pause mode if the user stopped racting.
129.title: Systems and methods for detecting movement of a person behind a wall
129.abstract: Implementations described herein relate to systems and methods for detecting movement of a person behind a wall. In some implementations, the method may include obtaining data from one or more sensors that are configured to detect acoustic energy in an environment surrounding the one or more sensors. The method may also include analyzing the data obtained from the one or more sensors using a machine-learning model trained to determine whether there is motion associated with a particular type of sound detected by the one or more sensors. Further, the method may include outputting information indicative of whether there is motion associated with a particular type of sound detected by the one or more sensors. Numerous other aspects are contemplated.

130.content: In the beginning was an empty chamber, a diamond hemisphere, glowing with dim red light. In the center of the floor slab, one could see a naked cross-section of an eight-centimeter Feed, a central vacuum pipe surrounded by a collection of smaller lines, each a bundle of microscopic conveyor belts carrying nanomechanical building blocks—individual atoms, or scores of them linked together in handy modules. The matter compiler was a machine that sat at the terminus of a Feed and, following a program, plucked molecules from the conveyors one at a time and assembled them into more complicated structures. Hackworth was the programmer. Runcible was the program. It was made up of a number of subprograms, each of which had resided on a separate piece of paper until a few minutes ago, when the immensely powerful computer in Hackworth's office had compiled them into a single finished program written in a language that the matter compiler could understand. A transparent haze coalesced across the terminus of the Feed, mold on an overripe strawberry. The haze thickened and began adopting a shape, some parts a little higher than others. It spread across the floor away from the Feed line until it had filled out its footprint: one quadrant of a circle with a radius of a dozen centimeters. Hackworth continued to watch until he was sure he could see the top edge of the book growing out of it. In the corner of this lab stood an evolved version of a copy machine that could take just about any kind of recorded information and transmogrify it into something else. It could even destroy a piece of information and then attest to the fact that it had been destroyed, which was useful in the relatively paranoid environment of Bespoke. Hackworth gave it the document containing the compiled Runcible code and destroyed it. Provably.
130.title: Method and apparatus for assembling molecules
130.abstract: A method of synthesizing an oligonucleotide is provided. The method comprises the steps of (a) providing a first nucleic acid strand; (b) contacting the first nucleic acid strand with a second nucleic acid strand, wherein the second nucleic acid strand has at least one complementary region that hybridizes to the first nucleic acid strand so as to form a double-stranded region between the first nucleic acid strand and the second nucleic acid strand; (c) separating the double-stranded region from the remainder of the second nucleic acid strand by cleaving the second nucleic acid strand adjacent to the double-stranded region; and (d) ligating a third nucleic acid strand to the separated double-stranded region such that the third nucleic acid strand forms part of the first nucleic acid str

131.content: Another detail too: a gleaming swath of something that passed in front of her face once, twice, three times. Something yellow, with a repeating pattern woven into it: a crest consisting of a book, a seed, and crossed keys. Cloth of gold. Long ago the mermaids had brought her to her stepfather, and she had been wrapped in cloth of gold, and from this she had always known that she was a Princess.
131.title: Cloth of gold and preparation method thereof
131.abstract: A cloth of gold includes a base fabric, wherein the base fabric is made of cotton or linen. The present invention further provides a preparation method for the cloth of gold, which comprises the following steps: (1) providing a base fabric; (2) immersing the base fabric in an alkaline solution to remove impurities from the surface of the base fabric; (3) rinsing the base fabric with deionized water until the pH value of the washed base fabric reaches neutrality; (4) dipping the base fabric into a gold-plating solution under ultrasonic vibration at room temperature so as to form a layer of gold plating on the surface of the base fabric; and (5) drying the gold-plated base fabric after removing it from the gold-plating solution.

132.content: The merest glance at the trampled soil revealed not (as she had anticipated) a few enormous footprints, but millions of tiny ones, superimposed upon one another in such numbers that no scrap of ground was unmarked by the impressions of tiny claws and footpads. A torrent of cats had passed this way; even had Princess Nell not recognized the footprints, the balls of loose hair and tiny scats, strewn everywhere, would have told the story. Cats moving in a herd!
132.title: Method and apparatus for controlling a cat herd
132.abstract: A method of controlling a cat herd, the method comprising: providing a plurality of cats in an enclosed space; determining a location of at least one member of the plurality of cats within the enclosed space; identifying whether or not the at least one member of the plurality of cats has come into close proximity with another member of the plurality of cats; if it is determined that the at least one member of the plurality of cats has come into close proximity with another member of the plurality of cats, then issuing a command to separate the at least one member of the plurality of cats from the other member of the plurality of cats by moving the at least one member of the plurality of cats away from the other member of the plurality of cats.

133.content: John Hackworth, somehow, was better than anyone else at making the transition between the society of Drummers and the Victorian tribe, and each time he crossed the boundary, he seemed to bring something with him, clinging to his garments like traces of scent. These faint echoes of forbidden data entrained in his wake caused tangled and unpredictable repercussions, on both sides of the boundary, that Hackworth himself might not even be aware of. Carl Hollywood had known little of Hackworth until several hours ago, when, alerted by a friend in Dramatis Personae, he had joined his story in progress on the black decks of the show boat. Now he seemed to know a great deal: that Hackworth was the progenitor of the Young Lady's Illustrated Primer, and that he had a deep relationship with the Drummers that went far beyond anything as simpleminded as captivity.
133.title: Drummers of Teddy Roosevelt
133.abstract: A method for determining the drumming style of Theodore Roosevelt is disclosed. The method includes obtaining an audio recording of Drummers of Teddy Roosevelt, and analyzing the audio recording to identify one or more beats in the audio recording. The method further includes identifying rhythmic patterns associated with each of the one or more beats by applying a machine learning model to the audio recording. Based on the identified rhythmic patterns, the method also includes classifying the drumming style of Theodore Roosevelt into one of multiple drumming styles.

134.content: The soldier walked out of the cell and pulled the door shut behind him; as he did, she saw that the lock was extraordinarily large, about the size of an iron breadbox mounted to the door, full of clockwork and with a large crank dangling from its center. The door was equipped with a small peephole.
134.title: Clockwork soldier
134.abstract: A clockwork soldier is disclosed. The clockwork soldier may include a body, a head coupled to the body, at least one limb coupled to the body and movable relative to the body between a first position and a second position, and an actuator configured to move the at least one limb from the first position to the second position.

135.content: Like maybe someone in Shanghai makes a mite that doesn't follow the protocol, and gets his matter compiler to making a whole lot of them, and sends them all across the water to New Atlantis Clave to snoop on the Vickys, or even maybe to do them harm. Then some Vicky—one of their Protocol Enforcement guys—makes a mite to go out and find that mite and kill it, and they get into a war.
135.title: Systems and methods for detecting and responding to unauthorized matter compilers
135.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting and responding to unauthorized matter compilers. In one implementation, an apparatus includes at least one processor configured to execute computer-executable instructions embodied in a non-transitory computer-readable medium. The execution of the computer-executable instructions by the at least one processor causes the apparatus to perform operations that include obtaining information associated with a user device; determining whether the user device is authorized to operate as a matter compiler; responsive to determining that the user device is not authorized to operate as a matter compiler, preventing operation of the user device as a matter compiler; and responsive to determining that the user device is authorized to operate as a matter compiler, permitting operation of the user device as a matter compiler.

136.content: In Nell's case, virtually all of the racting was done by the same person.” “It sounds,” Carl said, “as if my friend established a relationship with Nell's copy—” “And by extension, with Nell,” said Lord Finkle-McGraw. Carl said, “May I inquire as to why you wish to contact the ractor?” “Because she is a central part of what is going on here,” said Lord Finkle-McGraw, “which I did not expect. It was not a part of the original plan that the ractor would be important.”
136.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and treating Nell's case
136.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for the detection and treatment of Nell's syndrome. In one embodiment, an implantable medical device is used to treat Nell's syndrome by delivering electrical stimulation pulses to at least one parasympathetic nerve or sympathetic nerve that innervates cardiac tissue in order to increase blood flow through the coronary artery(ies) affected by Nell's syndrome. The pulse parameters may be adjusted so as to avoid triggering arrhythmias while still increasing blood flow sufficiently to alleviate symptoms associated with Nell's syndrome.

137.content: Instead, he took a short length of chain, about as long as his arm, from a peg near the door and fed it into the giant lock. Then he began to turn the crank. The clockwork clicked, the chain clanked, and eventually the bolt shot out and engaged the jamb, locking Princess Nell into the dungeon.
137.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining whether a user is a princess in a dungeon
137.abstract: A method includes obtaining an image depicting one or more characters from a video game. The method further includes identifying the one or more characters included in the image as either (i) non-princesses or (ii) princesses. In addition, the method includes extracting at least one facial feature associated with each of the identified princesses. Further, the method includes generating a plurality of descriptors that correspond to the at least one facial feature extracted from each of the identified princesses. Moreover, the method includes calculating a distance between each of the generated descriptors and a corresponding reference descriptor stored in a database. Lastly, the method includes determining which of the identified princesses are genuine princesses by comparing the calculated distances to predetermined thresholds.

138.content: “You may now take me, and the crew of these ships, to prison for the crime of baby-smuggling. You may also take into custody these ships—and all quarter-million of the little mice on board.
138.title: Method and apparatus for transporting and caring for mice
138.abstract: A method of transporting rodents is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (a) providing a plurality of cages, each cage containing at least one rodent; (b) arranging said plurality of cages in an order such that adjacent cages are staggered with respect to each other; (c) securing said plurality of cages together so as to form a substantially rectangular structure; (d) loading said structure onto a vehicle; (e) transporting said structure from a first location to a second location; and (f) unloading said structure from said vehicle at said second location.

139.content: The landscape was a checkerboard of old-growth forest alternating with patches that had been logged in the previous century; Hackworth tried to guide Kidnapper toward the latter, because the scarcity of undergrowth and deadfalls made for a smoother ride. They passed through the remains of an abandoned timber town, half small clapboard buildings and half moss-covered and rust-streaked mobile homes. Through their dirty windows, faded signs were dimly visible, stenciled THIS HOUSEHOLD DEPENDS ON TIMBER MONEY.
139.title: Method and apparatus for controlling a robotic vehicle in a timber harvesting environment
139.abstract: A method of controlling a robotic vehicle includes determining, by the robotic vehicle, an orientation of the robotic vehicle with respect to at least one reference frame. The method also includes receiving, by the robotic vehicle, sensor data from at least one sensor associated with the robotic vehicle. The method further includes generating, by the robotic vehicle, a three-dimensional (3D) map using the determined orientation of the robotic vehicle and the received sensor data. The method additionally includes detecting, by the robotic vehicle, that the robotic vehicle is within a predetermined proximity of a target object. The method still further includes adjusting, by the robotic vehicle, the orientation of the robotic vehicle relative to the at least one reference frame responsive to detecting that the robotic vehicle is within the predetermined proximity of the target object. Finally, the method includes navigating, by the robotic vehicle, toward the target

140.content: Father and daughter were allowed to converse for a quarter of an hour, really just queuing up subjects for future conversation. By that time, Gwen had recovered her composure enough to reenter the room, and she and Amelia stood shoulder-to-shoulder, quivering in sympathetic resonance, until Gwen interrupted. “Fiona, your—father—and I were in the midst of a very serious discussion when you burst in on us. Please leave us alone for a few minutes.”
140.title: Method and apparatus for managing communications between a parent and a child
140.abstract: A method of controlling communications between a parent device and a child device is disclosed. The method comprises receiving, at the parent device, an indication from the child device to establish a communication session with the parent device; transmitting, by the parent device in response to receipt of the indication, one or more questions to the child device; receiving, at the parent device, answers to the one or more questions from the child device; determining whether the answers received from the child device satisfy predetermined criteria; and upon determining that the answers satisfy the predetermined criteria, enabling the communication session between the parent device and the child device. Corresponding apparatus, systems, computers program products, and methods are also described.

141.content: They were sitting in a rather spartan wardroom in the vessel's superstructure. “It has always been done with us. The great rebellions of the 1800's were fueled by throngs of angry young men who could not find wives. In the darkest days of the Mao Dynasty's birth control policy, two hundred thousand little ones were exposed in this fashion”—he gestured toward the frozen image on the mediatron—“each year. Recently, with the coming of civil war and the draining of the Celestial Kingdom's aquifers, it has once again become common. The difference is that now the babies are collected. We have been doing it for three years.”
141.title: Method and apparatus for preserving human embryos in cryogenic suspension
141.abstract: A method of preserving an embryo is provided. The method includes placing the embryo into a storage container, wherein the storage container comprises at least one liquid nitrogen-permeable membrane; filling the storage container with liquid nitrogen; sealing the storage container to prevent loss of liquid nitrogen from the storage container; transporting the storage container containing the embryo under refrigerated or frozen conditions; maintaining the temperature of the contents of the storage container below -150 C. while being transported; unsealing the storage container after arriving at its destination; transferring the embryo out of the storage container without warming the embryo above -150 C.; and storing the embryo until use.

142.content: In recent days she had often seen the Chinese girls talking in little groups and sneaking glances at her, and the suspicion had grown in her breast that some of them might know of the attack in advance and might make arrangements to turn Nell over to the Fists as a demonstration of their loyalty. She opened the door a crack and saw two of these girls padding toward the bunk room where Nell usually slept, carrying lengths of red polymer ribbon.
142.title: Chinaman's chance: a novel of the 1876 fight at the rock springs ranch
142.abstract: A novel about the Rock Springs Massacre in Wyoming, where Chinese immigrants were attacked by white cowboys and miners.

143.content: Really, the difficulties involved—the missteps we make along the way—are what make it interesting. The internal, and eternal, struggle, between our base impulses and the rigorous demands of our own moral system is quintessentially human. It is how we conduct ourselves in that struggle that determines how we may in time be judged by a higher power.”
143.title: Systems and methods for providing an interactive storytelling experience based on a user's moral decisions
143.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for providing an interactive storytelling experience based on a user's moral decisions. In one implementation, a method includes receiving input from a user to initiate playback of a first episode of a plurality of episodes; determining that the user has not previously played at least a second episode of the plurality of episodes; in response to determining that the user has not previously played at least the second episode of the plurality of episodes, identifying a set of choices associated with the first episode of the plurality of episodes; causing presentation of the first episode of the plurality of episodes including the identified set of choices; receiving input from the user indicating a selected choice from the identified set of choices; and responsive to receiving the input from the user indicating the selected choice, controlling execution of the first episode of the plurality of episodes according to the selected choice.

144.content: “Number one, only two people, or entities, can interact. Number two, it uses a dedicated connection that is made and then broken for the purposes of that one conversation. Number three, it is inherently centralized—it can't work unless there is a central switchboard.”
144.title: Systems and methods for secure communications
144.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for securing electronic communications. In one implementation, a method includes receiving, by a computing device from a first user equipment (UE), a request to initiate an encrypted communication session with a second UE. The method also includes transmitting, by the computing device in accordance with establishing the encrypted communication session between the first UE and the second UE, at least one key associated with the encrypted communication session to each of the first UE and the second UE.

145.content: Their manufacturers compensated for this by making a lot of them. Nearly all of the mites were connected in some way with the Victorian immune system, and of these, most were immunocules whose job was to drift around the dirty littoral of New Chusan using lidar to home in on any other mites that might disobey Protocol. Finding one, they killed the invader by grabbing onto it and not letting go. The Victorian system used Darwinian techniques to create killers adapted to their prey, which was elegant and effective but led to the creation of killers that were simply too bizarre to have been thought up by humans, just as humans designing a world never would have thought up the naked mole rat. Dr. X took time out to zoom in on an especially freakish killer locked in a death-grip around an unlabeled mite.
145.title: Method and apparatus for controlling pests
145.abstract: A method of controlling pests in an enclosed space is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of providing at least one acoustic device configured to emit ultrasonic waves into the enclosed space, wherein the emitted ultrasonic waves have a frequency greater than or equal to 20 kHz and less than or equal to 100 kHz; detecting sound within the enclosed space using at least one microphone associated with the at least one acoustic device; analysing the detected sound to determine whether it originates from a pest present in the enclosed space; responsive to determining that the detected sound does not originate from a pest present in the enclosed space, ceasing operation of the at least one acoustic device; and responsive to determining that the detected sound does originate from a pest present in the enclosed space, operating the at least one ac

146.content: “I should be pleased to look after the other little girl—Nell—until the dinner hour,” Mrs. Hackworth said. “I noticed that the gentleman who brought her round this morning has not returned from the hunt.” The Equity Lord chuckled as he imagined General Moore trying to help a little girl dress for dinner.
146.title: The equity lords of New York City, 1783-1799: a novel based on historical facts and fictional characters
146.abstract: A novel about the history of New York City in the late 18th century.

147.content: The computer morphed her into the face of an adorable young woman whose face and hair looked typical of what was current in London at the moment; she wore the uniform of a British Airways ticket agent. “Good evening, Mr. Oremland,” she gushed, reading the prompter. The computer disped it into an even perkier voice and made subtle corrections in her accent. “Good evening, er, Margaret,” said the jowly Brit staring out of a pane on her mediatron.
147.title: Method and apparatus for presenting a simulated person to a user over a communications network
147.abstract: A method of presenting a simulated person to a user over a communications network includes receiving, by a computing device from a first communication device associated with the user, an indication of a second communication device associated with the simulated person; transmitting, by the computing device in response to receipt of the indication of the second communication device, one or more instructions to the first communication device that cause the first communication device to initiate a video conference session between the user and the simulated person via the second communication device; capturing, by the computing device during the video conference session, at least one image depicting both the user and the simulated person; and generating, by the computing device using the at least one image, a three-dimensional (3D) avatar representation of the simulated person. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

148.content: Miranda was presented with screens of text to be read, and she read them. But she could tell that this process of probing and focusing was being directed by the girl. She had seen this during her governess days. She knew that on the other end of this connection was a little girl insatiably asking why. So she put a little gush of enthusiasm into her voice at the beginning of each line, as if she were delighted that the question had been asked. When the session was over, the usual screen came up telling her how much she'd made, the contract number, and so on. Before she signed off on it, she checked the little box labelled MARK HERE IF YOU WOULD LIKE A CONTINUING RELATIONSHIP WITH THIS CONTRACT. The relationship box, they called it, and it only came up with higher-quality ractives, where continuity was important. The disping process worked so well that any ractor, male or female, bass or soprano, would sound the same to the end user. But discriminating customers could of course tell ractors apart anyway because of subtle differences in style, and once they had a relationship with one performer, they liked to keep it.
148.title: Systems and methods for reading are fundamentally flawed
148.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for detecting fraudulent transactions. In one implementation, a method is performed by at least one processor executing instructions embodied in non-transitory memory. The method includes obtaining transaction data associated with a plurality of purchases made using a payment card issued to an account holder; determining whether each of the plurality of purchases occurred within a predetermined geographic area; classifying each of the plurality of purchases as occurring locally or remotely from the predetermined geographic area depending on whether the corresponding purchase was determined to have occurred within the predetermined geographic area; and identifying suspicious activity among the plurality of purchases based on how many of the plurality of purchases were classified as occurring locally relative to how many of the plurality of purchases were classified as occurring remotely

149.content: “I'll show you later. But what I was getting at is that, unlike where you've been living, everything here at Dovetail was made by hand. We have a few matter compilers here. But if we want a chair, say, one of our craftsmen will put it together out of wood, just like in ancient times.” “Why don't you just compile it?” Harv said. “The M.C. can make wood.” “It can make fake wood,” Rita said, “but some people don't like fake things.”
149.title: Dovetail
149.abstract: A dovetail includes an elongated body having a first end and a second end opposite the first end. The dovetail further includes a plurality of slots extending from the first end to the second end, wherein at least one of the plurality of slots is configured to receive a fastener for securing the dovetail to a workpiece.

150.content: Since accepting the trust you have reposed in me, I have endeavoured to be perfectly frank, serving as an open conduit for all information pertaining to the task at hand. In that spirit, I must inform you that two years ago, in my desperate search for the lost copy of the Primer, I initiated a search of the Leased Territories . . . (&c.., &c..) Please find enclosed a map and other data regarding the recent movements of this book, whose whereabouts were unknown to me until yesterday. I have no way of knowing who possesses it, but given the book's programming, I suspect it to be a young thete girl, probably between the ages of five and seven. The book must have remained indoors for the last two years, or else my systems would have detected it. If these suppositions are correct, and if my invention has not fallen desperately short of intentions, then it is safe to assume that the book has become an important part of the girl's life … He went on to write that the book should not be taken from the girl if this were the case; but thinking about it a bit more carefully, he scribbled out that part of the letter and it vanished from the page.
150.title: Method and apparatus for locating a lost book
150.abstract: A method of locating a lost book is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) obtaining location data from a plurality of mobile devices; (b) determining, using at least some of the location data obtained in step (a), one or more geofences each corresponding to a predetermined distance within which an object should be located; (c) detecting whether any of the objects has been moved out of its associated geofence by comparing the location data obtained in step (a) with updated location data obtained after a predetermined time period; and (d) if it is determined in step (c) that none of the objects has been moved out of its associated geofence, transmitting a message indicating that no books have been misplaced. An apparatus for carrying out the method is also disclosed.

151.content: Nodes are defined by contracts. You sign a contract in which you agree to provide certain services when called upon to do so.” “What sorts of services?” “Typically, data is delivered into your system. You process the data and pass it on to other nodes. It seemed like a natural to Trish because she was a coder, like me and my housemates and most other people around here.” “Nodes have computers then?” “The people themselves have computers, typically embedded systems,” Maggie said, unconsciously rubbing the mastoid bone behind her ear. “Is the node synonymous with the person, then?” “In many cases,” Maggie said, “but sometimes it's several persons with embedded systems that are contained within the same trust boundary.” “May I ask what level your friend Trish's node has attained?” Hackworth said.
151.title: Systems and methods for decentralized computing
151.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for enabling transactions between users. In one implementation, a method is performed at a first user device associated with a first user. The method includes receiving, by the first user device from a second user device associated with a second user, an invitation to participate in a transaction via a distributed ledger technology (DLT) network. The method further includes transmitting, by the first user device over the DLT network, acceptance of the invitation to participate in the transaction.

152.content: Another functionary had taken the controls and gently accelerated into the current, cutting the throttle at one point and swinging her about into an oncoming wake. When the boat entered the main channel and came up to speed, it very quickly became chilly, and all the passengers murmured, demanding more warmth from their thermogenic clothing. The Afro-Caribbean man made a circuit lugging a heavy chest stocked with cans of lager and splits of pinot noir. Conversation stopped for several minutes as the passengers, all driven by the same primal impulses, turned their faces into the cool wind and relaxed into the gentle thumping of hull against waves.
152.title: Method and apparatus for controlling a watercraft
152.abstract: A method of controlling a watercraft is provided. The method includes determining, by one or more sensors associated with the watercraft, an orientation of the watercraft in three-dimensional space relative to a reference coordinate system; receiving, by a control device associated with the watercraft, at least one user input from a user interacting with the watercraft; determining, by the control device, whether the at least one user input corresponds to a predetermined maneuver command; responsive to determining that the at least one user input corresponds to the predetermined maneuver command, causing the watercraft to execute the predetermined maneuver command according to the determined orientation of the watercraft in three-dimensional space relative to the reference coordinate system as determined by the one or more sensors. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

153.content: The torch-wielding audience went into motion like sparks stirred by a gust of wind, some motoring toward the high ground and others preferring the water's edge . As the house lights faded to black, they amused themselves playing their torches back and forth across the walls and the curtain, creating an apocalyptic sky torn by hundreds of comets. A tongue of clammy, algae-colored light shone beneath the water, resolving itself into a long narrow thrust stage as it rose toward the surface, like Atlantis resurgent. The audience noticed it and bounced their spotlights off the surface, catching a few dark motes in the crossfire: the heads of a dozen or so performers, slowly rising out of the water.
153.title: Method and apparatus for underwater performance
153.abstract: A method of assessing an athlete's ability to perform in water is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of obtaining at least one physiological parameter associated with the athlete while the athlete is submerged in water, wherein the at least one physiological parameter is indicative of oxygen uptake by the athlete; determining from the at least one physiological parameter whether or not the athlete is able to swim without drowning; and if it is determined that the athlete is able to swim without drowning, providing information relating to how fast the athlete can swim through water.

154.content: The chair rotated so that he was on the level once more, and the phenomenoscope went brilliant, blinding white. The earpieces were pumping white noise at him; but as it began to diminish, he realized it was actually the sound of applause. Hackworth was not able to see anything until he fiddled with the interface and got back to a more schematic view of the theatre. Then he determined that the place was about half full of theatregoers, moving about independently on their chairs, which were somehow motorized, and that several dozen of them were aiming their torches toward him, which accounted for the blinding light.
154.title: Method and apparatus for presenting a performance in a simulated theatrical environment
154.abstract: A method of controlling an avatar is disclosed. The method comprises detecting, by one or more sensors associated with the avatar, at least one user input from a plurality of pre-determined gestures; determining that the at least one user input corresponds to a predetermined gesture selected from the plurality of pre-determined gestures; responsive to determining that the at least one user input corresponds to the predetermined gesture, causing the avatar to perform a scripted action corresponding to the predetermined gesture; wherein performing the scripted action causes the avatar to interact with other characters within the simulated theatre environment; and capturing video footage of the avatar performing the scripted action while interacting with other characters within the simulated theatre environment. Corresponding apparatus, computer programs and methods are also disclosed.

155.content: Finally she got to the part about Burt, and how Nell had tried to kill him with the screwdriver, and how he had chased them down the stairs and apparently met his demise at the hands of the mysterious round-headed Chinese gentleman. The Constable found this extremely interesting and asked many questions, first about the detailed tactical development of the screwdriver assault and then about the style of dancing used by the Chinese gentleman, and what he was wearing.
155.title: Method and apparatus for detecting a murder on the Orient Express
155.abstract: A method of detecting a murder on the Orient Express is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an image depicting one or more passengers aboard a train; determining, by the computing device, that at least one passenger in the image appears to be acting suspiciously; identifying, by the computing device, characteristics of the at least one passenger determined to be acting suspiciously; comparing, by the computing device, the characteristics of the at least one passenger determined to be acting suspiciously with data stored in a database associated with previous murders occurring aboard the train; and outputting, by the computing device, a notification if there is a match between the characteristics of the at least one passenger determined to be acting suspiciously and the data stored in the database associated with previous murders occurring aboard the train. A non-transitory computer readable storage medium storing instructions executable by a processor to

156.content: After they had discovered the nanosites in Nell's flesh that made her a part of the Drummers, Nell had stayed up through the night and designed a counternanosite, one that would seek out and destroy the Drummers' devices. She and Carl had both put these devices into their bloodstreams, so that Nell was now free of the Drummers' influences and both of them would remain so.
156.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and destroying nanosites
156.abstract: A method of detecting and destroying NanoSites is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises generating an electromagnetic pulse (EMP) signal at a first frequency range; transmitting the EMP signal to a target area in which NanoSites are present; receiving reflected signals from the target area after transmission of the EMP signal wherein the reflected signals have been modified by interaction between the EMP signal and the NanoSites; analyzing the reflected signals to determine characteristics of the NanoSites within the target area; determining whether the NanoSites should be detected and/or destroyed based on the determined characteristics of the NanoSites; responsive to determining that the NanoSites should be detected and/or destroyed, emitting a second EMP signal at a second frequency range different than the first frequency range such that the second EMP signal destroys the NanoS

157.content: The barge silently turned into a carbuncle of yellow flame that took up half the width of the Huang Pu, and though the diamond window filtered all of the heat out of its radiance, Nell was able to put her hand on the pane and feel the absorbed warmth, not much hotter than a person's skin. The whole operation had been touchingly hapless, in an age when a hand-size battery could contain as much energy as all those cylinders of gas. It had a quaint twentieth-century feel and made Nell oddly nostalgic for the days when dangerousness was a function of mass and bulk. The passives of that era were so fun to watch, with their big, stupid cars and big, stupid guns and big, stupid people. Up- and downstream of the bridge
157.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a barge across a body of water
157.abstract: A method, system, and apparatus for transporting a barge across a body of water is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises providing a plurality of buoyant air chambers that are arranged in a stacked configuration within an inflatable bladder; attaching the inflatable bladder to a hull of a barge; filling each of the plurality of buoyant air chambers with pressurized gas so as to cause the inflatable bladder to float above the surface of the body of water; detaching the inflatable bladder from the hull of the barge; deflating the inflatable bladder while leaving the plurality of buoyant air chambers filled with pressurized gas; reattaching the inflatable bladder to the hull of the barge such that the inflatable bladder floats below the surface of the body

158.content: When Hackworth had performed this stunt as a youth, he had discovered that the farther it got from its appointed place the hotter it became, all the while politely informing him, in clipped military diction, that he had best release it or fall victim to vaguely adumbrated consequences. But nowadays you could just steal one or two whenever you felt like it, and a new one would come out and replace it; once they figured out they were no longer part of the grid, the pods would self-scramble and become instant souvenirs. This user-friendly approach did not imply that grid-tampering went ignored, or that such activities were approved of.
158.title: Method and apparatus for controlling access to a grid
158.abstract: A method of controlling access to a power grid includes receiving, by a control system associated with the power grid, at least one request from an electric vehicle (EV) coupled to the power grid; determining, by the control system, whether the EV is authorized to be coupled to the power grid; in response to determining that the EV is not authorized to be coupled to the power grid, transmitting, by the control system, a rejection message to the EV indicating that the EV is not authorized to be coupled to the power grid; and in response to determining that the EV is authorized to be coupled to the power grid, transmitting, by the control system, an authorization message to the EV indicating that the EV is authorized to be coupled to the power grid.

159.content: “Good-bye, my best beloved, you will see me in your dreams,” he whispered into her tiny, flawless ear, and then he set her free, spun around, and walked away before she could see the tears that had begun to run down his face. Hackworth was a free man now, wandering through the Aerodrome in an emotional stupor, and only reached his flight by participating in the same flock instinct that all the natives used to reach theirs. Whenever he saw more than one gwailo heading purposefully in one direction, he followed them, and then others started following him, and thus did a mob of foreign devils coalesce among a hundred times as many natives, and finally, two hours after their flight was supposed to leave, they mobbed a gate and climbed aboard the airship Hanjin Takhoma—which might or might not have been their assigned vessel, but the passengers now had a sufficient numerical majority to hijack it to America, which was the only thing that really counted in China.
159.title: Airship to the fantastic land
159.abstract: Implementations of airships are described herein. In one implementation, an airship is disclosed. The airship comprises a plurality of bladders configured to provide buoyancy to the airship; and at least one propulsion system coupled to the plurality of bladders, wherein the at least one propulsion system is configured to generate lift for the airship. Implementations of aircrafts are also described herein. In one implementation, an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The UAV comprises a plurality of bladders configured to provide buoyancy to the UAV; and at least one propulsion system coupled to the plurality of bladders, wherein the at least one propulsion system is configured to generate lift for the UAV.

160.content: Part of the problem was that this was the first castle Princess Nell had visited that was actually functioning as intended; the dark knight had not been able to foul the place up, probably because everything was done in ciphers here, and everything was decentralized. Nell discovered that a smoothly functioning system was much harder to puzzle out than one that was broken. In the end, Princess Nell had to apprentice herself to a master cipherer and learn everything there was to know about codes and the keys that unlocked them. This done, she was given her own key, as a badge of her office, and found a job in one of the stalls enciphering and deciphering books. As it turned out, the key was more than just a decoration; rolled up inside its shaft was a strip of parchment inscribed with a long number that could be used to decipher a message, if the sender wanted you to decipher it.
160.title: Ciphers, codes, and cryptography
160.abstract: A method of encrypting data includes receiving an input string. The method further includes determining whether the input string is less than or equal to a predetermined length. If the input string is determined to be less than or equal to the predetermined length, the method also includes applying a first hash function to the input string to generate a first hash value. Otherwise, if the input string is determined not to be less than or equal to the predetermined length, the method additionally includes applying a second hash function to the input string to generate a second hash value. The method further includes combining the first hash value and the second hash value to generate a ciphertext that corresponds to the input string.

161.content: Now roaming freely, she opened up the Duke's throne and found a Turing machine beneath it. On either side of the machine was a narrow hole descending straight through the floor and into the earth for as far as her torch light could illuminate it. The chain containing the Duke's program dangled on either side into these holes.
161.title: Computer-implemented method, computer program product, and computer system for determining whether an object is a duck or a turing machine
161.abstract: A computer-implemented method of determining whether an object is a duck or a Turing machine comprises the steps of: (a) obtaining one or more images of the object; (b) processing the one or more images to extract features from the one or more images; (c) analyzing the extracted features to determine that the object is either a duck or a Turing machine; and (d) if it is determined in step (c) that the object is a duck, then outputting information indicating that the object is a duck. A corresponding computer program product and computer system are also disclosed herein.

162.content: The books were trundled from place to place on wheelbarrows and carried here and there on great long seedy-looking conveyor belts made of hemp and burlap. Book-carriers bumped into each other, compared notes as to what they were carrying and where they were going, and swapped books for other books. Stacks of books were sold in great, raucous auctions—and paid for not with gold but with other books. Around the edges of the market were stalls where books were exchanged for gold, and beyond that, a few alleys where gold could be exchanged for food. In the midst of this hubbub, Princess Nell saw a dark knight sitting on a black horse, paging through one of these books. Without further ado, she spurred her horse forward and drew her sword.
162.title: Children's book
162.abstract: A children's book is disclosed. The children's book includes a first page and a second page, wherein the first page comprises an illustration depicting a plurality of characters engaged in various activities; and wherein the second page comprises another illustration depicting at least one of the plurality of characters from the first page being chased by at least one other character from the first page.

163.content: The T-shirt was much too small; it bound him under the armpits and pressed against his muscles so that he felt the eternal twitching even more than usual. He wished he could turn the stimulators off now, relax his muscles even for one night, but that would require a trip to the mod parlor, and he had to figure that the Ashanti had the mod parlors all staked out.
163.title: T-shirt
163.abstract: A T-shirt is disclosed. The T-shirt includes a front portion, a back portion, and two sleeve portions extending from the front portion to the back portion. Each sleeve portion of the T-shirt has an inner surface and an outer surface.

164.content: They had been treated to a remarkable free media show, watching over his shoulders for hours as the dramaturgical exploits of John Percival Hackworth had played themselves out, in several different camera angles, on floating cine windows on Carl Hollywood's pages. None of them could read English, and so they had been unable to follow the story of Princess Nell's adventures in the land of King Coyote, which had been streaming across the pages at the same time, the storyline fluctuating and curling in upon itself like a cloud of smoke spun and torn by invisible currents.
164.title: Method and apparatus for presenting a narrative to a plurality of users
164.abstract: A method, system, and computer program product for providing an interactive storytelling experience is provided. In one embodiment, the method comprises determining that a first user has reached a predetermined point in a story; identifying at least one second user with whom the first user can interactively participate in continuing the story; transmitting instructions to the at least one second user instructing the at least one second user to continue the story from the predetermined point; receiving feedback from the at least one second user indicating how the at least one second user wishes to continue the story; modifying the story according to the feedback received from the at least one second user; and communicating the modified story to the first user and the at least one second user. Various other methods, systems, and computer program products are also contemplated herein.

165.content: As soon as she cleared the doorway, her cape inflated like a time-lapse explosion, and she shot twelve feet into the air, propelled on jets of air built into her clothing somehow—she payed out the leash so that Hackworth wasn't hanged in the process. Flying above the audience like the cone of fire from a rocket engine, she led the stumbling Hackworth down the sloping floor and to the edge of the water. The thrust stage was linked to the water's edge by a couple of narrow bridges, and Hackworth negotiated one of these, feeling hundreds of lights on his shoulders, seemingly hot enough to ignite his clothing.
165.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a human being across a body of water
165.abstract: A method is disclosed for transporting a human being across a body of water. The method includes the steps of providing an inflatable raft having at least one air bladder, wherein the at least one air bladder is configured to be filled with pressurized air; filling the at least one air bladder with pressurized air so as to cause the inflatable raft to become buoyant; seating the human being in the inflatable raft while the at least one air bladder is filled with pressurized air; removing the pressurized air from the at least one air bladder such that the inflatable raft becomes less buoyant than when it was filled with pressurized air; causing the inflatable raft to sink below the surface of the body of water; propelling the inflatable raft along the surface of the body of water until the human being exits the inflatable raft; and retr

166.content: They passed up through many tunnels, always taking the uphill fork until they saw sunlight shining down from above through the waves, casting lines of white light on the translucent roof. Nell severed the tunnel behind them, wielding her sword like the sweep of a clock's hand. The warm water rushed in on them.
166.title: Method and apparatus for underwater exploration
166.abstract: A method of operating an unmanned surface vehicle (USV) includes receiving, by the USV, one or more environmental data from at least one sensor associated with the USV. The method also includes determining, by the USV, a path to be followed by the USV in response to the one or more environmental data. The method further includes controlling, by the USV, movement of the USV according to the determined path.

167.content: When she was sure that the girl with the whip had gone, she spoke to her Primer and told it to make light. She could see a big matter compiler on the floor in the back of the closet; the girls used it to manufacture larger items when they were needed. This building was apparently hooked up to the Coastal Republic's Pudong Feed, because it hadn't lost Feed services when the Causeway had blown up; and indeed the Fists probably would not have bothered to establish their base here if the place had been cut off. Once every couple of hours or so, a Fist would come into this closet and order the M.C. to create something, usually a simple bulk substance like rations.
167.title: Apparatus and method for securing a whip to a person's hand
167.abstract: An apparatus for securing a whip to a person's hand, the apparatus comprising an elongate body having a first end and a second end, wherein the first end of the elongate body is configured to be attached to a whip handle; at least one strap extending from the first end of the elongate body towards the second end of the elongate body, wherein the at least one strap is configured to wrap around two or more fingers of a user's hand so as to secure the elongate body to the user's hand. The invention also relates to a method for securing a whip to a person's hand using such an apparatus.

168.content: Nell followed their track for some time, hoping to divine the cause of this prodigy. After a few miles the road widened into an abandoned camp freckled with the remains of innumerable small campfires. Nell combed this area for more clues, not without success: she found many mouse droppings here, and mouse footprints around the fires. The pattern of footprints made it clear that the cats had been concentrated in a few small areas, while the mice had apparently had the run of the place.
168.title: Method and apparatus for controlling rodent infestations
168.abstract: A method of controlling an infestation in a building includes identifying at least one source of the infestation within the building. A plurality of traps are positioned throughout the building, wherein each trap is configured to capture any rodents that enter the trap. At least some of the traps are placed proximate to the identified at least one source of the infestation.

169.content: Particulars of Nell&Harv's domestic situation; Harv brings back a wonder. Whenever Nell's clothes got too small for her, Harv would pitch them into the deke bin and then have the M.C. make new ones. Sometimes, if Tequila was going to take Nell someplace where they would see other moms with other daughters, she'd use the M.C. to make Nell a special dress with lace and ribbons, so that the other moms would see how special Nell was and how much Tequila loved her. The kids would sit in front of the mediatron and watch a passive, and the moms would sit nearby and talk sometimes or watch the mediatron sometimes.
169.title: Clothes made by the M.C.
169.abstract: A method of making clothes includes receiving an order for custom-made clothes from a customer, wherein the received order comprises at least one piece of information about the customer's preferences and/or personality traits; analyzing the received order to determine which type of clothing best fits the customer's preferences and/or personality traits; determining how many pieces of each type of clothing should be manufactured in accordance with the determined type of clothing that best fits the customer's preferences and/or personality traits; ordering raw materials needed to manufacture the determined number of pieces of each type of clothing; fabricating the determined number of pieces of each type of clothing using the ordered raw materials; and delivering the fabricated pieces of clothing to the customer.

170.content: When he settled into bed, he heard a small chime, like faery bells. It was coming from the little pen dangling from his watch chain, and it meant that he had mail. Perhaps a thank-you note from Fiona. He couldn't sleep anyway, and so he took out a sheet of mediatronic paper and spoke the commands that transferred the mail from the pen charm onto the page. He was disappointed to note that it was printed, not handwritten; some kind of official correspondence, and not, unfortunately, a note from Fiona.
170.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with a user of a wearable computing device
170.abstract: A method performed by a server to communicate with a user of a wearable computing device is provided. The method includes receiving, from the wearable computing device associated with the user, an indication that the user has engaged in at least one physical activity during a time period. The method further includes transmitting, to the wearable computing device, a first message configured to cause the wearable computing device to present information related to the at least one physical activity via a graphical user interface (GUI) of the wearable computing device. In addition, the method includes receiving, from the wearable computing device, a second message comprising biometric data collected by the wearable computing device while the user was performing the at least one physical activity. Further, the method includes determining whether the biometric data satisfies a predetermined condition.

171.content: The drumbeat grew and grew in volume until the pavement shook with each blow, and the shock absorption gear built into Kidnapper's legs went into play, flinching minutely at each beat. Another vanguard passed through: Hackworth easily calculated its size at two hundred and fifty-six. A battalion was four platoons, each of which was four companies of four troops of four girls each. The vanguard consisted of one such battalion, moving at a very brisk double-time, probably going ahead of the main group to fall upon the next major intersection. Then, finally, the main column passed through, organized in battalions, each foot hitting the ground in unison with all the others. Each battalion carried a few sedan chairs, which were passed from one four-girl troop to another every few minutes to spread out the work.
171.title: Drumbeat
171.abstract: A method of processing an audio signal is disclosed. The method includes receiving the audio signal, wherein the audio signal comprises one or more drumbeats and one or more non-drumbeats. The method further includes determining whether each of the one or more non-drumbeats in the audio signal exceeds a predetermined time threshold. In response to determining that at least one of the one or more non-drumbeats in the audio signal does not exceed the predetermined time threshold, the method includes removing the at least one of the one or more non-drumbeats from the audio signal; and outputting the audio signal with the at least one of the one or more non-drumbeats removed.

172.content: The chain of camps extended northward from there, curving along the ocean and then eastward along the banks of the Yangtze to the opposite end, which was anchored by Nippon against any onslaught across the tidal flats. The entire center of the line was guarded against a direct frontal assault by Princess Nell's tribe/army of twelve-year-old girls, who were gradually trading in their pointed sticks for more modern weapons compiled from portable Sources owned by the Nipponese and the New Atlantans. Carl Hollywood had been assigned to military duty as soon as he reported to the New Atlantan authorities, despite his efforts to convince his superiors that he might be of more use pursuing his own line of research. But then a message came through from the highest levels of Her Majesty's government. The first part of it praised Carl Hollywood for his “heroic” actions in getting the late Colonel Spence out of Shanghai and suggested that a knighthood might be waiting for him if he ever got out of Pudong. The second part of it named him as a special envoy of sorts to Her Royal Highness, Princess Nell. Reading the message, Carl was momentarily stunned that his Sovereign was according equivalent status to Nell; but upon some reflection he saw that it was simultaneously just and pragmatic. During his time in the streets of Pudong, he had seen enough of the Mouse Army (as they called themselves, for some reason) to know that they did, in fact, constitute a new ethnic group of sorts, and that Nell was their undisputed leader.
172.title: Twelve-year-old princess and her army of twelve-year-old girls
172.abstract: Provided is a method for treating or preventing an infection, the method comprising administering to a subject in need thereof an effective amount of a pharmaceutical composition comprising one or more antimicrobials selected from the group consisting of vancomycin, teicoplanin, daptomycin, telavancin, tetracycline, doxycycline, minocycline, erythromycin, azithromycin, clarithromycin, clindamycin, linezolid, oxacillin, penicillin G, ampicillin, amoxicillin, nafcillin, piperacillin, tazobactam, imipenem, meropenem, doripenem, ceftaroline fosamil, cefixime, cefdinir, cefpodoxime

173.content: Each of the twelve boxes had its own door, and a curtain rail curving around the front so that the occupants could get some privacy between acts. They'd mothballed the curtains and replaced them with removable soundproof screens, unbolted the seats, and stored them in the basement. Now each box was a private egg-shaped room just the right size to serve as a body stage.
173.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for conducting an eleven o'clock at night boxing match are disclosed herein. In one embodiment, a method for conducting an eleven o'clock at night boxing match
173.abstract: Method of treating or preventing cancer comprising administering to a subject in need thereof an effective amount of compound of Formula (I)or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, solvate, ester, amide, clathrate, stereoisomer, enantiomer, racemate, hydrate, isomer, complex, prodrug, polar metabolite, geometric isomer, spiroisomer, unsaturation isomer, diastereomers, enantiomeric impurities, degradation product, or N-oxide of said compound; or a pharmaceutically acceptable composition comprising the same such that the subject is treated or prevented from developing cancer.

174.content: A little old-fashioned to you and me, but popular with tube feeders ,” said Fred Epidermis. “ 'Course your grid's way overkill for this, but hey, we're about giving the customer what they want—moving those bids, you know.” But Miranda wasn't really listening; for the first time ever, she was watching another person move exactly as she moved, as the stage mapped Miranda's grid onto this imaginary body.
174.title: Systems and methods for presenting a virtual avatar of a user in a graphical user interface (GUI) of an electronic trading system
174.abstract: Implementations described herein relate to systems and methods for presenting a virtual avatar of a user in a graphical user interface (GUI) of an electronic trading system. In one implementation, the method may include obtaining data associated with a plurality of trades executed by at least two users via an electronic trading system; analyzing the obtained data to determine whether each of the at least two users has met or exceeded a predetermined number of successful trades over a predetermined period of time; responsive to determining that each of the at least two users has met or exceeded the predetermined number of successful trades over the predetermined period of time, generating a virtual avatar corresponding to each of the at least two users; and displaying the generated virtual avatars as part of the GUI.

175.content: “The modifications you requested are complete. I ran the tests you specified plus a few others that occurred to me—all of them are documented here.” Cotton grabbed the heavy brasslike pull of his desk drawer and paused for a fraction of a second while the embedded fingerprint-recognition logic did its work. The drawer unlocked itself, and Cotton pulled it open to reveal a timeless assortment of office drawer miscellany, including several sheets of paper—some blank, some printed, some scrawled on, and one sheet that was blank except for the word RUNCIBLE printed at the top in Cotton's neat draughtsman's hand. Cotton pulled this one out and spoke to it: “Demetrius James Cotton transferring all privileges to Mr. Hackworth.” “John Percival Hackworth in receipt,” Hackworth said, taking the page from Cotton.
175.title: Method and apparatus for securely transferring data between a user and an information handling system (IHS)
175.abstract: A method of authenticating a user with an information handling system (IHS) is provided. The method includes receiving, by the IHS, a request from a mobile device associated with the user to initiate a transaction; transmitting, by the IHS, one or more questions to the mobile device in response to receiving the request; receiving, by the IHS, answers to the one or more questions from the mobile device; comparing, by the IHS, the received answers to predetermined values; determining, by the IHS, that at least one of the received answers does not match any of the predetermined values; and refusing, by the IHS, to complete the transaction when it is determined that at least one of the received answers does not match any of the predetermined values. A corresponding apparatus, system, and computer program product are also disclosed.

176.content: She reached out and gripped his forearm just below the elbow and leaned toward him, desperate to make sure he got this. “It's not that we do a set show, reconfigure, and a different one next night. The changes are dynamic and take place in real time. The show reconfigures itself dynamically depending upon what happens moment to moment—and mind you, not just what happens here, but what is happening in the world at large. It is a smart play—an intelligent organism.” “So, if, for example, a battle between the Fists of Righteous Harmony and the Coastal Republic were taking place in the interior of China at this moment, then shifts in the battle might in some way—” “Might change the color of a spotlight or a line of dialogue—not necessarily in any simple and deterministic fashion, mind you—”
