176.title: Method and apparatus for interactive theatrical performance
176.abstract: A method of controlling an interactive theatrical performance is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, one or more inputs from at least one user; determining, by the computing device, that the received one or more inputs satisfy a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the received one or more inputs satisfy the predetermined criterion, causing, by the computing device, display of a visual cue indicative of enactment of a pre-determined action associated with satisfying the predetermined criterion; obtaining, by the computing device, feedback from the at least one user responsive to the displayed visual cue; and modifying, by the computing device, execution of the interactive theatrical performance based on the obtained feedback.

177.content: Nell followed him into the kitchen, which housed several important boxy entities with prominent doors. Some were warm, some cool, some had windows, some made noises. Nell had frequently seen Harv, or Tequila, or one of Tequila's boyfriends, removing food from them, in one stage or another of doneness. One of the boxes was called the M.C. It was built into the wall over the counter. Nell dragged a chair and climbed up to watch as Harv worked at it. The front of the M.C. was a mediatron, which meant anything that had pictures moving around on it, or sound coming out of it, or both. As Harv poked it with his fingers and spoke to it, little moving pictures danced around. It reminded her of the ractives she played on the big mediatron in the living room, when it wasn't being used by someone bigger. “What are those?” Nell said. “Mediaglyphics,” Harv said coolly.
177.title: Method and apparatus for generating and displaying graphical user interface (GUI) elements using mediaglyphics
177.abstract: A method of generating and displaying GUI elements is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method includes receiving an input from a user to generate a first GUI element; determining that the first GUI element corresponds to at least one second GUI element; in response to determining that the first GUI element corresponds to the at least one second GUI element, retrieving information associated with the at least one second GUI element corresponding to the first GUI element; storing the information associated with the at least one second GUI element as metadata within the first GUI element; and outputting the first GUI element including the metadata stored therein. Correspondingly, a system for generating and displaying GUI elements is also disclosed.

178.content: “At Your Honor's convenience,” Miss Pao said, “I would invite you to examine the two objects I laid on the table.” Judge Fang was startled to notice that, while the block's appearance had not changed, the book had become covered in a layer of thick gray dust, as if it had been growing mildew for several decades. “Oooh,” Chang blurted, sucking a lengthy skein of noodles into his maw and bulging his eyes in the direction of this peculiar exhibit. Judge Fang rose, walked around the table, and bent down for a closer look.
178.title: Methods, systems, and apparatuses for presenting evidence in a virtual courtroom
178.abstract: A method of operating a computing device includes receiving an indication that the computing device is located within a predetermined geographic area. In response to receiving the indication that the computing device is located within the predetermined geographic area, one or more images captured by a camera of the computing device are analyzed to identify at least one object depicted in the one or more images. The at least one object is classified as either (i) physical evidence associated with a legal proceeding or (ii) non-physical evidence not associated with the legal proceeding. Responsive to classifying the at least one object as being related to the legal proceeding, the at least one object is transmitted from the computing device to a second computing device over a network.

179.content: A young hooligan before the court of Judge Fang; the magistrate confers with his advisers; Justice is served. The revolving chain of a nunchuk has a unique radar signature—reminiscent of that of a helicopter blade, but noisier,” Miss Pao said, gazing up at Judge Fang over the half-lenses of her phenomenoscopic spectacles. Her eyes went out of focus, and she winced; she had been lost in some enhanced three-dimensional image, and the adjustment to dull reality was disorienting. “A cluster of such patterns was recognized by one of Shanghai P.D.'s sky-eyes at ten seconds after 2351 hours.” As Miss Pao worked her way through this summary, images appeared on the big sheet of mediatronic paper that Judge Fang had unrolled across his brocade tablecloth and held down with carved jade paperweights. At the moment, the image was a map of a Leased Territory called Enchantment, with one location, near the Causeway, highlighted. In the corner was another pane containing a standard picture of an anticrime sky-eye, which always looked, to Judge Fang, like an American football as redesigned by fetishists: glossy and black and studded. Miss Pao continued, “The sky-eye dispatched a flight of eight smaller aerostats equipped with cine cameras.” The kinky football was replaced by a picture of a teardrop-shaped craft, about the size of an almond, trailing a whip antenna, with an orifice at its nose protected by an incongruously beautiful iris. Judge Fang was not really looking; at least three-quarters of the cases that came before him commenced with a summary almost exactly like this one. It was a credit to Miss Pao's seriousness and diligence that she was able to tell each story afresh. It was a challenge to Judge Fang's professionalism for him to listen to each one in the same spirit. “Converging on the scene,” Miss Pao said, “they recorded activities.” The large map image on Judge Fang's scroll was replaced by a cine feed. The figures were far away, flocks of relatively dark pixels nudging their way across a rough gray background like starlings massing before a winter gale. They got bigger and more clearly defined as the aerostat flew closer to the action.
179.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and identifying persons engaged in illicit activities
179.abstract: A method of detecting an illicit activity is disclosed. The method includes obtaining, by one or more processors, image data from at least one surveillance camera that captures images within a predetermined field of view (FOV) of the at least one surveillance camera. The method also includes determining, by the one or more processors, whether any person(s) are engaging in an illicit activity using the image data. In addition, the method includes transmitting, by the one or more processors, information associated with the detected illicit activity to a remote computing device. Further, the method includes receiving, by the one or more processors, instructions generated by the remote computing device responsive to the transmitted information. Moreover, the method includes executing, by the one or more processors, the instructions to control operation of the at least one surveillance camera. An apparatus for detecting an illic

180.content: Nell perched herself on the windowsill, leaned against the pane, opened the Primer, and flipped all the way back to the beginning. It started with the same old story, as ever, but told now in more mature prose. She read the story of how her stepfather had gotten her from the mermaids, and read it again, drawing out more details, asking it questions, calling up detailed illustrations. There, in one of the illustrations, she saw it: her stepfather's lockbox, a humble plank chest bound in rusted iron straps, with a heavy old-fashioned padlock, stored underneath his bed.
180.title: Method and apparatus for reading a book
180.abstract: A method of reading a book is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (i) receiving an indication from a user that they wish to read a book; (ii) determining, in response to the received indication, one or more predetermined sections of text within the book which are relevant to the subject matter of the book; (iii) extracting the determined one or more predetermined sections of text from the book; (iv) presenting the extracted one or more predetermined sections of text to the user; and (v) repeating steps (ii)-(iv) until the entirety of the book has been read by the user.

181.content: A man stood outside before a large chopping-block, using a hatchet with an exceptionally wide blade to split thin wedges of red wood from a log. These were piled into a wicker basket that was hauled up on a rope by a man who stood on the roof, replacing some of the old gray shingles with these new red ones.
181.title: Apparatus and method for installing roofing shingles
181.abstract: An apparatus for installing roofing shingles is provided. The apparatus includes a base having a first end, a second end, and a sidewall extending from the first end to the second end; a plurality of slots disposed in the sidewall, wherein each of the plurality of slots extends between the first end and the second end such that at least two of the plurality of slots are positioned adjacent one another along an entire length of the sidewall; and a locking mechanism operatively coupled to the base configured to selectively engage any slot of the plurality of slots so as to prevent movement of the locking mechanism with respect to the base when the locking mechanism is engaged with any slot of the plurality of slots. A method for installing roofing shingles using the apparatus is also provided.

182.content: Everett seemed to think that if he could just swivel his head around in the right direction, a big healthy pack of duck-bills would suddenly rotate into view. At the very end, I think that Everett may have put two and two together; I saw him blink in surprise once, as if the light had finally gone on in his head, and the rest of that day he was very quiet, as if all of his half-dozen or so neurons were busy working out the implications.
182.title: Duck-billed dinosa
182.abstract: A duck-billed dinosaur is provided. The duck-billed dinosaur includes a skull having an upper jaw and a lower jaw, wherein each of the upper jaw and the lower jaw comprises a plurality of tooth sockets; at least one replacement tooth configured to be removably insertable into any one of the plurality of tooth sockets in either the upper jaw or the lower jaw; and means for retaining the at least one replacement tooth within any one of the plurality of tooth sockets.

183.content: It was lined with ancient masonry warehouses—a category of structure now so obsolete as to defy explanation—which had been converted into offices. A pier rode on the surface of the river, riding up and down on the tide, linked to the rim of the granite embankment by a hinged gangway. A shaggy black vessel was tied up to the pier, but it was completely unlit, visible only by its black shadow against the charcoal-gray water. After the chevalines had planted themselves and the Hackworths had dismounted, they were able to hear low voices coming from below. John Hackworth withdrew some tickets from his breast pocket and asked them to illuminate themselves; but they were printed on old-fashioned paper that did not contain its own energy source, and so he finally had to use the microtorch dangling from his watch chain. Apparently satisfied that they had arrived at the right place, he offered Fiona his arm and escorted her down the gangway to the pier. A tiny flickering light bobbed toward them and resolved into an Afro-Caribbean man, wearing rimless glasses and carrying an antique hurricane lamp. Fiona watched his face as his enormous eyes, yellowed like antique ivory billiard balls, scanned their tickets. His skin was rich and warm and glowing in the light of the candle, and he smelled faintly of citrus combined with something darker and less ingratiating.
183.title: Method and apparatus for transporting passengers across bodies of water
183.abstract: A passenger ferry is provided that includes a hull, at least one propulsion system operably coupled to the hull, wherein the at least one propulsion system is configured to maneuver the passenger ferry within a body of water. The passenger ferry further includes an elevated platform supported by the hull, wherein the elevated platform is positioned above the surface of the body of water when the passenger ferry is floating in the body of water. The passenger ferry additionally includes a plurality of seating arrangements disposed on the elevated platform, wherein the plurality of seating arrangements are spaced apart from each other so as to provide unobstructed views of the environment surrounding the passenger ferry while the passenger ferry is floating in the body of water.

184.content: At one end was a raised platform, and on that was an old folding table with a red cloth tossed over it. The red cloth had gold threads woven through it to make a design: a unicorn or a dragon or some shit like that.
184.title: Method and apparatus for playing a game of baccarat
184.abstract: A method, apparatus, and computer-readable storage medium for playing Baccarat are disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises receiving an initial wager from a player at a Baccarat gaming table; determining that the player is eligible to participate in a progressive jackpot award associated with the Baccarat gaming table; displaying information about the progressive jackpot award during play of the Baccarat hand; resolving the Baccarat hand according to predetermined Baccarat rules; determining whether the resolution of the Baccarat hand resulted in a win by the player or a loss by the player; responsive to winning the Baccarat hand, incrementing the value of the progressive jackpot award; and responsive to losing the Baccarat hand, not incrementing the value of the progressive jackpot award.

185.content: Carl gave the Equity Lord a brief description of Miranda's relationship with the Primer. Finkle-McGraw was keenly interested in how much time Miranda had spent in the Primer each week. “If your estimates are even approximately accurate, this young woman must have singlehandedly done at least nine-tenths of the racting associated with that copy of the Primer.” “That copy? Do you mean to say there were others?”
185.title: Method and apparatus for managing a plurality of copies of a document
185.abstract: A method, computer program product, and computer system are provided for managing a plurality of copies of a document. The method includes receiving an indication that a first copy of the document is to be deleted; determining whether one or more other copies of the document exist; in response to determining that no other copies of the document exist, deleting the first copy of the document; and in response to determining that at least one other copy of the document exists, generating a notification indicating that the first copy of the document is to be deleted.

186.content: “Our media system today—the one that you and I make our livings from—is a descendant of the phone system only insofar as we use it for essentially the same purposes, plus many, many more. But the key point to remember is that it is totally different from the old phone system. The old phone system—and its technological cousin, the cable TV system—tanked. It crashed and burned decades ago, and we started virtually from scratch.”
186.title: Systems and methods for delivering audio and video content
186.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for delivering audio and video content. In one implementation, an apparatus comprises at least one processor coupled to a non-transitory computer readable medium storing instructions that when executed by the at least one processor, cause the at least one processor to perform operations comprising receiving user input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the user input is associated with playback of first media content; identifying second media content in response to receipt of the user input; determining whether the identified second media content corresponds to the first media content; responsive to a determination that the identified second media content does not correspond to the first media content, initiating playback of the identified second media content; and responsive to a determination that the identified second media content corresponds to the first media content, pausing playback of the first media content. Other implementations are also described herein.

187.content: As usual, the tag mites were equipped with inertial navigation systems that recorded all of the suspect's subsequent movements.” The big cine feed was replaced by a map of the Leased Territories with the suspect's movements traced out with a red line. This boy did a lot of wandering about, even going into Shanghai on occasion, but he always came back to the same apartment. “After a pattern was established, the tag mites automatically spored,” Miss Pao said. The image of the barbed dart altered itself, the midsection—which contained a taped record of the dart's movements—breaking free and accelerating into the void. “Several of the spores found their way to a sky-eye, where their contents were downloaded and their serial numbers checked against police records. It was determined that the suspect spent much of his time in a particular apartment. Surveillance was placed on that apartment. One of the residents clearly matched the suspect seen on the cine feed. The suspect was placed under arrest and additional tag mites found in his body, tending to support our suspicions.” “Oooh,” Chang blurted, absently, as if he'd just remembered something important. “What do we know about the victim?” Judge Fang said.
187.title: Method and apparatus for locating a person of interest
187.abstract: A method, system and apparatus for identifying the location of a person of interest (POI) are disclosed. In an embodiment, one or more sensors may be used to collect sensor data that is indicative of the presence of at least one POI within a predetermined geographic area. The collected sensor data may then be analyzed to determine whether there is a high likelihood that said at least one POI is located within the predetermined geographic area. If it is determined that there is a high likelihood that said at least one POI is located within the predetermined geographic area, information relating to the location of said at least one POI in the predetermined geographic area may be transmitted to a remote computing device.

188.content: Before Finkle-McGraw had come to him with the idea for Runcible, Hackworth had spent a lot of time pondering this issue, mostly while carrying Fiona through the park on his shoulders. He knew that he must seem distant to his daughter, though he loved her so—but only because, when he was with her, he couldn't stop thinking about her future. How could he inculcate her with the nobleman's emotional stance—the pluck to take risks with her life, to found a company, perhaps found several of them even after the first efforts had failed? He had read the biographies of several notable peers and found few common threads between them. Just when he was about to give up and attribute it all to random chance, Lord Finkle-McGraw had invited him over to his club and, out of nowhere, begun talking about precisely the same issue.
188.title: Method and apparatus for training a child to be a nobleman or nobleman's heir
188.abstract: A method of training a child to be a nobleman or nobleman's heir includes providing the child with an opportunity to interact with one or more pets. The pet(s) is/are trained to respond to commands from the child in accordance with a predetermined set of behaviors associated with being a nobleman or nobleman's heir. Responses by the pet(s) are monitored during the interaction between the child and the pet(s). A determination is made as to whether the child has mastered at least some of the predetermined set of behaviors. If it is determined that the child has not mastered at least some of the predetermined set of behaviors, further interactions between the child and the pet(s) are provided until the child has mastered at least some of the predetermined set of behaviors.

189.content: But what does it really mean when such a young person moves to another phyle? It means that they have outgrown youthful credulity and no longer wish to belong to a tribe simply because it is the path of least resistance—they have developed principles, they are concerned with their personal integrity. It means, in short, that they are ripe to become members in good standing of New Atlantis—as soon as they develop the wisdom to see that it is, in the end, the best of all possible tribes.” “Your strategy was much too subtle for me to follow. I thank you for explaining it. You encourage subversiveness because you think that it will have an effect opposite to what one might naively suppose.”
189.title: Method and apparatus for facilitating the formation of a new tribe
189.abstract: A method includes receiving, by a computing device from a first user, a request to join a second user's tribe in a social network. Responsive to determining that joining the second user's tribe does not violate one or more privacy settings associated with the first user, the computing device sends an invitation to join the second user's tribe to the first user. In response to receipt of the invitation, the first user accepts the invitation to join the second user's tribe. The computing device adds the first user as a member of the second user's tribe within the social network.

190.content: Money and shit,” Bud said, and just like that, the man took some hard ucus out of his pocket and handed them over—and then actually thanked him as he backed away. Bud enjoyed getting that kind of respect from black people—it reminded him of his noble heritage in the trailer parks of North Florida—and he didn't mind the money either. After that day he began looking for black people with that same scared uncertain look about them. These people bought and sold off the record, and so they carried hard money.
190.title: Method and apparatus for buying and selling contraband
190.abstract: A method of trading in contraband is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of receiving an offer to sell contraband from a first user, determining whether the offered contraband meets predetermined quality criteria, if the offered contraband does not meet the predetermined quality criteria, rejecting the received offer; if the offered contraband does meet the predetermined quality criteria, accepting the received offer by transmitting an acceptance message to the first user, wherein the acceptance message instructs the first user to deliver the offered contraband to a second user at a pre-determined location within a pre-determined time period; upon receipt of the delivered contraband, verifying that the delivered contraband complies with the predetermined quality criteria before releasing payment to the first user. A corresponding system and computer program product are also disclosed.

191.content: Inside were two small machines, one for reading tapes and one for writing them. “Follow me,” said King Coyote, and opened a trapdoor set into the floor behind the altar. Princess Nell followed him down a spiral staircase into a small room. The connecting rods from the altar came down into this room and terminated at a small console.
191.title: Method and apparatus for recording and retrieving data on a magnetic tape
191.abstract: A method of writing data to a magnetic tape is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (i) determining an amount of available space on the magnetic tape; (ii) identifying a plurality of write-blocks, wherein each write-block corresponds to a predetermined length of the magnetic tape; (iii) dividing the determined amount of available space among the plurality of write-blocks such that each write-block contains substantially the same amount of data as any other write-block in the plurality of write-blocks; and (iv) writing at least some of the data to be written to the magnetic tape within one or more of the plurality of write-blocks.

192.content: East of town in the fertile delta of the Fraser River, the Slavs and the Germans were both supposed to have large patches of Lebensraum staked out, surrounded by grids of somewhat nastier than usual security pods. Hindustan had a spray of tiny claves all over the metropolitan area. The Atlantis clave climbed out of the water half a mile west of the university, to which it was joined by a causeway.
192.title: Method and apparatus for creating a new clave in an existing metropolitan area
192.abstract: A method of creating a new Clave in an existing Metropolitan Area (MA) includes receiving, by a first network element from a second network element, a request to create the new Clave in the existing MA. The method also includes sending, by the first network element to the second network element, one or more configuration parameters associated with the new Clave. In addition, the method further includes determining, by the first network element using the one or more configuration parameters received from the second network element, that the creation of the new Clave in the existing MA is complete.

193.content: The windows on the Dovetail side of the gatehouse were larger, and she could see the two corgi dogs outside, peering in through the lead latticework, flabbergasted that they had, through some enormous lacuna in procedure, been left on the outside, wagging their tails somewhat uncertainly, as if, in a world that allowed such mistakes, nothing could be counted on. The Constable found a wooden tray and carried it about the room, cautiously assembling a collection of cups, saucers, spoons, tongs, and other tea-related armaments. When all the necessary tools were properly laid out, he manufactured the beverage, hewing closely to the ancient procedure, and set it before them. Resting on a counter by the window was an outlandishly shaped black object that Nell recognized as a telephone, only because she had seen them on the old passives that her mother liked to watch—where they seemed to take on a talismanic significance out of proportion to what they actually did. The Constable picked up a piece of paper on which many names and strings and digits had been hand-written. He turned his back to the nearest window, then leaned backward over the counter so as to bring most of him closer to its illumination. He tilted the paper into the light and then adjusted the elevation of his own chin through a rather sweeping arc, converging on a position that placed the lenses of his reading spectacles between pupil and page. Having maneuvered all of these elements into the optimal geometry, he let out a little sigh, as though the arrangement suited him, and peered up over his glasses at Nell and Harv for a moment, as if to suggest that they could learn some valuable tricks by keeping a sharp eye on him.
193.title: Dovetail; or, how to build a time machine out of a tea chest and a deck of playing cards
193.abstract: A dovetail is disclosed. The dovetail comprises at least one elongated body extending along a longitudinal axis from a first end to a second end opposite the first end. The dovetail further comprises a plurality of protrusions projecting laterally away from the elongated body between the first end and the second end. At least some of the plurality of protrusions are angled relative to the longitudinal axis so as to form an angle with the longitudinal axis greater than 90 degrees but less than 180 degrees. A method for building a time machine using such a dovetail is also disclosed.

194.content: They used existing data—a digital map of the world that is available to any maker of ractives who needs it, for a price of course. That digital map is a separate object. It resides in the memory of a computer somewhere.
194.title: Systems and methods for providing location-based augmented reality (AR)
194.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for providing location-based augmented reality (AR). In one implementation, an AR system includes memory storing instructions and a processor configured to execute the instructions to access geolocation data associated with a user device. The geolocation data can be used to determine that the user device is located within a predetermined distance from a physical object. Based on determining that the user device is located within the predetermined distance from the physical object, image data captured by the user device are analyzed to identify at least one feature in the image data corresponding to the physical object. One or more additional features not corresponding to the physical object are also identified in the image data. Augmented reality content is generated based on the at least one feature and the one or more additional features.

195.content: The skin of her arms glowed yellow-pink in the beam of a torch shone up from below. She did not make the mistake of looking down into the dazzling light and did not have to; the excited voice of the Fist below her told her that she had been discovered. A moment later, the light vanished as the ascending elevator interposed itself between Nell and the Fists who had seen her. She recalled Harv and his buds elevator-surfing in their old building and reckoned that this would be a good time to take up the practice. As the car rose toward her, she jumped off the ladder, trying to give herself enough upward thrust to match its velocity.
195.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a person in an elevator shaft
195.abstract: A method of transporting a person in an elevator shaft, the elevator shaft extending between first and second floors of a building. The method comprises receiving at least one request to transport a person from the first floor to the second floor via the elevator shaft; determining whether there is sufficient capacity within the elevator shaft to accommodate both the person and any luggage being carried by the person; if it is determined that there is sufficient capacity within the elevator shaft to accommodate both the person and any luggage being carried by the person, then transporting the person from the first floor to the second floor via the elevator shaft; and if it is determined that there is insufficient capacity within the elevator shaft to accommodate both the person and any luggage being carried by the person, then transporting the person from the first floor to the second floor without using the elevator shaft.

196.content: As you have demonstrated in the case of the book and the girl, you are too wise a magistrate not to understand the importance of proper upbringing of small children. No doubt you will exhibit the same concern for each one of these quarter of a million infants as you did for one little barbarian girl.”
196.title: Systems and methods for managing a population of newborn babies
196.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for managing a population of newborn babies. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method may include receiving an indication that a newborn baby has been born in a hospital; obtaining information associated with the newborn baby from medical records maintained by the hospital; determining whether the newborn baby is eligible for enrollment in a healthcare insurance program offered by a governmental entity; if the newborn baby is determined to be eligible for enrollment in the healthcare insurance program, automatically enrolling the newborn baby in the healthcare insurance program; and transmitting data related to the birth of the newborn baby to at least one external system.

197.content: Then she finished putting on her makeup and choosing her outfit, and went to the dining car for dinner. Most of the other characters were already in here. The nine amateurs were stiff and stilted as usual, the two other professionals were circulating among them, trying to loosen them up, break through that self-consciousness and get them into their characters.
197.title: Murder on the Orient Express (A Hercule Poirot Mystery)
197.abstract: The extraordinary new novel by the #1 New York Times bestselling author--a prequel to Agatha Christie's most beloved novel, Murder on the Orient Express.It is 1932, and at the famous Belgrave Hotel in London, Hemingway is hard at work on his first novel, A Farewell to Arms. Ernest Hemingway is a celebrity in London. He is handsome, charming, and a big drinker with women falling at his feet. But when he challenges hotel proprietor Samuel Woolf to a fistfight, the stakes are changed forever. Kicking off one of the juiciest literary what-ifs of all time, Murder on the Orient Express goes back in time to consider what would have transpired if Woolf kills Hemingway and thereby avoids all the events that lead to To Have and Have Not,

198.content: He waved his hand toward the window. “These were rice paddies before they were parking lots. Rice was the basis for our society. Peasants planted the seeds and had highest status in the Confucian hierarchy. As the Master said, “Let the producers be many and the consumers few.' When the Feed came in from Atlantis, from Nippon, we no longer had to plant, because the rice now came from the matter compiler. It was the destruction of our society. When our society was based upon planting, it could truly be said, as the Master did, “Virtue is the root; wealth is the result.' But under the Western ti, wealth comes not from virtue but from cleverness.
198.title: Methods and apparatus for treating rice paddies and parking lots
198.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to methods and apparatuses for removing hydrogen sulfide (H2S) from water. In one implementation, an H2S-removal system comprises at least one electrolytic cell configured to receive contaminated water that includes H2S; wherein the at least one electrolytic cell is configured to produce deionized water having less than about 10 parts per billion (ppb) total dissolved solids (TDS), including less than about 5 ppb TDS, by passing the contaminated water through the at least one electrolytic cell using direct current (DC) electricity generated by a DC power source coupled to the at least one electrolytic cell such that the at least one electrolytic cell produces chlorine gas in response to the DC electricity flowing through the at least one electrolytic cell during passage of the

199.content: As she awaited the elevator, she was more scared than she had ever been; the sight of the cruel red ribbons in the small hands of the girls had for some reason struck more terror into her heart than the sight of knives in the hands of Fists. A shrill commotion arose from the bunk room. The bell for the elevator sounded. She heard the bunk room door fly open, and someone running down the hall. The elevator door opened. One of the girls came into the lobby, saw her, and shrieked something to the others in a dolphinlike squeal. Nell got into the elevator, punched the button for the lobby, and held down the DOOR CLOSE button. The girl thought for a moment, then stepped forward to hold the door.
199.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an elevator
199.abstract: A method of controlling an elevator is provided. The method includes determining that the elevator is to be moved from a first position to a second position, obtaining information related to at least one parameter affecting movement of the elevator between the first position and the second position, wherein the at least one parameter comprises at least one of (i) weight of passengers in the elevator, (ii) speed of the elevator, (iii) acceleration of the elevator, (iv) inclination of the elevator, or (v) angle of the elevator with respect to a horizontal plane; and controlling the elevator such that the elevator arrives at the second position within a predetermined time period while maintaining the at least one parameter within a predetermined range. A computer-readable storage medium storing instructions executable by a processor to control an elevator in accordance with the method, and an elevator

200.content: Protocol, you know.” “Explain protocol,” Nell said.
200.title: Systems and methods for secure communications
200.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for securing communications. In one implementation, a method includes receiving, by a computing device from a first user equipment (UE), a request to establish an encrypted communication session with a second UE; determining, by the computing device, whether at least one condition associated with the request is satisfied; in response to determining that the at least one condition associated with the request is satisfied, transmitting, by the computing device, information used to establish the encrypted communication session between the first UE and the second UE; and initiating, by the computing device, the encrypted communication session between the first UE and the second UE. Other implementations are also described herein.

201.content: Others, like the Boers, the Parsis, the Jews, went for the understated approach, and in Pudong anything understated was more or less invisible. Still others—the Mormons, the First Distributed Republic, and the Chinese Coastal Republic itself—used every square inch of their mediatronic walls to proselytize.
201.title: Mediatronic wall
201.abstract: A mediatronic wall is disclosed. The mediatronic wall comprises a plurality of panels, each panel having an outer surface and an inner surface opposite the outer surface. At least one electronic device is positioned between the inner surfaces of two adjacent panels in the plurality of panels such that the at least one electronic device is operable to communicate with other electronic devices within the plurality of panels.

202.content: Other girls in the class began to titter—their faces were all turned back toward Nell, and she could see their exultation, and somehow Miss Stricken and the ruler became irrelevant compared to the other girls. Nell raised her hand a whole inch, saw the windup out of the corner of her eye, heard the whir. At the last moment, on an impulse, she flipped her hand over, caught the ruler on her palm, grabbed it, and twisted in a way that Dojo had taught her, bending it against the grain of Miss Stricken's fingers so that she was forced to let go. Now Nell had the ruler, and Miss Stricken was disarmed. Her opponent was a bulging sort of woman, taller than average, rather topheavy on those heels, the sort of teacher whose very fleshiness becomes the object of morbid awe among her gamine pupils, whose personal toilet practices—the penchant for dandruff, the habitually worn-out lipstick, the little wad of congealed saliva at the corner of the mouth—loom larger in her students' minds than the Great Pyramids or the Lewis and Clark Expedition. Like all other women, Miss Stricken benefited from a lack of external genitalia that would make it more difficult for Nell to incapacitate her, but nevertheless, Nell could think of half a dozen ways to leave her a bloody knot on the floor and not waste more than a quarter of a minute in the process.
202.title: Systems and methods for using a ruler as a self-defense weapon
202.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for using a ruler as a self-defense weapon. In one implementation, a system includes a ruler having an elongated body extending from a first end to a second end opposite the first end. The ruler further includes a plurality of ridges formed along at least a portion of the elongated body between the first end and the second end.

203.content: Then came Carl Hollywood, who, with his height and his rifle, seemed to have ended up with the job of long-range reconnaissance and defense. Colonel Spence and the other Israeli brought up the rear, walking backward most of the time. This got them down the alley without much trouble, but that was the easy part; when they reached the street, they were no longer the only focus of action but mere motes in a sandstorm. Colonel Spence discharged most of a clip into the air; the explosions were nearly inaudible in the chaos, but the gouts of light from the weapon's barrel drew some attention, and people in their immediate vicinity actually got out of their way. Carl saw one of the Zulus do something very ugly with his long weapon and looked away; then he reflected that it was the Zulus' job to break trail and his to concentrate on more distant threats. He turned slowly around as he walked, trying to ignore the threat that was just beyond arm's length and to get a view of the larger scene. They had walked into a completely disorganized street fight between the Coastal Republic forces and the Fists of Righteous Harmony, which was not made any clearer by the fact that many of the Coastals had defected by tying strips of red cloth round the arms of their uniforms, and that many of the Fists were not wearing any markings at all, and that many others who had no affiliation were taking advantage of the situation to loot stores and were being fought off by private guards; many of the looters were themselves being mugged by organized gangs. They were on Nanjing Road, a broad thoroughfare leading straight to the Bund and the Huang Pu, lined with four- and five-story buildings so that many windows looked out over them, any one of which might have contained a sniper. A few of them did contain snipers, Carl realized, but many of these were shooting across the street at each other, and the ones who were firing into the street could have been shooting at anyone. Carl saw one fellow with a laser-sighted rifle emptying clip after clip into the street, and he reckoned that this constituted a clear and present danger; so at a moment when their forward progress had stalled momentarily, while the Zulus were waiting for an especially desperate Coastal/Fist melee to resolve itself ahead of them, Carl planted his feet, swung his rifle up to his shoulder, took aim, and fired. In the dim fire- and torch-light rising up from the street, he could see powder explode from the stone window frame just above the sniper's head. The sniper cringed, then began to sweep the street with his laser, looking for the source of the bullet.
203.title: Method and apparatus for defeating a sniper
203.abstract: A method of defeating a sniper includes receiving, by a computing device, an image captured by a camera. A portion of the image is cropped to generate a crop frame. The crop frame is analyzed to identify one or more objects in the crop frame. At least one object identified in the crop frame is determined to be associated with a sniper rifle. In response to determining that at least one object identified in the crop frame is associated with a sniper rifle, instructions are transmitted from the computing device to cause a projectile launcher coupled to the computing device to fire a projectile toward the location of the sniper rifle.

204.content: When she finished her warmups and went on, she found a bid already waiting for her. The casting agent, which was a semiautonomous piece of software, had assembled a company of nine payers, enough to ract all the guest roles in First Class to Geneva, which was about intrigue among rich people on a train in Nazi-occupied France, and which was to ractives what The Mousetrap was to passive theatre. It was an ensemble piece: nine guest roles to be assumed by payers, three somewhat larger and more glamorous host roles to be assumed by payees like Miranda. One of the characters was, unbeknownst to the others, an Allied spy.
204.title: Air transportation from first class to Geneva
204.abstract: Systems, methods, and computer-readable media are disclosed herein for facilitating air travel. In one embodiment, the method comprises receiving an indication that a user is interested in booking at least one flight segment between a source location and a destination location. The method further comprises accessing historical data associated with previous flights taken by the user. The method further comprises analyzing the historical data to determine whether the user has previously traveled via non-commercial means (e.g., driving or ridesharing) between the source location and the destination location. The method further comprises determining availability of ground transportation between the source location and the destination location. The method further comprises providing information about the available ground transportation to the user.

205.content: “It appears to use echolocation, like a bat,” Miss Pao admitted. “The other one, as you can see, is of a radically different design.” The other mite looked like a spacecraft as envisioned by Jules Verne. It had a streamlined, teardrop shape, a pair of manipulator arms folded neatly against its fuselage, and a deep cylindrical cavity in the nose that Judge Fang took to be its eye. “This one sees light in the ultraviolet range,” Miss Pao said. “Despite their differences, each does the same thing: searches for books. When it finds a book, it lands on the cover and crawls to the edge, then creeps between the pages and examines the internal structure of the paper.” “What is it looking for?” “There is no way to tell, short of disassembling its internal computer system and decompiling its program—which is difficult,” Miss Pao said, with characteristic understatement. “When it finds that it has been investigating a normal book made of old-fashioned paper, it deactivates and becomes dust.” “So there are many dirty books in the Leased Territories now,” Chang said.
205.title: Method and apparatus for cleaning books
205.abstract: A method of cleaning a book includes providing a first set of pages from the book, wherein each page in the first set of pages is associated with one or more second sets of pages. Each second set of pages comprises at least one additional page not included in the first set of pages.

206.content: When he walked around the deck, his viewpoint changed correspondingly. There was also a standard interface that enabled him to “fly” around the ship; Hackworth himself remained in one fixed location, of course, but his viewpoint in the spectacles became unlinked to his real coordinates. Whenever he used this mode, the following legend was superimposed on his view in giant flashing red block letters: JOHN PERCIVAL HACKWORTH'S GODLIKE PERSPECTIVE sometimes accompanied by a cartoon of a wizardly sort of fellow sitting atop a mountain peering down into a village of squalid midgets.
206.title: Augmented-reality glasses for use aboard a starship
206.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer program products comprising a computer-readable storage medium. In one implementation, a method includes determining that an augmented reality (AR) headset is to be used by a user while riding in a spacecraft configured to travel between planets or other celestial bodies within a solar system; obtaining data from at least one sensor coupled to the AR headset; transmitting the data obtained from the at least one sensor to a computing device associated with the spacecraft; analyzing the data received from the at least one sensor relative to predetermined criteria; and providing feedback to the user via the AR headset when it is determined that the data does not meet the predetermined criteria.

207.content: Judge Fang nodded at the Sikh, who took the cue. “The CEP code,” said the Sikh, “governs all kinds of economic interactions between people and organizations. Theft is one such interaction. Maiming is another, insofar as it affects the victim's ability to fend for himself economically. As Protocol does not aspire to sovereign status, we work in cooperation with the indigenous justice system of CEP signatories in order to pursue such cases.” “You familiar with the Confucian system of justice, Bud?” said Judge Fang.
207.title: Method and apparatus for resolving disputes in a decentralized peer-to-peer network
207.abstract: A method of resolving a dispute between two or more parties, the method comprising: (a) receiving at least one message from each party to the dispute; (b) determining whether there is consensus among the received messages as to what action should be taken with respect to the dispute; (c) if it is determined that there is not consensus amongst the received messages as to what action should be taken with respect to the dispute, then repeating steps (a)-(c); and (d) if it is determined that there is consensus amongst the received messages as to what action should be taken with respect to the dispute, then performing an action according to the consensus.

208.content: On either side of the main gate, the fence terminated in a small stone tower with narrow diamond-paned windows set deeply into its walls. The Constable entered one of these from his side of the fence and then opened a heavy wooden door with huge wrought-iron hinges, letting Nell and Harv in from their side. The tiny octagonal room was cluttered with fine furniture made of dark wood, a shelf of old books, and a small cast-iron stove with a red enamel kettle on top, pocked like an asteroid from ancient impacts, piping out a tenuous column of steam.
208.title: Fence at the end of the world
208.abstract: A fence is disclosed. The fence comprises a plurality of panels, wherein each panel has a first side and a second side opposite to the first side; an attachment means for attaching one or more adjacent panels together in order to form a continuous fence along a longitudinal axis extending from the first side to the second side thereof so as to create a barrier between two opposing sides of the fence that are separated by a predetermined distance (e.g., about 0.15 meters), thereby forming a corridor through which it is possible to pass while remaining within the confines of the fence. In some embodiments, the fence may be configured such that only one person can walk through its corridor at any given time without interfering with another person who is already walking through said corridor.

209.content: They were magnificent folio-size volumes, as thick as Princess Nell's hand was broad, bound in rich leather illuminated with hair-thin gilt lines in an elaborate interlace pattern, and closed with heavy brass hasps and locks. The lock on the Book of the Book yielded to the same key that Princess Nell had taken from King Coyote. She had discovered this very early in her exploration of the library but was unable to comprehend the contents of this volume until she had studied the others and learnt the secrets of these machines. The Book of the Book contained a complete set of plans for a magical book that would tell stories to a young person, tailoring them for the child's needs and interests—even teaching them how to read if need be.
209.title: Systems, methods, and computer-readable media for managing digital content
209.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems, methods, and computer-readable media for managing digital content. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication from a first user device associated with a second user device indicating that the second user device is within a predetermined proximity range of the first user device. The method further includes determining whether there is at least one other user device in the predetermined proximity range of either the first user device or the second user device. Responsive to determining that there is at least one other user device in the predetermined proximity range of either the first user device or the second user device, the method also includes transmitting instructions to the at least one other user device instructing the at least one other user device to establish a peer-to-peer (P2P) connection between the first user device and the second user device.

210.content: Each also had a key around his neck. As Princess Nell waited, they deciphered the contents of the books she had brought and punched the results onto strips of paper tape using little machines built into their tables. Then, with great ceremony, the thirteen paper tapes were coiled up and placed on a tremendous silver platter carried by a young altar boy. A pair of large doors was swung open, and the acolytes, the altar boy, and Princess Nell formed into a procession of sorts, which marched into the Chamber of the Wizard, a vast vaulted room, and down its long central aisle.
210.title: Necronomicon
210.abstract: A method of using the Necronomicon is disclosed. In one embodiment, an apparatus comprises a processor and a memory storing instructions executable by the processor to cause the processor to perform operations including receiving input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the input indicates that the user desires to use the Necronomicon; determining whether the user has previously used the Necronomicon within a predetermined period of time; in accordance with a determination that the user has not previously used the Necronomicon within the predetermined period of time, causing at least one image associated with the Necronomicon to be displayed via the GUI; receiving additional input from the user via the GUI; and causing at least one function associated with the Necronomicon to be performed as a result of the additional input. Various other aspects are contemplated.

211.content: Then he looked mildly alarmed as he watched Miranda's expression change. “You can't just trace the connection backward. That's not how media works.” “How does media work, then?”
211.title: Method and system for detecting unauthorized use of media
211.abstract: A method includes receiving, by a computing device from a first user account associated with a first user, an indication that the first user desires to view content provided by a second user account associated with a second user. In response to receiving the indication, the computing device determines whether the first user is authorized to view the content. If the first user is not authorized to view the content, then the computing device prevents the first user from viewing the content. On the other hand, if the first user is authorized to view the content, then the computing device permits the first user to view the content.

212.content: They ate in silence for a few minutes, communicating through eye contact and other subtleties, then spent several minutes exchanging polite formal chatter. “Something struck a chord in my memory,” Judge Fang said, when the time was right to discuss business. “The name Tequila—the mother of the suspect and of the little girl.” “The name has come before our court twice before,” Miss Pao said, and refreshed his memory of two previous cases: one, almost five years ago, in which this woman's lover had been executed, and the second, only a few months ago, a case quite similar to this one . “Ah, yes,” Judge Fang said, “I recall the second case.
212.title: Murder in the Forbidden City: A Detective Liu Mystery (Detective Liu Mysteries Book 1)
212.abstract: A Murder in the Forbidden City: A Detective Liu Mystery (Detective Liu Mysteries Book 1)

213.content: Are you sure you know what you are getting into?” Bud answered by whispering “hut” under his breath and firing a Crippler into the man's right bicep. It went off deep in the muscle, like an M-80, blowing a dark hole in the sleeve of the man's jacket and leaving his arm stretched out nice and straight—the trike now pulling without anything to oppose it. The man clenched his teeth, his eyes bulged, and for a few moments he made strangled grunting noises from way down in his chest, making an effort not to cry out.
213.title: Method and apparatus for securing a rider to a three-wheeled vehicle
213.abstract: A method of securing a rider to a three-wheeled vehicle includes the steps of (a) determining an orientation of the three-wheeled vehicle; (b) identifying at least one wheel of the three-wheeled vehicle that is not in contact with the ground; (c) moving the at least one identified wheel into contact with the ground, thereby changing the orientation of the three-wheeled vehicle from a first orientation to a second orientation different than the first orientation; (d) activating a seat belt restraint system attached to the rider so as to secure the rider to the three-wheeled vehicle; and (e) returning the orientation of the three-wheeled vehicle back to the first orientation. An apparatus for securing a rider to a three-wheeled vehicle may also be provided.

214.content: ” “Slightly taller than average, flashing green eyes, raven hair falling in luxuriant waves to my waist unless I pin it up to emphasize my high cheekbones and full lips. Narrow waist, pert breasts, long legs, alabaster skin that flushes vividly when I am passionate about something, which is frequently.”
214.title: Systems and methods for generating a digital avatar of a user
214.abstract: Implementations described herein relate to systems and methods for generating a digital avatar of a user. In some implementations, the method may include obtaining an image depicting at least a portion of a face of the user; extracting one or more facial features from the image using a trained machine-learning model; determining whether the extracted one or more facial features are within a predetermined threshold of accuracy; in response to determining that the extracted one or more facial features are not within the predetermined threshold of accuracy, iteratively refining the extracted one or more facial features until the extracted one or more facial features are determined to be within the predetermined threshold of accuracy; and upon determining that the extracted one or more facial features are within the predetermined threshold of accuracy, generating a digital avatar of the user having the extracted one or more facial features.

215.content: Then he subjected the corgis to a minute or so of close-order drill, using a patch of moss-covered flagstones as parade ground, and stringently criticizing their performance in tones loud enough to penetrate through the glass doors. The corgis pretended to listen attentively.
215.title: Method and apparatus for training dogs
215.abstract: A method of training a dog includes providing the dog with a first toy, wherein the first toy is configured to emit an audible sound in response to being manipulated by the dog. The method also includes detecting that the dog has interacted with the first toy such that the first toy emits the audible sound. Responsive to detecting that the dog has interacted with the first toy so as to cause the first toy to emit the audible sound, the method further includes providing the dog with a second toy, wherein the second toy is configured to emit a different audible sound in response to being manipulated by the dog. The method additionally includes detecting that the dog has interacted with the second toy such that the second toy emits the different audible sound. Responsive to detecting that the dog has interacted with the second toy so as to cause the

216.content: The gates were guarded by men in armor, presumably backed up by other, less obvious defensive systems. Nell was fairly certain that she was being followed, unobtrusively, by at least three young men who had locked on to her during her initial passage in from the coast, and who were waiting to find out whether she really had somewhere to go or was just faking it.
216.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computer system
216.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computer system includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication that the computing device has been connected to a network. The method also includes determining, by the computing device, one or more operating parameters associated with the computing device. The method further includes comparing, by the computing device, the one or more operating parameters against at least one predetermined threshold value. The method additionally includes determining, by the computing device, whether the comparison results in a match between the one or more operating parameters and the at least one predetermined threshold value. The method still further includes transmitting, by the computing device, via the network, a notification message when it is determined that the comparison results in a match between the one or more operating parameters and the at least one predetermined threshold value.

217.content: But it was clear that in the last few days they had forked and split organically, like roots questing for moisture; clean new tubes forced their way out through the encrustation and ran uphill toward the tide line, splitting again and again until many orifices presented themselves to the refugees. The shoots terminated in lips that grabbed people and drew them in, like the tip of an elephant's trunk, accepting the refugees with a minimum of seawater. The tunnels were lined with mediatronic images urging them forward into the deep; it always seemed as though a warm dry well-lit space awaited them just a bit farther down the line. But the light moved along with the viewer so that they were drawn down the tunnels in a kind of peristalsis. The refugees came to the main tunnel, the old encrusted one, and continued moving on, now packed together in a solid mass, until they were disgorged into a large open cavity far below the surface of the ocean.
217.title: Undersea sanctuary for marine mammals and sea turtles
217.abstract: A system includes an underwater habitat configured to be submerged in water, wherein the underwater habitat comprises at least one interior volume. The system further includes a plurality of animal enclosures disposed within the at least one interior volume of the underwater habitat, wherein each of the plurality of animal enclosures is configured to house a respective marine mammal or sea turtle. Each of the plurality of animal enclosures may include a viewing window that permits observation of the respective marine mammal or sea turtle housed therein.

218.content: “Revolutionary, ain't it?” he snapped. The thing in Hackworth's pocket was a pair of dark sunglasses: wraparounds with a glimmering rainbow finish, the sort of thing that, decades ago, would have been worn by a Magnum-slinging rebel cop in a prematurely canceled television series. Hackworth unfolded them and slid the polished ends of the bows cautiously over his temples. As the lenses approached, he could see light coming from them; they were phenomenoscopes. Though in this context, the word phantascope might have been more appropriate. The image grew to fill his sight but would not focus until he put them all the way on, so he reluctantly plummeted into the hallucination until it resolved, and just then the bows behind his ears came alive, stretched, and grew around the back of his skull like a rubber band snapping in reverse, joining in the back to form an unbreakable band. “Release,” Hackworth said, and then ran through a litany of other standard yuvree commands.
218.title: Apparatus and method for detecting an object in a field of view of a vehicle
218.abstract: A system includes at least one sensor configured to generate data indicative of objects within a field of view of the apparatus. A processor is coupled to the at least one sensor, wherein the processor is configured to process the data generated by the at least one sensor to determine whether or not there is an object detected within the field of view that meets predetermined criteria. In response to determining that there is an object meeting the predetermined criteria present within the field of view, the processor is further configured to cause display of information associated with the object determined to meet the predetermined criteria via a graphical user interface (GUI).

219.content: They assumed that they were being monitored, but they never really knew. When they entered, each one of them had a pile of books on her desk—old books bound in chafed leather. Their job was to copy the books out by hand and leave the pages neatly stacked on Miss Stricken's desk before they went home. Usually, the books were transcripts of debates from the House of Lords, from the nineteenth century. During their seventh Saturday in Supplementary Curriculum, Elizabeth Finkle-McGraw suddenly dropped her pen, slammed her book shut, and threw it against the wall.
219.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for providing supplementary curriculum to students. One of the methods includes receiving, from a first student device associated with a first student, a request to

The method additionally includes determining an amount of time during which the first student has played the video game; in response to determining that the amount of time exceeds a predetermined threshold, identifying one or more learning objectives related to the video game; and causing presentation of information relating to the one or more learning objectives via the first student device. Yet another method includes receiving, from a first student device associated with a first student, a request to play a video game that is provided by a second student device associated with a second student. The method additionally includes determining an amount of time during which the first student has played the video game; in response to determining that the amount of time exceeds a predetermined threshold, obtaining feedback data regarding performance of the first student relative to performance of the second student while playing the video game; and causing presentation of

220.content: The hatboxes were stacked on one of the carts; his bowler went into the smallest and topmost box, which was empty, and then he yanked the largest box out from underneath, popping the stack, and took out a ten-gallon Stetson of breathtaking width and sweep, almost like a head-mounted umbrella. Casting an eye into the street, where a rushing brown stream carried litter, road dust, cholera-ridden sewage, and tons of captive nanotech toward the storm drains, he slipped off his leather shoes and exchanged them for a pair of hand-tooled cowboy boots, made from hides of gaudy reptiles and avians, the pores of which had been corked with mites that would keep his feet dry even if he chose to wade through the gutters. Thus reconfigured, Carl Hollywood stepped out into the streets of Shanghai.
220.title: Shanghai nocturne: a novel of the 2010 Shanghai World Expo
220.abstract: The present disclosure relates to a system and method for managing an event. In one embodiment, at least one processor is in communication with at least one memory device. The at least one memory device stores machine readable instructions that, when executed by the at least one processor, cause the at least one processor to perform operations comprising receiving information associated with an event; determining whether the received information satisfies predetermined criteria; upon determining that the received information satisfies the predetermined criteria, storing the received information in a database; and providing access to the stored information via a user interface.

221.content: “The internal variables of the play depend on the total universe of information outside—” The woman nodded vigorously, quite pleased with him, her huge black eyes shining. Hackworth continued, “As, for example, a person's state of mind at any given moment might depend on the relative concentrations of innumerable chemical compounds circulating through his bloodstream.” “Yes,” the woman said, “like if you're in a pub being chatted up by a fetching young gentleman, the words coming out of your mouth are affected by the amount of alcohol you've put into your system, and, of course, by concentrations of natural hormones—again, not in a simple deterministic way—these things are all inputs.” “I think I'm beginning to get your meaning,” Hackworth said. “Substitute tonight's show for the brain, and the information flowing across the net for molecules flowing through the bloodstream, and you have it,” the woman said.
221.title: Method and apparatus for simulating human behavior
221.abstract: A method of simulating human behavior is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication of one or more behaviors to be simulated in a virtual environment (VE), wherein the one or more behaviors are selected from at least one of walking, running, jumping, crouching, kneeling, sitting, lying down, picking up an object, dropping an object, throwing an object, catching an object, opening a door, closing a door, entering through a door, exiting through a door, climbing stairs, descending stairs, driving a vehicle, riding as a passenger in a vehicle, operating machinery, interacting with another avatar within the VE, using a computer application within the VE, playing a video game within the VE, eating, drinking, vomiting, urinating, defecating, sneezing, coughing

222.content: Hackworth walked across the parking lot toward the McDonald's, followed at a respectful distance by one of the soldiers. Another soldier opened the door for him, and Hackworth sighed with delight as cold dry air flowed over his face and began to chase the muggy stuff through the weave of his clothing.
222.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining a location of a vehicle in a drive-thru lane of a fast food restaurant are disclosed herein. In one embodiment, a method includes receiving, by a
222.abstract: A system for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), the system comprising at least one processor coupled to a non-transitory memory storing instructions executable by the at least one processor to cause the at least one processor to control flight of the UAV over a predetermined path from a first position to a second position; determine that the UAV has deviated from the predetermined path while flying along the predetermined path; responsive to determining that the UAV has deviated from the predetermined path, recalculating the predetermined path using updated data associated with the UAV; and controlling the UAV to fly according to the recalculated predetermined path.

223.content: As she laid out plates and silver, Hackworth picked up a large sheet of blank paper. “The usual,” he said, and then the paper was no longer blank; now it was the front page of the Times. Hackworth got all the news that was appropriate to his station in life, plus a few optional services: the latest from his favorite cartoonists and columnists around the world; clippings on various peculiar crackpot subjects forwarded to him by his father, ever anxious that he had not, even after all this time, sufficiently edified his son; and stories relating to the Uitlanders—a subphyle of New Atlantis, consisting of persons of British ancestry who had fled South Africa several decades previously. Hackworth's mother was an Uitlander, so he subscribed to the service. A gentleman of higher rank and more far-reaching responsibilities would probably get different information written in a different way, and the top stratum of New Chusan actually got the Times on paper, printed out by a big antique press that did a run of a hundred or so, every morning at about three A.M. That the highest levels of the society received news written with ink on paper said much about the steps New Atlantis had taken to distinguish itself from other phyles. Now nanotechnology had made nearly anything possible, and so the cultural role in deciding what should be done with it had become far more important than imagining what could be done with it. One of the insights of the Victorian Revival was that it was not necessarily a good thing for everyone to read a completely different newspaper in the morning; so the higher one rose in the society, the more similar one's Times became to one's peers'.
223.title: New Atlantis: a novel of the twenty-second century
223.abstract: A method and apparatus are disclosed for providing an automated system that can be utilized to generate, in real time, one or more customized versions of New Atlantis: A Novel of the Twenty-Second Century (hereinafter referred to as NEW ATLANTIS). In various embodiments, the methods and apparatus described herein may allow users to select from among several different types of content associated with NEW ATLANTIS. The selected content may then be incorporated into each user's version of NEW ATLANTIS such that no two copies of NEW ATLANTIS will be exactly alike. Users may also have the ability to add additional content to their copy of NEW ATLANTIS.

224.content: As he made his way through the corridors toward the upper deck where his airship awaited him, he reviewed for the thousandth time the Great Learning, the kernel of the Master's thought: The ancients who wished to demonstrate illustrious virtue throughout the kingdom, first ordered well their own states. Wishing to order well their states, they first regulated their families. Wishing to regulate their families, they first cultivated their persons. Wishing to cultivate their persons, they first rectified their hearts. Wishing to rectify their hearts, they first sought to be sincere in their thoughts. Wishing to be sincere in their thoughts, they first extended to the utmost their knowledge. Such extention of knowledge lay in the investigation of things.
224.title: Airship and method of operation thereof
224.abstract: An airship includes a plurality of bladders that are inflated or deflated to control the buoyancy of the airship. A propulsion system is configured to move the airship through an environment. An imaging system is configured to capture one or more images of the environment as the airship moves through the environment. One or more sensors are coupled to the airship, wherein the one or more sensors are configured to collect data from the environment while the airship moves through the environment.

225.content: But this was said to have its drawbacks: some concerns about long-term nerve damage, plus it was rumored that hackers for big media companies had figured out a way to get through the defenses that were built into such systems, and run junk advertisements in your peripheral vision (or even spang in the fucking middle) all the time—even when your eyes were closed. Bud knew a guy like that who'd somehow gotten infected with a meme that ran advertisements for roach motels, in Hindi, superimposed on the bottom right-hand corner of his visual field, twenty-four hours a day, until the guy whacked himself.
225.title: Augmented reality contact lenses
225.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems, methods, and computer-readable storage media for providing an augmented reality (AR) experience to a user. In some implementations, one or more processors may obtain image data corresponding to an eye of a user. The one or more processors may identify at least one portion of the image data that corresponds to a pupil of the eye. The one or more processors may determine whether the identified portion of the image data is within a predetermined threshold distance from a center of the pupil. Responsive to determining that the identified portion of the image data is not within the predetermined threshold distance from the center of the pupil, the one or more processors may apply AR effects to the image data. Otherwise, the one or more processors may refrain from applying AR effects to the image data.

226.content: He fed the papers back into the copier and told it to destroy them. He thrust his fists into his trouser pockets and walked up and down the length of the room twice, then sat down again, looking not at Nell and Harv and not at the book, but somewhere off into the distance. “Right,” he said. “I will not confiscate the book during your stay in Dovetail, if you follow certain conditions. First of all, you will not under any circumstances make use of a matter compiler. Secondly, the book is for your use, and your use only. Third, you will not copy or reproduce any of the information contained in the book. Fourth, you will not show the book to anyone here or make anyone aware of its existence. Violation of any of these conditions will lead to your immediate expulsion from Dovetail and the confiscation and probable destruction of the book. Do I make myself clear?”
226.title: Dovetail
226.abstract: A dovetail includes an elongated body having a first end and a second end opposite the first end. The dovetail further includes a plurality of slots extending from the first end to the second end, wherein at least one of the plurality of slots is configured to receive a fastener for securing the dovetail to a workpiece.

227.content: The Constable returned his attention to the piece of paper and scanned it with a furrowed brow for a few minutes before suddenly calling out a series of several numbers, which sounded random to his visitors but seemed both deeply significant and perfectly obvious to the Constable. The black telephone sported a metal disk with finger-size holes bored around its edge. The Constable hooked the phone's handset over his epaulet and then began to insert his finger into various of these holes, using them to torque the disk around against the countervailing force of a spring. A brief but exceedingly cheerful conversation ensued.
227.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with an extraterrestrial intelligence
227.abstract: A method of communicating with an extraterrestrial intelligence (ETI) includes transmitting, to the ETI, a plurality of pulses. Each pulse in the plurality of pulses is comprised of one or more sub-pulses that are separated from each other by a predetermined amount of time. In response to receiving the plurality of pulses, the ETI determines whether at least two of the sub-pulses have overlapped during transmission of the plurality of pulses. Responsive to it being determined that at least two of the sub-pulses have overlapped during transmission of the plurality of pulses, the ETI modulates future transmissions of the plurality of pulses such that there is no overlap between successive sub-pulses included in subsequent transmissions of the plurality of pulses

228.content: It was made of star-shaped connectors where five or six cigarette-size rods would come together, the rods and connectors forming into an irregular web that wrapped around into a geodesic space frame. The rods could change their length. Hackworth knew from seeing the same construction elsewhere that the web could change its size and shape to an amazing degree while providing whatever combination of stiffness and flexibility the controlling system needed at the moment. Inside the space frame Hackworth could see aluminum-plated spheres and ellipsoids, no doubt vacuum-filled, containing the mount's machine-phase guts: basically some rod logic and an energy source.
