The legs compiled quickly, the complicated feet took a little longer.
228.title: Method and apparatus for assembling a multi-legged walking machine
228.abstract: A method of assembling a multi-legged walking machine includes providing a plurality of legs, wherein each leg is configured to move relative to an adjacent leg in at least one degree of freedom. The method also includes arranging the plurality of legs such that they are substantially coplanar with one another so as to form a flat surface therebetween.

229.content: He unscrewed the bulges on his mask and took out black things that kicked up little black dust storms when he tossed them onto the floor. He replaced them with a couple of white things that he took from a Nanobar wrapper, though by the time he was finished, the white things were covered with his black fingerprints, the ridges and whorls perfectly resolved. He held the Nanobar wrapper up to the light for a moment. “Early protocol,” he rasped, and pitched it toward the wastebasket. Then he held the mask up to Nell's face, guided the straps around her head, and tightened them down. Her long hair got caught in the buckles and pinched, but her objections were muffled by the mask.
229.title: Apparatus and method for treating a respiratory illness caused by SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19), MERS-CoV (MERS), SARS-CoV (SARS
229.abstract: Provided is an apparatus for treating a respiratory illness caused by SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19), MERS-CoV (MERS), SARS-CoV (SARS), or the like, wherein the apparatus comprises: a first chamber configured to receive exhaled air from a patient suffering from the respiratory illness; a second chamber positioned downstream of the first chamber in fluid communication with the first chamber; a third chamber positioned downstream of the second chamber in fluid communication with the second chamber; a fourth chamber positioned downstream of the third chamber in fluid communication with the third chamber; a fifth chamber positioned downstream of the fourth chamber in fluid communication with the fourth chamber; a sixth chamber positioned downstream of the fifth chamber in fluid communication with the fifth chamber; a seventh chamber positioned downstream of the sixth chamber in fluid communication with the sixth

230.content: Judge Fang flew out to the one named (as best it could be translated into English) Generosity of Soul, personally carrying the M.C. program in the sleeve of his garment. This was the very ship he had visited on the eventful night of his boat ride with Dr. X, and ever since then he had somehow felt closer to these fifty thousand little mice than any of the other quarter-million in the other vessels. The program was written to work in a bulk compiler, extruding dozens of Primers each cycle. When the first batch was finished, Judge Fang plucked out one of the new volumes, inspected its cover, which had the appearance of marbled jade, flipped through the pages admiring the illustrations, and cast a critical eye over the calligraphy. Then he carried it down a corridor and into a playroom where a few hundred little mice were running around, blowing off steam.
230.title: Method and apparatus for generating primers for use in nucleic acid amplification reactions
230.abstract: A method of determining the sequence of one or more target polynucleotides is disclosed. The method comprises providing a plurality of oligonucleotides, wherein at least some of the oligonucleotides are complementary to portions of the target polynucleotide; incubating the plurality of oligonucleotides with the target polynucleotide under conditions suitable for hybridization between the oligonucleotides and the target polynucleotide; separating non-hybridized oligonucleotides from hybridized oligonucleotides so as to produce a population of hybridized oligonucleotides; sequencing the population of hybridized oligonucleotides to determine the sequence of the target polynucleotide.

231.content: “In any case,” Hackworth continued, “Trickster/Technologist is just one of the universals. The database is full of them. It's a catalogue of the collective unconscious. In the old days, writers of children's books had to map these universals onto concrete symbols familiar to their audience—like Beatrix Potter mapping the Trickster onto Peter Rabbit. This is a reasonably effective way to do it, especially if the society is homogeneous and static, so that all children share similar experiences. “What my team and I have done here is to abstract that process and develop systems for mapping the universals onto the unique psychological terrain of one child—even as that terrain changes over time. Hence it is important that you not allow this book to fall into the hands of any other little girl until Elizabeth has the opportunity to open it up.” “Understood,” said Lord Alexander Chung-Sik Finkle-McGraw.
231.title: Systems and methods for personalized storytelling
231.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for generating, displaying, and interacting with augmented reality (AR) stories. In some implementations, an AR story may be generated that includes one or more virtual objects to be displayed in conjunction with real-world imagery captured by a user's device. The AR story may then be transmitted to the user's device where it may be presented as part of a viewfinder application running on the user's device. As the user captures real-world imagery through the viewfinder application using the camera of the user's device, additional virtual objects may be added to the AR story at various locations relative to the real-world imagery such that the virtual objects appear superimposed over the real-world imagery within the viewfinder application. Upon receiving input from the user indicating that they are finished capturing real-world imagery via the viewfinder application, the AR story including

232.content: The setting was the front of a luxury hotel, one of the archipelago of Shangri-Las strung up the Kowloon-Guangzhou superhighway. The horseshoe drive was paved with interlocking blocks, brass door handles gleamed, thickets of tropical flowers sprouted from boat-size planters in the lobby. Men in business suits spoke into cellphones and checked their watches, white-gloved bellhops sprinted into the drive, pulled suitcases from the trunks of red taxicabs, wiped them down with clean moist cloths. The horseshoe drive was plugged into an eight-lane thoroughfare—not the highway, but a mere frontage road—with a spiked iron fence running down the center to keep pedestrians from crossing in midblock.
232.title: Systems and methods for managing hotel room reservations
232.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for providing an interface that allows a user to reserve one or more rooms in a hotel. In some implementations, the system may be configured to receive information associated with a plurality of check-in/check-out time slots corresponding to each day of a predetermined number of days (e.g., seven days). The system may also be configured to determine whether there are any overlapping check-in/check-out time slots among the plurality of check-in/check-out time slots. If no overlapping check-in/check-out time slots are determined, then the system may be configured to generate a visual representation of at least one reserved room pertaining to those non-overlapping check-in/check-out time slots. Otherwise, the system may be configured to modify the plurality of check-in/check-out time

233.content: “Nell,” the Constable continued, indicating through his tone of voice that the lesson was concluding, “the difference between ignorant and educated people is that the latter know more facts. But that has nothing to do with whether they are stupid or intelligent. The difference between stupid and intelligent people—and this is true whether or not they are well-educated—is that intelligent people can handle subtlety. They are not baffled by ambiguous or even contradictory situations—in fact, they expect them and are apt to become suspicious when things seem overly straightforward. “In your Primer you have a resource that will make you highly educated, but it will never make you intelligent. That comes from life. Your life up to this point has given you all of the experience you need to be intelligent, but you have to think about those experiences.
233.title: Method and apparatus for training an artificial general intelligence
233.abstract: A method of training an artificial general intelligence (AGI) is disclosed. The method comprises receiving, by the AGI, one or more input data sets; determining, by the AGI from the one or more input data sets, one or more output data sets; comparing, by the AGI, the one or more output data sets to at least one pre-determined set of desired outputs; identifying, by the AGI, errors in the one or more output data sets that do not match the at least one pre-determined set of desired outputs; modifying, by the AGI, the one or more output data sets so as to remove the identified errors therein; and updating, by the AGI, its knowledge base with the modified one or more output data sets.

234.content: In other R.D.R. nodes, the mechanism might be different. For example, person A might go into a room, take a pistol out of a box, load it with live ammunition, put it back in the box, and then leave the room for ten minutes. During that time, person B is supposed to enter the room and replace the live ammunition with a dummy clip having the same weight. Then person A comes back into the room, puts the gun to his head, and pulls the trigger.” “But person A has no way of knowing whether person B has done his job?” “Exactly.” “What is the role of the third person?” “A proctor. An official of the R.D.R. who sees to it that the two participants don't try to communicate.” “How frequently must they undergo this ritual?”
234.title: Method and apparatus for verifying the authenticity of an object
234.abstract: A method is disclosed for verifying the authenticity of an object. The method comprises obtain 1) acquiring at least one image of the object; 2) extracting, from the at least one image, a plurality of features representative of the object; 3) comparing the plurality of features with reference data to determine whether there is a match between the plurality of features and the reference data; and 4) determining that the object is authentic if it is determined that there is a match between the plurality of features and the reference data. An apparatus for carrying out the method is also disclosed.

235.content: These guys implanted it in the iliac crest of the pelvis, some opted for the mastoid bone in the skull—anywhere a big bone was close to the surface. A bone mount was needed because the card had to talk on the radio, which meant it needed an antenna long enough to hear radio waves. Then you could go around and buy stuff just by asking for it; Peacock Bank and the merchant you were buying from and the card in your pelvis handled all the details. Banks varied in their philosophy of interest rates, minimum monthly payments, and so on.
235.title: Method and apparatus for conducting a transaction between a customer and a merchant
235.abstract: A method of conducting a transaction between a customer and a merchant is provided. The method comprises the steps of receiving, at a point-of-sale (PoS) terminal, an indication from a mobile device associated with the customer indicating that the customer wishes to pay for goods or services offered by the merchant; determining whether the PoS terminal has sufficient funds to complete the transaction; in response to it being determined that the PoS terminal does not have sufficient funds to complete the transaction, transmitting information relating to the transaction to a payment service provider via a communications network; obtaining approval from the payment service provider to complete the transaction; and completing the transaction using the approval obtained from the payment service provider. Corresponding systems and computer program products are also provided.

236.content: She would sit with her back against a rock, read her Primer, and occasionally hear sound emanating from the inside of Constable Moore's house as he talked on the mediatron: mostly deep bellowing laughter and explosions of good-natured profanity. For quite some time she assumed that it was not the Constable who was making these sounds, but rather whomever he was talking to; because in her presence the Constable was always very polite and reserved, albeit somewhat eccentric. But one night she heard loud moaning noises coming from his house, and crept down out of the bamboo grove to see what was happening.
236.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with an extraterrestrial
236.abstract: A method of communicating with an extraterrestrial is disclosed. The method includes transmitting, to the extraterrestrial, a plurality of pulses at a first frequency; receiving, from the extraterrestrial, a plurality of response pulses at a second frequency that is different than the first frequency; determining one or more characteristics of the response pulses by comparing the response pulses to corresponding ones of the received pulses; and adjusting the first frequency in accordance with the determined one or more characteristics of the response pulses. An apparatus for communicating with an extraterrestrial is also disclosed. In some embodiments, the apparatus comprises a transmitter configured to transmit a plurality of pulses at a first frequency; a receiver configured to receive a plurality of response pulses at a second frequency that is different than the first frequency; a processor configured to

237.content: The operators of the big wall-size mediatrons that had so terrified Nell on her first night in the Leased Territories had turned the brightness all the way up, trying to compensate for the fog. Down by the waterfront, not far from the Aerodrome, the compilers of New Chusan had, as a charitable gesture, made some space available to the Vatican. In the early years it had contained nothing more than a two-story mission for thetes who had followed their lifestyle to its logical conclusion and found themselves homeless, addicted, hounded by debtors, or on the run from the law or abusive members of their own families. More recently those had become secondary functions, and the Vatican had programmed the building's foundation to extrude many more stories. The Vatican had a number of serious ethical concerns about nanotech but had eventually decided that it was okay as long as it didn't mess about with DNA or create direct interfaces with the human brain. Using nanotech to extrude buildings was fine, and that was fortunate, because Vatican/Shanghai needed to add a couple of floors to the Free Phthisis Sanatorium every year.
237.title: Apparatus and method for mounting a mediatron
237.abstract: A device for mounting a mediatron to a patient's body, comprising at least one first support element (10) configured to be fixed to the patient's body. At least one second support element (20) is movable with respect to the first support element (10). A mediatron (30) is arranged between the first support element (10) and the second support element (20), wherein the movement of the second support element (20) relative to the first support element (10) allows an adjustment of the position of the mediatron (30) in relation to the patient's body. An actuator (40) is provided for moving the second support element (20) relative to the first support element (10).

238.content: When he finally reached the grand chamber, he could not really tell whether it was reality or another machine-made hallucination. It was shaped like a flattened ice-cream cone, a domed ceiling above a gently sloping conical floor. The ceiling was a vast mediatron, and the floor served as an amphitheatre.
238.title: Augmented reality in a virtual environment
238.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for providing an augmented reality (AR) experience. In one implementation, a method includes determining that a user is viewing a physical object through a head-mounted device (HMD), wherein the HMD comprises at least one camera configured to capture image data associated with the physical object viewed by the user wearing the HMD. The method also includes identifying additional information about the physical object from the image data captured by the at least one camera while the user is viewing the physical object using the HMD. Additionally, the method includes overlaying the additional information onto the physical object as seen through the HMD such that the additional information is overlaid onto the physical object when the user views the physical object through the HMD.

239.content: Almost twenty years ago, you co- founded a CryptNet node in Oakland, California. It was a very early node—number 178. Now, of course, there are tens of thousands of nodes.” A hint of a smile from the prisoner.
239.title: Systems and methods for providing secure communications over an unsecured network
239.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for transmitting data between two or more devices. In one implementation, a method includes receiving, by a first computing device from a second computing device, a request to initiate a communication session with the second computing device; determining, by the first computing device, whether the second computing device is authorized to communicate with the first computing device; in response to determining that the second computing device is authorized to communicate with the first computing device, establishing, by the first computing device, a trusted connection with the second computing device; sending, by the first computing device to the second computing device via the trusted connection, at least a portion of the requested data; and terminating, by the first computing device, the trusted connection upon completion of the communication session. Various other aspects are contemplated.

240.content: The payer is someone else. You need to backtrace the payer and then, from there, track down Nell.”
240.title: Systems and methods for detecting fraudulent transactions
240.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting fraudulent transactions. In one implementation, a method includes receiving transaction data associated with a plurality of transactions; determining that at least one of the plurality of transactions is suspected to be fraudulent; in response to determining that at least one of the plurality of transactions is suspected to be fraudulent, identifying an entity associated with the at least one of the plurality of transactions that is suspected to be fraudulent

241.content: Somewhat to her alarm, she did see an inordinate number of chains. The chains were all of the same, somewhat peculiar design, and she saw them everywhere: piled up in heaps on streetcorners, overflowing from metal baskets, dangling from rooftops, strung between towers. The clanking and squeaking of the men who bore her along made it difficult for her to hear anything else; but as they proceeded higher and deeper into the castle, she slowly became conscious of a deep grinding, growling noise that pervaded the very ashlars.
241.title: Systems and methods for chain-based data storage and retrieval
241.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for storing and retrieving data. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an input comprising a plurality of chains wherein each chain in the plurality of chains is associated with at least one blockchain; determining whether there are any conflicts between the plurality of chains; responsive to determining that there are no conflicts between the plurality of chains, combining the plurality of chains into a consolidated chain by merging blocks from respective ones of the plurality of chains according to predetermined rules; and storing the consolidated chain as a new blockchain. Implementations of the present disclosure also include computer-readable media having instructions stored thereon that when executed result in performing operations of the present disclosure.

242.content: Then Dr. X himself quivered up out of his chair and began shuffling around the room, powering up a gallimaufry of contraband technology. This equipment came from diverse technological epochs and had been smuggled into this, the Outer Kingdom, from a variety of sources, but all of it contributed to the same purpose: It surveyed the microscopic world through X-ray diffraction, electron microscopy, and direct nanoscale probing, and synthesized all of the resulting information into a single three-dimensional view. If Hackworth had been doing this at work, he would already be finished, but Dr. X's system was a sort of Polish democracy requiring full consent of all participants, elicited one subsystem at a time. Dr. X and his assistants would gather around whichever subsystem was believed to be farthest out of line and shout at each other in a mixture of Shanghainese, Mandarin, and technical English for a while. Therapies administered included but were not limited to: turning things off, then on again; picking them up a couple of inches and then dropping them; turning off nonessential appliances in this and other rooms; removing lids and wiggling circuit boards; extracting small contaminants, such as insects and their egg cases, with nonconducting chopsticks; cable-wiggling; incense-burning; putting folded-up pieces of paper beneath table legs; drinking tea and sulking; invoking unseen powers; sending runners to other rooms, buildings, or precincts with exquisitely calligraphed notes and waiting for them to come back carrying spare parts in dusty, yellowed cardboard boxes; and a similarly diverse suite of troubleshooting techniques in the realm of software. Much of this performance seemed to be genuine, the rest merely for Hackworth's consumption, presumably laying the groundwork for a renegotiation of the deal. Eventually they were looking at the severed portion of John Percival Hackworth on a meter-wide sheet of mediatronic paper that one of the assistants had, with great ceremony, unfurled across a low, black lacquer table. They sought something that was bulky by nanotech standards, so the magnification was not very high—even so, the surface of Hackworth's skin looked like a table heaped with crumpled newspapers.
242.title: A nanotechnology and molecular assembler fabrication method and apparatus therefor. The present invention relates to a nanotechnology and molecular assembler fabrication method and apparatus therefor. More particularly, the present
242.abstract: method for fabricating a nanotechnology and molecular assembler includes providing a substrate; depositing a plurality of first electrodes onto the substrate; forming a plurality of second electrodes between the plurality of first electrodes; etching each of the plurality of first electrodes so as to form a plurality of protruded portions at an end of each of the plurality of first electrodes; attaching a plurality of microelectromechanical systems (MEMS) actuators to respective ones of the plurality of protruded portions such that each of the plurality of MEMS actuators is attached to one of the plurality of protruded portions by means of a conductive adhesive; electrically connecting each of the plurality of MEMS actuators to a corresponding one of the plurality of second electrodes; and

243.content: Through the window, Nell could see Rita putting a calling-card on a silver tray held out by the maid—a salver, they called it. The maid carried it back, then emerged a couple of minutes later and directed Rita into the back of the house.
243.title: Widow of Malabar hill
243.abstract: A new cultivar of Malabar spinach named Widow of Malabar Hill is disclosed, characterized by its upright to semi-spreading plant habit; dark green colored foliage; and medium sized fruit.

244.content: After a few seconds, the first of the letters began to blink. Nell prodded it. The letter grew until it had pushed all the other letters and pictures off the edges of the page. The loop on top shrank and became a head, while the lines sticking out the bottom developed into legs and began to scissor. “R is for Run,” the book said. The picture kept on changing until it was a picture of Nell. Then something fuzzy and red appeared beneath her feet. “Nell Runs on the Red Rug,” the book said, and as it spoke, new words appeared.
244.title: Systems and methods for interactive storytelling
244.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for interactive storytelling. In one implementation, a method is performed at an electronic device with one or more processors executing one or more programs stored in a non-transitory memory, the method comprising: receiving input from a user; determining that the received input corresponds to a selection of a first character among a plurality of characters depicted in a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein each of the plurality of characters are associated with a respective portion of a storyline; identifying a subset of portions of the storyline corresponding to the selected first character; updating the GUI to reflect the identified subset of portions of the storyline; and causing display of the updated GUI.

245.content: They have resurfaced in the Middle Kingdom.” “You must have been struck by the coincidence—that a judge who is in the habit of caning people enters the service of the Middle Kingdom, and shortly thereafter, a New Atlantan engineer returns from a visit to said clave bearing marks of having been caned.” “Now that you mention it, it is quite striking,” Major Napier said. The Equity Lord said, “It might lead one to conclude that the engineer in question owed some debt to a powerful figure within that clave, and that the judicial system was being used as a sort of collection agency.”
245.title: Method and apparatus for enforcement of compliance with contractual obligations
245.abstract: A method, system, and computer program product to enforce compliance with contractual obligations are provided. The present invention includes receiving an indication that one or more conditions have not been satisfied by at least one party to a contractual obligation; determining whether the non-satisfaction of the condition(s) constitutes a violation of the terms of the contractual obligation; responsive to a determination that the non-satisfaction of the condition(s) does not constitute a violation of the terms of the contractual obligation, transmitting information regarding the non-satisfaction of the condition(s) to another party to the contractual obligation; and responsive to a determination that the non-satisfaction of the condition(s) constitutes a violation of the terms of the contractual obligation, imposing a sanction against the party who failed to satisfy the condition(s).

246.content: Hackworth bent down, laced his fingers through the space frame, and lifted the chevaline with one hand. He carried it through the lobby of the post office, past bemused customers, and out the door onto the street. “Mount,” he said. The chevaline rose into a crouch. Hackworth threw one leg over its saddle, which was padded with some kind of elastomeric stuff, and immediately felt it shoving him into the air.
246.title: Method and apparatus for interplanetary travel
246.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by the UAV, one or more instructions from a ground control station (GCS), wherein the one or more instructions instruct the UAV to perform at least one maneuver while in transit between Earth and Mars. The method further includes performing the at least one maneuver according to the one or more instructions received from the GCS.

247.content: “What is the goal of this organisation?” Fiona asked. “It represents itself as a simple, moderately successful data-processing collective. But its actual goals can only be known by those privileged to be included within the trust boundary of the thirty-third level,” Hackworth said, his voice slowing down as he tried to remember why he knew all of these things. “It is rumoured that, within that select circle, any member can kill any other simply by thinking of the deed.”
247.title: Systems and methods for managing access to information
247.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing access to information. In one implementation, a method is performed at an electronic device with one or more processors executing one or more programs stored in a non-transitory memory, the method comprises receiving, by the electronic device from a first user account associated with a first user, a request to add a second user account associated with a second user to a group that includes the first user account; adding, by the electronic device, the second user account to the group including the first user account; determining, by the electronic device, whether each of the first user account and the second user account has been granted permission to share data within the group; and granting, by the electronic device, permission to share data within the group to each of the first user account and the second user account upon determining that each of the first user account and the second user account have been granted permission to share data within the group.

248.content: Another spear, at right angles to the first one. “Though,” Chang continued, “if some criminal activity has taken place of which I was not made aware, perhaps I should recharacterize this visit.” Spear number three; now Hackworth's pounding heart sat at the origin of a bloody coordinate system plotted by Lieutenant Chang, conveniently pinned and exposed for thorough examination.
248.title: Computer-implemented systems and methods for detecting anomalies in network traffic
248.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure provide computer-implemented systems and methods for detecting anomalies in network traffic. In one implementation, a method is performed by at least one processing device that includes obtaining data from a plurality of sensors configured to generate sensor data indicative of events occurring within an information technology (IT) environment; determining whether each event included in the sensor data satisfies a predefined set of rules associated with normal operation of the IT environment; responsive to determining that none of the events included in the sensor data satisfy the predefined set of rules, identifying an anomaly in the sensor data; and generating an alert corresponding to the anomaly. Other implementations are also described herein.

249.content: In the last few weeks, since Nell had entered the domain of King Coyote, the character of the Primer had changed. Formerly, her Night Friends or other characters had acted with minds of their own, even if Nell just went along passively. Reading the Primer had always meant racting with other characters in the book while also having to think her way through various interesting situations.
249.title: Method and apparatus for interactive storytelling
249.abstract: A method of interactive storytelling is disclosed. The method includes receiving, at an electronic device from a user, a selection of one or more characters to participate in a story; determining that the selected character(s) has/have not previously participated in the story; presenting content associated with the determined character(s), wherein the content comprises information about the determined character(s); responsive to receipt of input from the user indicating acceptance of the determined character(s), adding the determined character(s) to the list of participants in the story such that the determined character(s) have already participated in the story; and causing presentation of additional content relating to the added character(s). Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

250.content: Carl levered in another shell and then let the rifle dangle from one hand, pointed down at the street, where it wouldn't be so conspicuous. He got the other hand into Spence's armpit and helped him continue down the street.
250.title: Method and apparatus for assisting a person with reduced mobility
250.abstract: A method of assisting a person with reduced mobility (PRM) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: obtaining data from at least one sensor associated with an environment in which the PRM is located; processing the data to determine that the PRM requires assistance, wherein determining that the PRM requires assistance comprises comparing the data obtained from the at least one sensor against pre-determined thresholds; transmitting information relating to the determined need for assistance to a user device carried by the PRM via a wireless communication network; receiving instructions from the user device as to how to provide assistance to the PRM; and providing assistance to the PRM according to the instructions received from the user device. A corresponding system and computer program product are also disclosed.

251.content: The line of tanks was referred to as a cascade, a rather abstract bit of engineer's whimsy lost on the tourists who did not see anything snapshot-worthy there. All the action took place in the walls separating the tanks, which were not really walls but nearly infinite grids of submicroscopic wheels, ever-rotating and many-spoked. Each spoke grabbed a nitrogen or water molecule on the dirty side and released it after spinning around to the clean side.
251.title: Method and apparatus for treating wastewater
251.abstract: A method of treating wastewater is disclosed. The method includes introducing the wastewater into an aeration tank, wherein the wastewater comprises hydrogen sulfide (H2S), ammonia (NH3), methane (CH4), carbon dioxide (CO2), nitrogen (N) and/or oxygen (O). The method further includes removing at least a portion of the H2S from the wastewater in the aeration tank to produce treated wastewater.

252.content: “It's a way of creating mutual dependency. These people know they can trust each other. In a tribe such as the F.D.R., whose view of the universe contains no absolutes, this ritual creates an artificial absolute.” The woman finished her hot drink, shook hands with the proctor, then began to ascend a polymer ladder, fixed to the rock, that took her back toward her horse. Hackworth spurred Kidnapper into movement, following a path that ran parallel to the base of the cliff, and rode for half a kilometer or so until it was joined by another path angling down from above. A few minutes later, the woman approached, riding her horse, an old-fashioned biological model.
252.title: Apparatus and method for securing a toilet seat to a toilet bowl
252.abstract: An apparatus for securing a toilet seat to a toilet bowl is disclosed. The apparatus comprises an elongated member having a first end and a second end, wherein the first end of the elongated member is configured to be inserted into the toilet bowl such that at least a portion of the elongated member resides within the toilet bowl when the toilet seat is secured to the toilet bowl with the elongated member; and a locking mechanism coupled to the second end of the elongated member, wherein the locking mechanism is configured to secure the toilet seat to the toilet bowl via the elongated member. A method for securing a toilet seat to a toilet bowl using the apparatus is also disclosed.

253.content: So his identity has remained a mystery.” Chang reached into his breast pocket and pulled out a folded sheet of paper. “Mr. Hackworth, please tell me whether you recognize any of the figures in this clip.” “I'm actually rather busy—” Hackworth said, but Chang unfolded the paper in front of him and gave it a command in Shanghainese. Initially the page was covered with static Chinese characters. Then a large panel in the middle opened up and began to play back a cine feed.
253.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a person
253.abstract: A method of identifying a person is provided. The method includes obtaining, by one or more processors, biometric data associated with the person; determining, by the one or more processors, that the biometric data corresponds to at least one pre-stored biometric template in a plurality of pre-stored biometric templates; generating, by the one or more processors, a set of feature vectors from the biometric data; providing, by the one or more processors, the set of feature vectors to an artificial neural network (ANN); receiving, by the one or more processors, a response from the ANN indicative of a match between the set of feature vectors and information corresponding to the at least one pre-stored biometric template; and performing, by the one or more processors, at least one action based on the received response. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

254.content: Tourists, aerobicizing pensioners, and ranks of uniformed schoolchildren marched through it year in and year out, peering through walls of glass (actually solid diamond, which was cheaper) at various phases of the molecular disassembly line that was Source Victoria. Dirty air and dirty water came in and pooled in tanks. Next to each tank was another tank containing slightly cleaner air or cleaner water.
254.title: Systems and methods for treating wastewater
254.abstract: Systems and methods for treating wastewater are disclosed.

255.content: In letters, I guess.” “What are letters?” “Kinda like mediaglyphics except they're all black, and they're tiny, they don't move, they're old and boring and really hard to read. But you can use 'em to make short words for long words.” Hackworth arrives at work; a visit to the Design Works; Mr. Cotton's vocation. Rain beaded on the specular toes of Hackworth's boots as he strode under the vaulting wrought-iron gate. The little beads reflected the silvery gray light of the sky as they rolled off onto the pedomotive's tread plates, and dripped to the gray-brown cobblestones with each stride. Hackworth excused himself through a milling group of uncertain Hindus. Their hard shoes were treacherous on the cobblestones, their chins were in the air so that their high white collars would not saw their heads off. They had arisen many hours ago in their tiny high-rise warrens, their human coin lockers on the island south of New Chusan, which was Hindustani. They had crossed into Shanghai in the wee hours on autoskates and velocipedes, probably paid off some policemen, made their way to the Causeway joining New Chusan to the city. Machine-Phase Systems Limited knew that they were coming, because they came every day. The company could have set up an employment office closer to the Causeway, or even in Shanghai itself. But the company liked to have job-seekers come all the way to the main campus to fill out their applications. The difficulty of getting here prevented people from coming on a velleity, and the eternal presence of these people—like starlings peering down hungrily at a picnic—reminded everyone who was lucky enough to have a job that others were waiting to take their place. The Design Works emulated a university campus, in more ways than its architects had really intended. If a campus was a green quadrilateral described by hulking, hederated Gothics, then this was a campus. But if a campus was also a factory of sorts, most of whose population sat in rows and columns in large stuffy rooms and did essentially the same things all day, then the Design Works was a campus for that reason too.
255.title: Apparatus and method for manufacturing three-
255.abstract: Provided is an apparatus for manufacturing a three-dimensional object. The apparatus includes a heating unit configured to heat the three-dimensional object, wherein the heating unit includes a plurality of nozzles disposed in a predetermined pattern so as to be spaced apart from each other along a first direction perpendicular to a surface of the three-dimensional object when the three-dimensional object is heated by the heating unit; and a controller configured to control operation of the heating unit such that at least two adjacent nozzles out of the plurality of nozzles are simultaneously turned on among the plurality of nozzles while the three-dimensional object is heated by the heating unit. In addition, provided is a method for manufacturing a three-dimensional object using the above-mentioned apparatus.

256.content: “I have never had the honor of carrying a message to King Coyote,” Princess Nell said to the messenger preceding her in the queue. “It is an experience you will never forget,” said the messenger, a cocky young man with black hair and a goatee. “Why must we wait in this queue? In the stalls at the Cipherers' Market, we leave the books on the table and continue on our way.”
256.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for detecting fraudulent transactions
256.abstract: A method of detecting fraudulent transactions is provided. The method includes receiving transaction data associated with a plurality of transactions; determining whether the transaction data satisfies one or more conditions to be classified as an anomalous transaction; in response to determining that the transaction data satisfies the one or more conditions to be classified as an anomalous transaction, identifying at least one suspicious party associated with the anomalous transaction; obtaining additional transaction data associated with the at least one suspicious party; and training a machine learning model using the additional transaction data to generate a trained machine learning model.

257.content: She slammed the book closed, ran to her bed, gathered her stuffed animals up in her arms, started chewing on her blanket, and cried for a while, considering the question of trolls. The book made a fluttering sound.
257.title: Apparatuses, systems, and methods for detecting and mitigating trolls
257.abstract: Implementations of apparatuses, systems, and methods for detecting and mitigating trolls are disclosed. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an input from a user device associated with a social media platform; determining whether the input is indicative of a troll attack; in response to determining that the input is indicative of a troll attack, identifying at least one other user device associated with the social media platform; transmitting instructions to the at least one other user device instructing the at least one other user device to disable access to the social media platform via the at least one other user device; and enabling the user device to continue accessing the social media platform without being subjected to the troll attack.

258.content: He liked the kind you held in your lap on a sheet of smart paper. Nell tried to send Harv a letter every day, simply written in mediaglyphics, and for a while he had tried to respond in kind.
258.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with an artificially intelligent being
258.abstract: A method of communicating with an artificially intelligent being (AI) is provided. The method includes receiving, from the AI, one or more audio signals corresponding to speech uttered by the AI; converting the one or more audio signals received from the AI into textual data; determining whether the textual data corresponds to at least one predetermined triggering condition; in accordance with a determination that the textual data corresponds to the at least one predetermined triggering condition, causing presentation of at least one supplemental information associated with the textual data; and causing presentation of at least one action option associated with the textual data. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

259.content: She used the emergency stairs to make her way up to the next floor, then the next, and then the next. Two flights above, she could hear Fist guards posted at the roof, talking to each other and playing mah-jongg. Many flights below, she could hear more Fists making their way up the stairs one flight at a time, looking for her. She was pondering her next move when the guards above her were rudely interrupted by orders squawking from their radios.
259.title: Fist of the north star: a novel based on the anime and manga by Buronson and Tetsuo Hara
259.abstract: A fist of the north star video game, system, and method are disclosed. The present invention relates to a Fist of the North Star (Hokuto no Ken) video game, system, and method that allows players to play as their favorite characters from the popular Japanese comic book/manga series created by writer Buronson and artist Tetsuo Hara.

260.content: Traffic suddenly became thin, and the camera panned upstream: Several lanes had been blocked by a swarm of bicycles. Occasionally a red taxi or Mercedes-Benz would squeeze by along the iron fence and burst free, the driver holding down the horn button so furiously that he might detonate the air bag. Hackworth could not hear the sound of the horn, but as the camera zoomed in on the action, it became possible to see one driver take his hand off the horn and turn back to shake his finger at the mob of bicyclists.
260.title: Systems and methods for providing an augmented reality view of a transportation corridor
260.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for presenting information to a driver of a vehicle. In one implementation, the method comprises receiving sensor data from sensors associated with a vehicle; determining that the vehicle is traveling along a first lane of a plurality of lanes in a transportation corridor; identifying at least one additional lane of the plurality of lanes other than the first lane as being available for use by the vehicle; generating an augmented reality (AR) view of the transportation corridor displayed through a head-mounted display worn by a driver of the vehicle, wherein the AR view depicts the first lane and the at least one additional lane; and controlling movement of the vehicle within the transportation corridor according to the AR view. Other implementations are also disclosed herein.

261.content: Carl reached out lazily with one hand and began to stack the sheets on top of each other, just for something to occupy his hands while his mind worked—though it wasn't working, at this point, so much as stumbling blindly through a dark labyrinth à la John Percival Hackworth. Carl Hollywood had long suspected that, among other things, the network of the Drummers was a giant system for breaking codes. The cryptographic systems that made the media network run securely, and that made it capable of securely transferring money, were based on the use of immense prime numbers as magic keys. The keys could theoretically be broken by throwing enough computing power at the problem. But at any given level of computing power, code-making was always much easier than code-breaking, so as long as the system kept moving to larger and larger prime numbers as computers got faster, the code-makers could stay far ahead of the code-breakers forever. But the human mind didn't work like a digital computer and was capable of doing some funny things. Carl Hollywood remembered one of the Lone Eagles, an older man who could add huge columns of numbers in his head as quickly as they were called out. That, in and of itself, was merely a duplication of something that a digital computer could do. But this man could also do numerical tricks that could not easily be programmed into a computer. If many minds were gathered together in the network of the Drummers, perhaps they could somehow see through the storm of encrypted data that roared continuously through media space, cause the seemingly random bits to coalesce into meaning. The men who had come to talk to Miranda, who had persuaded her to enter the world of the Drummers, had implied that this was possible; that through them, Miranda could find Nell. Superficially, this would be disastrous, because it would destroy the system used for financial transactions. It would be as if, in a world where commerce was based upon the exchange of gold, some person had figured out how to change lead into gold. An Alchemist.
261.title: Method and apparatus for decrypting encrypted data
261.abstract: A method of decrypting encrypted data includes receiving, from a first computing device, a request to decrypt the encrypted data; determining that the encrypted data is stored in a second computing device; transmitting, to the second computing device, an indication indicating that the encrypted data is stored in the second computing device; receiving, from the second computing device, one or more keys associated with the encrypted data; and decrypting the encrypted data using the one or more keys received from the second computing device. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

262.content: This was for several reasons. Under the new system of Confucian justice, it was no longer necessary for every criminal to sign a confession before a sentence was carried out; all that was needed was for the magistrate to find him guilty on the strength of the evidence. This alone relieved the Judge of having to torture many of the people who came before his bench, though he was often tempted to force confessions from insolent Western thetes who refused to take responsibility for their own actions. Furthermore, modern surveillance equipment made it possible to gather information without having to rely on (sometimes reticent) human witnesses as the magistrates of yore had done. But the man with the red dreadlocks was a very reluctant witness indeed, and unfortunately the information locked up in his brain was unique.
262.title: Method and apparatus for extracting information from an unwilling subject
262.abstract: A method of extracting information from an unwilling subject includes the steps of (a) presenting to the subject one or more stimuli, wherein at least some of the stimuli comprise audio signals; (b) measuring physiological parameters of the subject in response to presentation of the stimuli; and (c) analyzing the measured physiological parameters to determine whether the subject is attempting to withhold information. If it is determined that the subject is attempting to withhold information, the method further includes the steps of (d) determining what type of information the subject is attempting to withhold by comparing the measured physiological parameters against predetermined thresholds corresponding to different types of information; and (e) using the determined type of information to modify subsequent stimuli presented to the subject. An apparatus for carrying out the above-described method is also disclosed herein.

263.content: “What's an adventure?” Nell said. The word was written across the page. Then both pages filled with moving pictures of glorious things: girls in armor fighting dragons with swords, and girls riding white unicorns through the forest, and girls swinging from vines, swimming in the blue ocean, piloting rocket ships through space.
263.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for presenting information to a user
263.abstract: A method of providing content to a user is disclosed. The method includes receiving an indication that the user has interacted with one or more objects in a virtual reality (VR) environment via a VR headset worn by the user. In response to receiving the indication, the method includes identifying at least one attribute associated with each of the one or more objects from which the user interacted. The method also includes determining whether any of the identified attributes satisfy a predetermined criterion. Responsive to determining that none of the identified attributes satisfy the predetermined criterion, the method includes retrieving contextual information associated with the VR environment within which the user interacted with the one or more objects. The method further includes transmitting the contextual information to a computing device operated by the user.

264.content: He'd taken a wrong turn into a cul-de-sac and inadvertently trapped a black man and woman and a couple of little kids who'd blundered in there before him. They had a scared look about them, like a lot of the new arrivals did, and Bud noticed the way the man's gaze lingered on his Sights, wondering whether those crosshairs, invisible to him, were centered on him, his lady, or his kid.
264.title: Sighting system for firearms and methods of use thereof
264.abstract: A sighting system for firearms is disclosed. The sighting system includes a barrel having a first end and a second end opposite the first end, wherein the barrel defines a longitudinal axis extending from the first end to the second end. The sighting system also includes a laser emitter coupled to the barrel such that the laser emitter is positioned along the longitudinal axis between the first end and the second end when the laser emitter is coupled to the barrel. In some embodiments, the laser emitter may be removably coupled to the barrel. Methods of using the sighting system are also disclosed.

265.content: Three people were waiting. Bud took a seat and skimmed a mediatron from the coffee table; it looked exactly like a dirty, wrinkled, blank sheet of paper. “ 'Annals of Self-Protection,' ” he said, loud enough for everyone else in the place to hear him. The logo of his favorite meedfeed coalesced on the page. Mediaglyphics, mostly the cool animated ones, arranged themselves in a grid. Bud scanned through them until he found the one that denoted a comparison of a bunch of different stuff, and snapped at it with his fingernail. New mediaglyphics appeared, surrounding larger cine panes in which Annals staff tested several models of skull guns against live and dead targets. Bud frisbeed the mediatron back onto the table; this was the same review he'd been poring over for the last day, they hadn't updated it, his decision was still valid. One of the guys ahead of him got a tattoo, which took about ten seconds. The other guy just wanted his skull gun reloaded, which didn't take much longer. The girl wanted a few 'sites replaced in her racting grid, mostly around her eyes, where she was starting to wrinkle up. That took a while, so Bud picked up the mediatron again and went in a ractive, his favorite, called Shut Up or Die! The mod artist wanted to see Bud's yuks before he installed the gun, which in other surroundings might have been construed as an insult but was standard business practice here in the Leased Territories. When he was satisfied that this wasn't a stick-up, he theezed Bud's forehead with a spray gun, scalped back a flap of skin, and pushed a machine, mounted on a delicate robot arm like a dental tool, over Bud's forehead. The arm homed in automatically on the old gun, moving with alarming speed and determination. Bud, who was a little jumpy at the best of times because of his muscle stimulators, flinched a little. But the robot arm was a hundred times faster than he was and plucked out the old gun unerringly. The proprietor was watching all of this on a screen and had nothing to do except narrate: “The hole in your skull's kind of rough, so the machine is reaming it out to a larger bore—okay, now here comes the new gun.” A nasty popping sensation radiated through Bud's skull when the robot arm snapped in the new model.
265.title: Method and apparatus for implanting a skull gun
265.abstract: A method of implanting a device into the cranium is disclosed. The method comprises providing an insertion tool having a distal end, inserting the distal end of the insertion tool through at least one opening in the cranium, advancing the distal end of the insertion tool to a predetermined location within the cranium, locking the distal end of the insertion tool with respect to the cranium such that the distal end of the insertion tool does not move relative to the cranium, unlocking the distal end of the insertion tool from the cranium, withdrawing the distal end of the insertion tool from the cranium while maintaining the distal end of the insertion tool locked with respect to the cranium, and re-locking the distal end of the insertion tool with respect to the cranium once the distal end of the insert

266.content: But now Mrs. Hackworth found that her own mind was elsewhere, as she pondered these three very strange girls—the three smartest little girls in Miss Matheson's Academy—each with her very strange relationship with her Primer. Her gaze drifted away from the sheets of mediatronic paper scattered about the escritoire, out the window, and across the moor, where a gentle shower had begun to fall. She devoted the better part of an hour to worrying about girls and Primers. Then she remembered an assertion that her host had made that afternoon, which she had not fully appreciated at the time: These girls weren't any stranger than any other girls, and to blame their behavior on the Primers was to miss the point entirely. Greatly reassured, she took out her silver pen and began to write a letter to her missing husband, who had never seemed so far away. Miranda receives an unusual ractive message; a drive through the streets of Shanghai; the Cathay Hotel; a sophisticated soirée; Carl Hollywood introduces her to two unusual characters.
266.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining an answer to a trivia question are disclosed. In one embodiment, a method for determining an answer to a trivia question is disclosed. The method
266.abstract: implementing receiving the trivia question from a user device; obtaining information associated with the trivia question by querying at least one data source using natural language processing (NLP) of the trivia question received from the user device; identifying multiple potential answers to the trivia question in response to analyzing the information obtained from the at least one data source; generating a plurality of images corresponding to the multiple potential answers to the trivia question; presenting the plurality of images to the user device as part of a game session between the user device and the computing system; receiving input indicating a selected image among the plurality of images presented to the user device during the game session; and providing feedback that indicates whether the selected image corresponds to any of the multiple potential answers to the trivia question. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

267.content: Until recently, Miss Stricken's classes had been nothing more than a routine annoyance—an ordeal that she had to sit through in order to experience the fun parts of the curriculum. She could look back on a time only a couple of months ago when she would come home with her mind aglow from all the things she had learned in Brilliance, and when the Joy part was just an indistinct smudge around the edge. But in recent weeks, Miss Stricken had, for some reason, loomed larger and larger in her view of the place. And somehow, Miss Stricken had read Nell's mind and had chosen just the right moment to step up her campaign of harassment.
267.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for teacher's pet. In some implementations, a method includes determining, by a processor, that a first user of a plurality of users has
267.abstract: improved performance with respect to a second user of the plurality of users; identifying, by the processor, one or more topics associated with the improved performance between the first user and the second user; generating, by the processor, a list of questions related to the one or more topics; transmitting, by the processor, the list of questions to the second user; receiving, by the processor, answers to the list of questions from the second user; evaluating, by the processor, the answers received from the second user against correct answers stored in association with the list of questions; and providing, by the processor, feedback to the second user indicating whether the answers received from the second user match the correct answers stored in association with the list of questions.

268.content: Then, getting herself well situated and clenching the hand-grips, she added, “Unlimited speed.” Within moments the chevaline was threading gaps between trees at something close to a cheetah's sprint velocity, clawing its way up the hill toward the dog pod grid. From the way the tubes ran, Nell guessed that Miss Matheson was plugged into the Feed in two or three different ways, though everything had been discreetly hidden under many afghans, piled up on top of her body like the airy layers of a French pastry.
268.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a person
268.abstract: A method of transporting a person includes receiving an order to transport the person from a first location to a second location. The method also includes determining, in response to receipt of the order, one or more modes of transportation between the first location and the second location. The method further includes selecting at least one mode of transportation among the determined one or more modes of transportation. The method additionally includes transporting the person from the first location to the second location using the selected at least one mode of transportation. An apparatus for transporting a person is also disclosed herein.

269.content: Most of them were notebooks where he would sketch the inventions he hadn't had time to build yet. He had plans for whole armies of Turing machines made to run in parallel, and for chains with links that could be set in more than two positions, and for machines that would read and write on two-dimensional sheets of chain mail instead of one-dimensional chains, and for a three-dimensional Turing grid a mile on a side, through which a mobile Turing machine would climb about, computing as it went. No matter how complicated his designs became, the Duke always found a way to simulate their behavior by putting a sufficiently long chain into one of the traditional Turing machines. That is to say that while the parallel and multidimensional machines worked more quickly than the original model, they didn't really do anything different. One afternoon, Nell was sitting in her favorite meadow, reading about these things in the Primer, when a riderless chevaline emerged from the woods and galloped directly toward her. This was not highly unusual, in and of itself; chevalines were smart enough to be sent out in search of specific persons.
269.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for processing data. In some implementations, a method includes obtaining, by one or more computing devices, a plurality of data points associated with
269.abstract: a first image captured at a first point in time using a first imaging device and a second image captured at a second point in time using the first imaging device. The method further includes determining an offset between the first point in time and the second point in time is less than a predetermined amount of time. The method further includes identifying a subset of the plurality of data points that are within the predetermined amount of time from the first point in time to the second point in time. The method further includes generating a three-dimensional (3D) reconstruction of a scene depicted in the first image and the second image based on the subset of the plurality of data points.

270.content: The soldier scooped it up in his arms and deposited it in an empty basket that was sitting handily nearby. Then he strode toward Nell, bent forward at the waist, put his hard cold shoulder rather uncomfortably into the pit of her stomach, and picked her up off the floor like a sack of corn. He carried her for some minutes through the castle, most of that time spent descending endless stone staircases, and finally brought her to a very deep, dark, and cold dungeon, where he deposited her in a small and perfectly dark cell. Nell said, “Princess Nell used one of the magic spells Purple had taught her to make light.” Princess Nell could see that the room was about two by three paces, with a stone bench on one wall to serve as a bed, and a hole in the floor for a toilet. A tiny barred window in the back wall led to an air shaft.
270.title: Method and apparatus for retrieving a person from a body of water
270.abstract: A method is provided for retrieving a person from a body of water. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication to retrieve the person from the body of water; identifying, by the computing device, one or more locations in the body of water where the person is likely to be located; determining, by the computing device, at least one type of information associated with each of the one or more locations; generating, by the computing device, a map that depicts the one or more locations as well as the at least one type of information associated with each of the one or more locations; transmitting, by the computing device, the generated map to a display device; and displaying, by the display device, the generated map. Corresponding apparatus, systems, computer programs and computers are also provided.

271.content: But it wouldn't have been ecological. The geotects of Imperial Tectonics would not have known an ecosystem if they'd been living in the middle of one. But they did know that ecosystems were especially tiresome when they got fubared, so they protected the environment with the same implacable, plodding, green-visored mentality that they applied to designing overpasses and culverts. Thus, water seeped into Source Victoria through microtubes, much the same way it seeped into a beach, and air wafted into it silently down the artfully skewed exponential horns of those thrusting calla lilies, each horn a point in parameter space not awfully far from some central ideal. They were strong enough to withstand typhoons but flexible enough to rustle in a breeze. Birds, wandering inside, sensed a gradient in the air, pulling them down into night, and simply chose to fly out.
271.title: Method and apparatus for treating water contaminated by hydrocarbons and other contaminants
271.abstract: A method of removing hydrocarbons from an aqueous solution comprises introducing the aqueous solution containing the hydrocarbons into a treatment chamber, wherein the treatment chamber is in fluid communication with at least one source of ozone. The method further comprises exposing the aqueous solution to ultraviolet (UV) light within the treatment chamber such that the UV light reacts with the hydrocarbons present in the aqueous solution to form carbon dioxide and organic acids.

272.content: As the sea rose over him, it lifted the bowler from his head, and the hat continued to bob on the tide for some minutes as the Chinese detonated strings of firecrackers on the shore and tiny shreds of the red paper wrappers drifted over the sea like cherry petals. On one of her forays into the surf, Nell had encountered a man—a Drummer—who had come swimming out of the deep, naked except for a gill pack. This should have astonished her; instead, she had known he was out there before she saw him, and when he came close, she could feel things happening in her mind that were coming in from outside. There was something in her brain that made her connected to the Drummers. Nell had drawn up some general plans and given them to her engineers for further elaboration, and they had given them to Carl, who had taken them to a functioning portable M.C. in the New Atlantan camp and compiled a little system for examining and manipulating nanotechnological devices. In the dark, motes of light sparkled in Nell's flesh, like airplane beacons in the night sky. They scraped one of these away with a scalpel and examined it. They found similar devices circulating in her bloodstream. These things, they realized, must have been put into Nell's blood when she was raped. It was clear that the sparkling lights in Nell's flesh were beacons signaling to others across the gulf that separates each of us from our neighbors. Carl opened one of the things from Nell's blood and found a rod logic system inside, and a tape drive containing some few gigabytes of data. The data was divided into discrete chunks, each one of which was separately encrypted. Carl tried all of the keys that he had obtained from John Percival Hackworth and found that one of them—Hackworth's key—unlocked some of the chunks. When he examined the decrypted contents, he discovered fragments of a plan for some kind of nanotechnological device. They drew blood from several volunteers and found that one of them had the same little devices in his blood. When they put two of these devices in close proximity, they locked onto one another using lidar and embraced, exchanging data and performing some sort of computation that threw off waste heat. The devices lived in the blood of the human race like viruses and passed from one person to the next during sex or any other exchange of bodily fluids; they were smart packets of data, just like the ones traversing the media network, and by mating with one another in the blood, they formed a vast system of communication, parallel to and probably linked with the dry Net of optical lines and copper wires. Like the dry Net, the wet Net could be used for doing computations—for running programs. And it was now clear that John Percival Hackworth was using it for exactly that, running some kind of vast distributed program of his own devising. He was designing something. “Hackworth is the Alchemist,” Nell said, “and he is using the wet Net to design the Seed.” Half a kilometer offshore, the tunnels began.
272.title: Systems and methods for using nanotechnology, warfare, and hominid politics at the end of the twentieth century, A.D.
272.abstract: A system comprises an interface configured to receive input from a user; a processor coupled to the interface, wherein the processor is configured to execute instructions stored in non-transitory machine-readable media that cause the processor to perform operations comprising determining one or more characteristics associated with each of a plurality of objects within a field of view (FOV), generating a three-dimensional (3D) model of the FOV by fusing the one or more characteristics associated with each of the plurality of objects into the 3D model, and displaying the 3D model via the interface. In some embodiments, the displayed 3D model may be interactive such that the user can interact with the displayed 3D model through the interface.

273.content: He clambered up toward the perimeter of the house, dodging the occasional moving chair, and tracked by a few spotlight beams from fellow audience members who had taken a particular interest in his personal story. An aperture was above him, glowing with warm light, and passing through it, Hackworth found himself in a cozy little bar with a curving window that afforded an excellent view of the theatre. It was a refuge in more ways than one; he could see normally through the spectacles here, they seemed to be giving him an untampered view of reality.
273.title: Method and apparatus for enabling a user to interact with a virtual reality environment using a head-mounted display (HMD)
273.abstract: A method of controlling an HMD comprises detecting, by one or more sensors associated with the HMD, at least one gesture performed by a user wearing the HMD; in response to detecting the at least one gesture, determining whether the at least one gesture corresponds to a predefined command; and in accordance with a determination that the at least one gesture corresponds to the predefined command, providing feedback to the user indicative of execution of the predefined command. Related apparatus, systems, methods, and computer program products are also described herein.

274.content: The walls were of an unexceptional beige material that had been used to construct many of the buildings in the L.T., which was unfortunate, because it had an almost magnetic attraction for the cineritious corpses of airborne mites. Like all the other buildings so constituted, the Free Phthisis Sanatorium had, over the years, turned black, and not evenly but in vertical rain-streaks.
274.title: Method and apparatus for treating tuberculosis
274.abstract: The present invention relates to a method of treating tuberculosis, the method comprising administering an effective amount of at least one compound of formula (I)or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt thereof.

275.content: She drew a handkerchief from her sleeve and wiped her eyes. The presence of so many lidar-emitting mites prompted her to realize that they had been infiltrating a great expanse of fog for some minutes without really being aware of it; moisture from the river was condensing around the microscopic guardians of the border. Colored light flashed vaguely across the screen of fog before them, silhouetting a stone column planted in the center of the road: wings of a gryphon, horn of a unicorn, crisp and black against a lurid cosmos.
275.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an object in a field of view of a head-mounted display (HMD)
275.abstract: A method is provided for detecting an object in a field of view of a head-mounted display (HMD). The method includes determining, by the HMD, at least one first image from a plurality of images that are captured while wearing the HMD. The method also includes determining, by the HMD, at least one second image from the plurality of images that are captured while not wearing the HMD. The method further includes comparing, by the HMD, the at least one first image with the at least one second image to determine whether there is any difference between the at least one first image and the at least one second image. If it is determined that there is no difference between the at least one first image and the at least one second image, indicating that the object is present in the field of view of the HMD. Numerous other aspects are also claimed and described.

276.content: Mites fighting other mites. This dust—we call it toner—is actually the dead bodies of all those mites.”
276.title: Systems and methods for controlling pests
276.abstract: A system is provided for controlling pests. The system comprises at least one sensor configured to detect the presence of an object, such as a pest, within a predetermined range of the at least one sensor. A controller is coupled to the at least one sensor and is configured to receive information from the at least one sensor indicative of the presence of the object in the predetermined range of the at least one sensor. The controller is further configured to determine that the object is a pest based on the information received from the at least one sensor. Responsive to determining that the object is a pest, the controller is configured to activate or deactivate (e.g., turn on or off) at least one light source disposed remotely from the at least one sensor.

277.content: She had responded saying that she did not wish to continue the relationship, and he had, perhaps with the help of a hidden monitor, encountered her and her chaperone pod one morning as she had been riding to Miss Matheson's Academy. She had reminded him of the recent termination of their relationship by declining to recognize him, but he had persisted anyway, and by the time she had reached the gates of the Academy, the chaperone pod had gathered enough evidence to support a formal sexual harassment accusation should Nell have wished to bring one.
277.title: Method and apparatus for preventing unwanted encounters
277.abstract: A method of preventing unwanted encounters includes receiving, by a computing device from a first user associated with the computing device, an indication that the first user does not want to be within a predetermined distance of a second user. The computing device is further configured to receive location information identifying a current location of the first user. The computing device is further configured to determine whether the current location of the first user is within the predetermined distance of a current location of the second user. In response to determining that the current location of the first user is within the predetermined distance of the current location of the second user, the computing device is further configured to disable communication between the first user and the second user. Corresponding apparatus, system, computer program products, and methods are also described.

278.content: The model's skin was mediatronic, just like the skin of the building itself, and it was currently echoing (as she supposed) whatever images were being displayed on the outside of the building: mostly advertising panels, though some Fists had apparently come in here and scrawled graffiti across them. On top of the model rested a stylus—just a black stick pointed on one end—and a palette, covered with a color wheel and other controls. Nell picked them up, touched the tip of the stylus to a green area on the palette's color wheel, and drew it across the surface of the model. A glowing green line appeared along the track of the stylus, disfiguring an ad panel for an airship line. Whatever other steps Nell might take in the time she had left, there was one thing she could do quickly and easily here. She was not entirely sure why she did it, but some intuition told her that it might be useful; or perhaps it was an artistic urge to make something that would live longer than she would, even if only by a few minutes.
278.title: Augmented-reality system for augmenting a real-world environment with computer-generated graphics
278.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer program products comprising a computer-readable storage medium in which computer-executable instructions are encoded. Implementations of the present disclosure also include articles of manufacture comprising computer-readable media (e.g., non-transitory computer-readable media) containing computer-executable instructions that implement the embodiments described herein.

279.content: It was a solid thing. The top was printed with golden letters. The left edge was rounded and smooth, made of something that felt warm and soft but strong. The other edges were indented slightly, and they were cream-colored.
279.title: Apparatus for dispensing beverages from a vending machine
279.abstract: The present invention relates to an apparatus for dispensing beverages from a vending machine.
