The apparatus comprises at least one nozzle, wherein each nozzle is configured to spray the beverage and/or foam of the beverage out of the vending machine into a cup or other receptacle placed underneath the nozzle.

280.content: … Hackworth wondered if he was somehow obligated to read this line. But soon the torches turned away from him, as more audience members began to rain down through the astral plane of the chandeliers. Watching them fall, Hackworth realized that he'd seen something like it before at amusement parks: This was nothing more than bungee-jumping. It's just that the spectacles had declined to show Hackworth his own bungee cord, just to add an extra frisson to the whole experience. The armrest of Hackworth's chair included some controls that enabled him to move it around the floor of the house, which was cone-shaped, sloping sharply in toward the center. A pedestrian would have found difficult footing, but the chair had powerful nanotech motors and compensated for the slope.
280.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with a user of a virtual or augmented reality system
280.abstract: A method performed by an electronic device comprising one or more processors coupled to non-transitory computer readable media. The method comprises receiving, at the electronic device from a service provider via a cellular network, data indicative of a plurality of services offered by the service provider; determining whether any of the plurality of services offered by the service provider are available within a geographic area associated with the electronic device; in response to determining that none of the plurality of services offered by the service provider are available within the geographic area associated with the electronic device, causing presentation of information indicating availability of the plurality of services offered by the service provider outside of the geographic area associated with the electronic device.

281.content: He had a few cartridges from his mite trap. Tomorrow Harv would take the cartridge down to the Flea Circus and find out if he'd caught anything, and whether it was worth money. There were other things like buttons.
281.title: Apparatus and method for performing a flea circus
281.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed herein to perform a flea circus. An example embodiment of the present invention is directed to an apparatus comprising at least one processor configured to execute computer-readable program code stored in at least one memory device. When executed by the at least one processor, the computer-readable program code configures the at least one processor to cause the apparatus to receive user input via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the user input identifies a plurality of actions associated with a flea circus; store the plurality of actions identified by the received user input as part of a virtual flea circus; and playback the virtual flea circus according to the plurality of actions upon receipt of additional user input via the GUI.

282.content: John Percival Hackworth projected his thoughts into matter and did it better than anyone else in this place. But he had felt the need to go beyond that—he had wanted to reach beyond mere matter and into someone's soul.
282.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for determining a user's emotional state
282.abstract: A method includes receiving an audio signal from a microphone of a computing device. The method further includes processing the audio signal to identify one or more acoustic features in the audio signal. The method further includes classifying the one or more acoustic features as belonging to at least one of a plurality of emotion classes. The method further includes determining that the user is exhibiting signs of distress. The method further includes transmitting a notification to a caregiver indicating that the user is exhibiting signs of distress. Corresponding methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

283.content: Something you couldn't find by looking it up in a database.” “I'm seeking a fellow called the Alchemist,” Hackworth said. Suddenly, things got bright. The side of the woman's face that was toward the window was brilliantly illuminated, like a probe in space lit on one side by the directional light of the sun. Hackworth sensed, somehow, that this was not a new development. Looking out over the audience, he saw that nearly all of them were aiming their spotlights into the bar, and that everyone in the place had been watching and listening to his entire conversation with the woman. The spectacles had deceived him by adjusting the apparent light levels. The woman looked different too; her face had reverted to the way it looked when she came in, and Hackworth now understood that her image in his spectacles had been gradually evolving during their conversation, getting feedback from whatever part of his brain buzzed when he saw a beautiful woman. The curtain parted to reveal a large electric sign descending from the fly space: JOHN HACKWORTH in QUEST FOR THE ALCHEMIST starring JOHN HACKWORTH as HIMSELF.
283.title: Method and apparatus for creating an immersive experience
283.abstract: A method of providing an immersive experience to a user is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of obtaining data from at least one sensory device, wherein the data relates to events occurring in a real world environment; determining whether or not the obtained data satisfies predetermined criteria; if it is determined that the obtained data satisfies the predetermined criteria, then storing the obtained data in a database; retrieving stored data from the database; processing the retrieved data to generate synthesized data; presenting the synthesized data to the user so as to enable the user to interact with the synthesized data thereby enabling the user to have an immersive experience within the real world environment. An apparatus for providing an immersive experience to a user is also disclosed.

284.content: They use the sparkles to talk to each other,” Harv explained. “They're in the air, in food and water, everywhere. And there's rules that these mites are supposed to follow, and those rules are called protocols. And there's a protocol from way back that says they're supposed to be good for your lungs.
284.title: Systems and methods for treating respiratory illnesses
284.abstract: A system includes an air purification device configured to remove at least one of particulate matter, volatile organic compounds (VOCs), or nitrogen dioxide (NO2) from ambient air. A controller is in communication with the air purification device. The controller is configured to cause the air purification device to operate in a plurality of operational modes including a first operational mode during which the air purification device removes at least one of the particulate matter, VOCs, or NO2 from the ambient air; and a second operational mode during which the air purification device delivers ozone into the ambient air. In some embodiments, the controller is further configured to cause the air purification device to transition between the first operational mode and the second operational mode responsive to detecting that a threshold level of particulates has been removed from the ambient air by the air purification device.

285.content: Parts of it were marked off with a lovely wrought-iron fence, but the real border was defended by something called the dog pod grid—a swarm of quasi-independent aerostats. Aerostat meant anything that hung in the air. This was an easy trick to pull off nowadays. Nanotech materials were stronger. Computers were infinitesimal. Power supplies were much more potent.
285.title: Method and apparatus for controlling unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs)
285.abstract: A method of controlling Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one UAV from a plurality of UAVs, an area to be inspected; dividing the determined area into a plurality of sub-areas; assigning each sub-area in the plurality of sub-areas to two or more UAVs selected from the plurality of UAVs; transmitting information about assigned sub-areas to other UAVs among the plurality of UAVs so that each UAV can autonomously inspect its assigned sub-area; receiving images captured by cameras attached to the respective UAVs; analyzing the received images to determine whether any abnormalities are present in the corresponding sub-areas; and reporting results of the analysis to a ground station.

286.content: They took a sneaky and indirect route to the waterfront, staying as far as possible from the clusters of drunks winding through the constellation of incandescent bordellos like cold dark clumps of rock wending their way through a bright nebula of young stars. They made their way to a public M.C. on a streetcorner and picked out items from the free menu: boxes of water and nutri-broth, envelopes of sushi made from nanosurimi and rice, candy bars, and packages about the size of Harv's hand, festooned with implausible block letter promises (“REFLECTS 99% OF INFRARED!”) that folded out into huge crinkly metallized blankets. Nell had been noticing a lot of rough shapes strewn around on the beach like giant chrome-plated larva. Must be fellow transients wrapped up in these selfsame.
286.title: Nano-survival kit for post-apocalyptic survivors
286.abstract: A nano-survival kit is disclosed. The nano-survival kit comprises one or more nanomaterials, wherein the one or more nanomaterials are encapsulated in a polymeric matrix and configured to release an active ingredient upon rupture of the polymeric matrix.

287.content: But for all that, the image quality was a lot better than photographic, and she quickly forgot herself and began sweeping it back and forth across the city. She checked out the little Celestial Kingdom Clave in the heart of the old city, where a couple of Mandarins stood on a zigzag bridge across a pond, contemplating a swarm of golden carp, wispy silver beards trailing down over the colorful silk of their lapels, blue sapphire buttons on their caps flashing as they nodded their heads. She looked into a high-rise building farther inland, apparently a foreign concession of some type, where some Euros were holding a cocktail party, some venturing onto the balcony with glasses of wine and doing some eavesdropping of their own. Finally she leveled the 'scope toward the horizon, out past the vast dangerous triad-ridden suburbs, where millions of Shanghai's poor had been forcibly banished to make way for high-rises. Beyond that was real agricultural land, a fractal network of canals and creeks glimmering like a golden net as they reflected the lambency of the sunset, and beyond that, as always, a few scattered pillars of smoke in the ultimate distance, where the Fists of Righteous Harmony were burning the foreign devils' Feed lines. “You are a curious girl,” Madame Ping said.
287.title: Method and apparatus for capturing an image using a telescopic viewfinder
287.abstract: A method of capturing an image includes determining, by one or more processing devices, whether to capture the image. In response to determining not to capture the image, the method further includes controlling, by the one or more processing devices, a telescopic viewfinder to move from a first position to a second position that is different from the first position. The method further includes obtaining, by the one or more processing devices, image data corresponding to at least a portion of an image captured by the telescopic viewfinder when the telescopic viewfinder moves from the first position to the second position. The method further includes storing, by the one or more processing devices, the image data in memory.

288.content: So while she was happy to respond to this message in kind, she intended to take a guarded approach until she had established whether the sender was human or mechanical. The next part of the message was GIVE- - -CHAIN- - - -TUG- - - - - -ANSWER. Assuming that four horizontal marks stood for a/an and six stood for to, this was GIVE THE CHAIN A TUG TO ANSWER. Nell began to flip the toggles on the chain, erasing the message from this personage calling himself the Duke and replacing it with I AM PRINCESS NELL WHY DID YOU IMPRISON ME. Then she gave the chain a tug, and after a moment it began to withdraw from her cell. A few minutes later, back came the message: WELCOME PRINCESS NELL LET US DEVISE A MORE EFFICIENT MEANS OF COMMUNICATION followed by instructions on how to use a more compact system of toggles to represent numbers, and how to convert the numbers into letters and punctuation marks.
288.title: Systems and methods for communicating between humans and artificial intelligences
288.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for facilitating communication between an artificial intelligence (AI) system and a human. In one implementation, a method includes receiving input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the GUI is configured to display content generated by at least one AI model; determining that the received input corresponds to a request to modify the displayed content; in response to determining that the received input corresponds to a request to modify the displayed content, generating modified content using the at least one AI model; and displaying the modified content via the GUI.

289.content: From swords-and-sorcery ractives. See, the more experience points your character earns, the more power he gets.” Judge Fang straightened one hand and snapped it backward past his head, making a whooshing sound like a low-flying fighter plane. “The reference escaped me,” he explained for the benefit of Chang and Miss Pao, who did not recognize the gesture. “Feels like there's something tickling my right eardrum now,” the prisoner said, snapping his head back and forth.
289.title: Systems and methods for sword and sorcery role-playing game
289.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for an augmented reality (AR) sword and sorcery role-playing game. The AR sword and sorcery role-playing game may be played by one or more players, wherein each player is equipped with at least one wearable device configured to capture motion data associated with physical movements performed by the respective player. In some implementations, the captured motion data may be used to control in-game avatars that are controlled by other players participating in the AR sword and sorcery role-playing game. Other implementations of the present disclosure are also disclosed and/or claimed herein.

290.content: On the first of these, you left in midafternoon and returned late at night bleeding from lacerations that seemed to have been recently incurred, according to the”—Major Napier could not repress a tiny smile—“evocative description logged by the border patrol officer on duty that night. On the second occasion, you again left in the afternoon and returned late, this time with a single deep laceration across the buttocks—not visible, of course, but picked up by surveillance.” Hackworth took a bite of his sandwich, correctly anticipating that the meat would be gristly and that he would have plenty of time to think about his situation while his molars subdued it.
290.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a secure facility
290.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized access to a secure facility is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device from at least one sensor coupled to the secure facility, data indicative of movement within the secure facility; determining, by the computing device, whether the data received from the at least one sensor satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the data received from the at least one sensor satisfies the predetermined criterion, transmitting, by the computing device, a notification message comprising information associated with the detected unauthorized access via a communication network; and storing, by the computing device, the information associated with the detected unauthorized access into a database accessible over the communication network. A corresponding system and computer program product are also disclosed.

291.content: After a minute or two, she noticed that something akin to a shock wave was making its way down the street far below, moving in slow motion, covering a city block every couple of minutes. Details were difficult to make out at this distance: it was a highly organized group of pedestrians, all wearing the same generally dark clothing, ramming its way through the mob of refugees, forcing the panicked barbarians toward the picket line of the Fists or sideways into the lobbies of the dead buildings.
291.title: Zombie apocalypse with dystopian and post-apocalyptic themes
291.abstract: A zombie apocalypse game is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises receiving an input from a user to initiate play of a zombie apocalypse game; generating a plurality of undead creatures (e.g., zombies) that are spawned at random locations within a predetermined geographic area in response to receipt of the input; determining whether any of the plurality of undead creatures have come into contact with human survivors located within the predetermined geographic area; if it is determined that none of the plurality of undead creatures have come into contact with any human survivors, incrementing a timer associated with the zombie apocalypse game by a predetermined period of time upon expiration of a predetermined amount of time after generation of the plurality of undead cre

292.content: One story led to another. Miranda tried to tell the stories as fast as she could, tried to put a tone of boredom and impatience into her voice, which wasn't easy because she was actually on the verge of panic.
292.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for determining an outcome of a Little Red Riding Hood vs. The Big Bad Wolf game. In one aspect, a Little Red R
292.abstract: methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for determining an outcome of a Little Red Riding Hood vs. The Big Bad Wolf game. In one aspect, a Little Red Riding Hood vs. The Big Bad Wolf game is provided that comprises the following steps: (i) receiving a wolf's move; (ii) comparing the received wolf's move to predetermined outcomes stored in a database; (iii) if the received wolf's move does not match any of the predetermined outcomes stored in the database, storing the received wolf's move into the database as a new predetermined outcome; (iv) repeating steps (ii) and (iii) until all possible wolf's moves are accounted for in the database; and (v) upon receipt of little red riding hood's move, retrieving the

293.content: So she accepted it. She wondered who was sending her urgent job offers; six years ago it had happened frequently, but since she'd gone into her habit of working the evening shift she had, in general, become just another interchangeable Western bimbo with an unpronounceable name. It looked like some kind of weird bohemian art piece, some ractors'-workshop project from her distant past: a surreal landscape of abstract colored geometric forms with faces occasionally rising out of flat surfaces to speak lines. The faces were texture-mapped, as if wearing elaborately painted makeup, or were sculpted to the texture of orange peels, alligator hide, or durian fruit. “We miss her,” said one of the faces, the voice a little familiar, but disped into a weird ghostly echoing moan. “Where is she?” said another face, rather familiar in its shape. “Why has she abandoned us?” said a third face, and even through the texture-mapping and the voice disping, Miranda recognized Carl Hollywood. “If only she would come to our party!” cried another one, whom Miranda recognized as a member of the Parnasse Company named Christine something-or-other. The prompter gave her a line:
293.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing party invitations
293.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing party invitations. In one implementation, a method is performed at an electronic device having one or more processors coupled to memory. The method includes determining that a first user account associated with the electronic device has been invited by a second user account to participate in a group chat session hosted by a third user account. The method further includes receiving input from the first user account indicating acceptance of the invitation to participate in the group chat session. The method additionally includes transmitting, to the third user account, confirmation that the first user account has accepted the invitation to participate in the group chat session. Responsive to receipt of the confirmation, the third user account may be notified that the first user account has accepted the invitation to participate in the group chat session.

294.content: More recently she had understood it as the workings of a parallel computer of enormous size and power, carefully programmed to understand the human mind and give it what it needed. Now she wasn't so sure. Princess Nell's recent travels through the lands of King Coyote, and the various castles with their increasingly sophisticated computers that were, in the end, nothing more than Turing machines, had caught her up in a bewildering logical circle. In Castle Turing she had learned that a Turing machine could not really understand a human being. But the Primer was, itself, a Turing machine, or so she suspected; so how could it understand Nell? Could it be that the Primer was just a conduit, a technological system that mediated between Nell and some human being who really loved her? In the end, she knew, this was basically how all ractives worked. The idea was too alarming to consider at first, and so she circled around it cautiously, poking at it from different directions, like a cavewoman discovering fire for the first time. But as she settled in closer, she found that it warmed her and satisfied her, and by the time her mind wandered into sleep, she had become dependent upon it and would not consider going back into the cold and dark place where she had been traveling for so many years. Carl Hollywood returns to Shanghai; his forebears in the territory of the Lone Eagles; Mrs. Kwan's teahouse. Heavy rains had come rolling into Shanghai from the West, like a harbinger of the Fists of Righteous Harmony and the thundering herald of the coming Celestial Kingdom. Stepping off the airship from London, Carl Hollywood at once felt himself in a different Shanghai from the one he had left; the old city had always been wild, but in a sophisticated urban way, and now it was wild like a frontier town. He sensed this ambience before he even left the Aerodrome; it leaked in from the streets, like ozone before a thunderstorm. Looking out the windows, he could see a heavy rain rushing down, knocking all the nanotech out of the air and down into the gutters, whence it would eventually stain the Huang Pu and then the Yangtze.
294.title: Method and apparatus for generating a virtual reality environment based on a user's emotional state
294.abstract: A method of generating a virtual reality environment is disclosed. The method includes detecting an emotional state of a user, wherein the detected emotional state corresponds to one of a plurality of predetermined emotional states; determining at least one characteristic associated with each of the plurality of predetermined emotional states; creating a virtual reality environment based on the determined at least one characteristic associated with the detected emotional state; and presenting the created virtual reality environment to the user via a head-mounted display device.

295.content: “I do not even desire your food—information only!” “I will give you a big piece of cheese, all to yourself, if you give me some information,” Princess Nell said. She caught the mouse's tail and lifted him up into the air so that they could talk face-to-face. Meanwhile, with her other hand, she loosened the drawstring of her bag and drew out a nice piece of blue-veined Stilton. “We are seeking our lost Queen,” the mouse said.
295.title: Method and apparatus for locating a missing person
295.abstract: A method of locating a missing person is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of receiving (102) at least one sensor reading from each of a plurality of sensors; determining (104) an estimated location of the missing person by applying machine learning to the received sensor readings; comparing (106) the estimated location of the missing person with previously determined locations of the missing person, wherein the previously determined locations are stored in a database; selecting (108), if there is no match between the estimated location of the missing person and any of the previously determined locations of the missing person, as the current location of the missing person; and transmitting (110) information relating to the selected location to a user interface.

296.content: Then she saw Spirit again, this time from two different camera angles. The mediatron had split up into several panes. One was a camera angle on Spirit's face, which still did whatever Miranda's face did. One was a two-shot showing Spirit and an older man, standing in a room full of big machines. Another pane showed a closeup of the old man, who as Spirit realized was being played by Fred Epidermis. The old man said, “Okay, keep in mind we usually play this through a head stage, so you don't control Spirit's arms and legs, just her face—”
296.title: Method and apparatus for controlling a humanoid robot
296.abstract: A method of controlling a humanoid robot includes determining, by the humanoid robot, whether an object is present in a predetermined area. When it is determined that the object is not present in the predetermined area, the humanoid robot moves toward the predetermined area at a first moving speed. When it is determined that the object is present in the predetermined area, the humanoid robot moves toward the predetermined area at a second moving speed lower than the first moving speed.

297.content: “What conclusions do you draw, Miss Pao?” the Judge said. “Two different parties are searching the Leased Territories for the same book,” Miss Pao said. She did not have to state that the target of this search was probably the book stolen from the gentleman named Hackworth. “Can you speculate as to the identity of these parties?” Miss Pao said, “Of course, neither device carries a maker's mark. The bat-eared one has Dr. X written all over it; most of its features appear to be evolved, not engineered, and the Doctor's Flea Circus is nothing more than an effort to collect evolved mites with useful features. At a first glance, the other device could have come from any of the engineering works associated with major phyles—Nippon, New Atlantis, Hindustan, the First Distributed Republic being prime suspects. But on deeper examination I find a level of elegance—” “Elegance?” “Pardon me, Your Honor, the concept is not easy to explain—there is an ineffable quality to some technology, described by its creators as concinnitous, or technically sweet, or a nice hack—signs that it was made with great care by one who was not merely motivated but inspired. It is the difference between an engineer and a hacker.” “Or an engineer and an artifex?” Judge Fang said. A trace of a smile came across Miss Pao's face. “I fear that I have enmeshed that little girl in a much deeper business than I ever imagined,” Judge Fang said. He rolled up the paper and handed it back to Miss Pao.
297.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computer system
297.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computer system includes receiving, by a computing device, one or more sensor signals from one or more sensors associated with the computing device; determining, by the computing device, that at least one of the one or more sensor signals satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that at least one of the one or more sensor signals satisfies the predetermined criterion, generating, by the computing device, an anomaly indication; and transmitting, by the computing device, the anomaly indication. Various other aspects are contemplated.

298.content: Instead, she excerpted one five-second piece of the cine record from the chaperone pod: the one in which, approached by the young man, Nell said, “I'm sorry, but I'm afraid you have me at a disadvantage,” and the young man, failing to appreciate the ramifications, pressed on as if he had not heard. Nell placed this information into a smart visiting card and arranged to have it dropped by the young man's family home.
298.title: Apparatus and method for facilitating a meeting between two or more people
298.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for facilitating a meeting between two or more people. In one embodiment, an apparatus is provided that comprises at least one processor configured to execute instructions stored in non-transitory machine-readable media; wherein execution of the instructions by the at least one processor causes the at least one processor to perform operations comprising: obtaining location information associated with each of a plurality of mobile devices located within a predetermined geographic area; determining whether any of the plurality of mobile devices have been stationary for a predetermined period of time; responsive to determining that none of the plurality of mobile devices have been stationary for the predetermined period of time, transmitting a notification message to all of the plurality of mobile devices instructing them to leave their respective current locations so as to move into closer proximity to another member of the pl

299.content: The beat is now a notch faster than your basic pulse rate, lots of other beats and counterrhythms woven through it, and the chanting of the individual singer has become a wild semi-organized choral phenomenon. At some point, after seemingly nothing has happened for half an hour, everything happens at once: The drumming and chanting explode to a new, impossible level of intensity. The dancers reach down, grip the flaccid reservoir tips of their radioactive condoms, stretch them out. Someone runs out with a knife and cuts off the tips of the condoms in a freakish parody of circumcision, exposing the glans of each man's penis. The girl moves for the first time, tossing her bouquet up in the air like a bride making her move toward the limo; the roses fountain, spinning end over end, and come down individually among the dancers, who snatch them out of the air, scrabble for them on the floor, whatever.
299.title: Method and apparatus for enhancing intimacy between two or more people
299.abstract: A method of enhancing intimacy between two or more people, comprising the steps of: (a) providing to each participant an electronic device that is capable of communicating with one or more other electronic devices; (b) transmitting from at least one first electronic device to at least one second electronic device data indicative of physiological information associated with its user(s); (c) determining in real-time whether there is a correlation between the physiological information received from different participants; (d) when it is determined that there is a correlation between the physiological information received from different participants, triggering provision of stimulation to both users via their respective electronic devices so as to enhance intimacy between them.

She had already removed the pedomotive from the M.C. and set it by the door for him; it was smart enough to know that it was indoors, and so its long legs were fully collapsed, giving him almost no mechanical advantage. 300.abstract: A method of controlling an exoskeleton is disclosed. 301.content: Though Bespoke was a design rather than a production house, it had its own matter compilers, including a couple of fairly big ones, a hundred cubic meters. Hackworth had reserved a more modest desktop model, one-tenth of a cubic meter. Use of these compilers had to be logged, so he identified himself and the project first. Then the machine accepted the edge of the document. Hackworth told the matter compiler to begin immediately, and then looked through a transparent wall of solid diamond into the eutactic environment.
301.title: Apparatus and method for manufacturing a three-dimensional (3D) object from a two-dimensional (2D) image of the 3D object
301.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for generating a three-dimensional (3D) object from a two-dimensional (2D) image of the 3D object. In one embodiment, an apparatus comprises at least one light source configured to emit electromagnetic radiation having a wavelength that is absorbed by a photoinitiator in a layer of photopolymerizable resin exposed to the electromagnetic radiation emitted by the at least one light source; a stage movable relative to the at least one light source between a first position and a second position different from the first position; and a controller configured to control movement of the stage between the first position and the second position while exposing the layer of photopolymerizable resin to the electromagnetic radiation emitted by the at least one light source so as to cure the layer of photopolymerizable resin into a 3D object corresponding to

302.content: It was a notification sent back to him automatically by a piece of machinery he had set into motion two years ago. The central message was wreathed in pages of technical gibberish, maps, graphs, and diagrams. The message was: THE YOUNG LADY'S ILLUSTRATED PRIMER HAS BEEN FOUND. It was accompanied by an animated, three-dimensional map of New Chusan with a red line drawn across it, starting in front of a rather seedy-looking high-rise apartment building in the Leased Territory called Enchantment and making its way erratically around the island from there.
302.title: Method and apparatus for locating a missing person
302.abstract: A method of locating a missing person is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) obtaining location data from at least one mobile device; (b) processing the location data to determine an estimated location of the missing person; (c) determining whether the estimated location falls within a predetermined geographical area; (d) if the estimated location does not fall within the predetermined geographical area, repeating steps (a)-(c) until the estimated location falls within the predetermined geographical area; and (e) once the estimated location falls within the predetermined geographical area, transmitting information relating to the estimated location in order to locate the missing person.

303.content: Most of the ones on the floor were windows into written documents, grids of numbers, schematic diagrams (lots of organizational trees), or wonderful maps, drawn with breathtaking precision and clarity, with rivers, mountains, and villages labeled in Chinese characters. As Nell surveyed this panorama, she flinched once or twice from the impression that something small was creeping along the floor; but there were no bugs in the room, it was just an illusion created by small fluctuations in the maps and in the rows and columns of numbers. These things were ractive, just like the words in the Primer; but unlike the Primer, they were responding not to what Nell did but, she supposed, to events far away. When she finally raised her gaze from the floor to view the mediatrons lining the walls, she saw that most of the panes there were much larger, and most of them carried cine feeds, and most of these had been frozen.
303.title: Systems and methods for providing information to a user based on a location of the user
303.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for providing information to a user based on a location of the user. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication that a mobile device associated with a user is located within a geographic area corresponding to a venue; determining whether the user has previously visited the venue; in response to determining that the user has not previously visited the venue, identifying content related to the venue; causing presentation of the content on a display of the mobile device; obtaining feedback from the user regarding the content; and modifying the content based at least in part on the feedback. Numerous other implementations are also contemplated.

304.content: But on his initial reconnaissance, he discovered a few items of interest. For one thing, the Nipponese fellow who had got pissed and fallen overboard had encountered a group of several other people who had, by a remarkable coincidence, also fallen out of their boats on the way here, and who upon being rescued had all begun to emit colored light and see visions that they insisted on recounting to anyone in the vicinity. These people convened into a poorly organized chorus, all shouting at once and articulating visions that seemed to be linked in an approximate way—as if they had all just now awakened from the same dream and were all doing an equally bad job describing it. They stuck together despite their differences, drawn together by the same mysterious attractive force that causes streetcorner crackpots to set up their soapboxes right next to each other. Shortly after Hackworth zoomed toward them in his phenomenoscopic view, they began to hallucinate something along the lines of a giant eyeball peering at them from the heavens, the black skin of its eyelids studded with stars. Hackworth skulked away and focused in on another large gathering: a couple of dozen older people of the trim, fit, and active style, tennis sweaters draped over their shoulders and sensible walking shoes firmly but not too tightly laced to their feet, piling off a small airship that had just moored on the old helicopter pad near the ship's stern. The airship had many windows and was festooned with mediatronic advertisements for aerial tours of London.
304.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a person across a body of water using a balloon-powered airship
304.abstract: A method is provided for transporting a person across a body of water using a balloon-powered airship. The method comprises the steps of providing an airship having at least one buoyancy control bladder (12) that can be inflated or deflated to increase or decrease the buoyancy of the airship, launching the airship into the air above the surface of the body of water, landing the airship onto the surface of the body of water by deflating the at least one buoyancy control bladder (12), securing the airship to the surface of the body of water with mooring lines (30), filling the at least one buoyancy control bladder (12) with enough helium gas to float the airship above the surface of the body of water, lifting off from the surface of the body of water while floating above the surface of the body of water,

305.content: “How's that?” the prisoner said. “Would you like another demonstration?” “I think I have the general idea,” Judge Fang said. “One of your high-level CryptNet tricks, I suppose. Nanosites embedded in your brain, mediating its interchanges with the peripheral nervous system. It would make sense for you to have advanced telæsthetic systems permanently installed. And a system that could trick your nerves into thinking that they were somewhere else could also trick them into thinking that they were not experiencing pain.” “What can be installed can be removed,” Miss Pao observed.
305.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and preventing unauthorized remote access to a computing device
305.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized user attempting to remotely access a computing device is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a first application executing on the computing device, from a second application executing on the computing device, one or more data packets; determining, by the first application in response to receiving the one or more data packets, whether the one or more data packets comprise at least one predetermined type of data packet; generating, by the first application in response to determining that the one or more data packets comprise at least one predetermined type of data packet, a hash value associated with said at least one predetermined type of data packet; and transmitting, by the first application, the generated hash value to a third application executing on the computing device. A corresponding apparatus, graphical user interface, and computer readable medium are also disclosed.

306.content: The sound of the drumming did not build gradually but exploded to a deafening, mind-dissolving roar as Carl emerged into a vast cavern, a conical amphitheatre that must have been a kilometer wide, roofed with a storm of mediatronic images that played across a vast dome. The Drummers, visible by the flickering light of the overhead media storm and by their own internal light, moved up and down the slopes of the cone in a kind of convection pattern. Caught up in an eddy, Carl was transported down toward the center and found that an orgy of fantastic dimensions was underway. The steam of vaporized sweat rose from the center of the pit in a cloud. The bodies pressing against Carl's naked skin were so hot that they almost burned him, as if everyone were running a high fever and in some logical abstract compartment of his mind that was, somehow, continuing to run along its own reasonable course, he realized why: They were exchanging packets of data with their bodily fluids, the packets were mating in their blood, the rod logic throwing off heat that drove up their core temperature. The orgy went on for hours, but the pattern of convection gradually slowed down and condensed into a stable arrangement, like a circulating crowd in a theatre that settles into its assigned seats as curtain time approaches. A broad open space had formed at the center of the pit, and the innermost ring of spectators consisted of men, as if these were in some sense the winners of the enormous fornication tournament that was nearing its final round. A lone Drummer circulated around this innermost ring, handing something out; the something turned out to be mediatronic condoms that glowed bright colors when they were stripped onto the men's erect phalluses.
306.title: Method and apparatus for communicating between a user and a virtual reality environment
306.abstract: A method of controlling an interaction between a user and a virtual reality (VR) environment is disclosed. The method comprises detecting, by one or more sensors associated with the VR environment, at least one gesture performed by the user within the VR environment; in response to detecting the at least one gesture, transmitting data indicative of the at least one gesture from the VR environment to a computing device used by the user to interact with the VR environment; determining, by the computing device, that the at least one gesture corresponds to a predetermined command relating to communication between the user and the VR environment; and responsive to determining that the at least one gesture corresponds to the predetermined command, initiating communication between the user and the VR environment according to the predetermined command. Corresponding apparatus, system, computer program product, and methods are also described.

307.content: “You yourself said that the engineers in the Bespoke department—the very best—had led interesting lives, rather than coming from the straight and narrow. Which implies a correlation, does it not?” “Clearly.” “This implies, does it not, that in order to raise a generation of children who can reach their full potential, we must find a way to make their lives interesting. And the question I have for you, Mr. Hackworth, is this: Do you think that our schools accomplish that?
307.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for determining an interest score for a user. One of the methods includes identifying a plurality of events associated with a user, wherein each event
307.abstract:
---
Resultado:a) corresponds to one or more actions taken by the user; andb) is stored in association with a time at which the action(s) took place.The method further includes generating a feature vector comprising features derived from the plurality of events corresponding to the user over a predetermined period of time (e.g., days, weeks, months, etc.). The method further includes training a machine learning model using the feature vectors generated during the predetermined period of time such that the machine learning model outputs an interest score for the user as a function of the input feature vector.

308.content: Much of this work was spalled from bullets fired by high-spirited Red Guards during Cultural Revolution times. Other than the bullet holes, the Parnasse was in decent shape, though sometime in the twentieth century great black-iron pipes had been anchored vertically alongside the boxes and horizontally before the balconies so that spotlights could be bolted on. Nowadays the spotlights were coin-size disks—phased-array devices that carried their own batteries—and could be stuck up anywhere and controlled by radio.
308.title: Method and apparatus for illuminating an object with a plurality of light emitting diodes (LEDs)
308.abstract: A method is disclosed for illuminating an object using a plurality of light-emitting diodes (LEDs). The method comprises the steps of determining at least one characteristic of each LED in the plurality of LEDs; selecting, from the plurality of LEDs, two or more LEDs having characteristics that are within a predetermined range of each other to form a group of selected LEDs; controlling the power supplied to the group of selected LEDs so as to provide substantially uniform illumination of the object by the group of selected LEDs. An apparatus for carrying out the method is also disclosed.

309.content: “Two days ago,” Judge Fang continued, “you returned to Shanghai in a riverboat badly overloaded with several dozen passengers, most of them peasants fleeing from famine and strife in the interior.” He was now reading from a Shanghai Harbormaster document detailing the inspection of the boat in question. “I note that several of the passengers were women carrying female infants under three months of age. The vessel was searched for contraband and admitted into the harbor.”
309.title: Method and apparatus for detecting counterfeit documents
309.abstract: A method of authenticating a document is disclosed. The method includes obtaining an image of the document, wherein the image comprises one or more machine-readable features (MRFs). The method further includes determining whether each MRF in the image satisfies at least one predetermined criterion associated with that MRF. In response to determining that none of the MRFs satisfy the at least one predetermined criterion, the method includes outputting an indication that the document is genuine. In response to determining that at least one of the MRFs satisfies the at least one predetermined criterion, the method includes outputting an indication that the document is not genuine.

310.content: Amid those trees was the silhouette of a human being. “Quiet,” Hackworth mouthed to his daughter, then reined Kidnapper to a stop. The person had a short haircut and wore a bulky waist-length jacket with stretch pants; they could tell by the curve of the hips that it was a woman. Around those hips she had fastened an arrangement of neon green straps: a climbing harness.
310.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computer system
310.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computer system includes receiving, by a processor from an input/output (I/O) device coupled to the computer system, I/O data. The method also includes determining whether the I/O data corresponds to one or more predetermined patterns stored in a pattern database. In response to determining that the I/O data does not correspond to at least one of the one or more predetermined patterns, the method further includes storing the I/O data in a first buffer associated with the I/O device. However, in response to determining that the I/O data corresponds to at least one of the one or more predetermined patterns, the method further includes discarding the I/O data without storing the I/O data in the first buffer.

311.content: The leader was a stocky man with white hair, sixtyish but pumping away vigorously on an unexceptional black bicycle, wearing drab worker's clothes. He moved it down the street with deceptive speed and pulled into the horseshoe drive. An embolism of bicycles formed on the street as hundreds tried to crowd in the narrow entrance. And here came another classic moment: The head bellhop skirted his stand-up desk and ran toward the bicyclist, waving him off and hurling abuse in Cantonese—until he got about six feet away and realized he was looking at Zhang Han Hua.
311.title: Method and apparatus for identifying and locating a person of interest in a large crowd based on facial recognition
311.abstract: A method, an apparatus, and at least one non-transitory computer-readable storage medium are disclosed to identify and locate a person of interest (POI) in a large crowd based on facial recognition.

312.content: “While I'm at it, if it pleases the court, I can also,” Hackworth said, most obsequiously, “make changes in the content so that it will be more suitable for the unique cultural requirements of the Han readership. But it will take some time.” “Very well,” said Judge Fang, “all but one stroke of the cane are suspended, pending the completion of these alterations. As for the ten years of imprisonment, I am embarrassed to relate that this district, being very small, does not have a prison, and so the suspect will have to be released this evening after the business with the cane is finished. But rest assured, Mr. Hackworth, that your sentence will be served, one way or another.”
312.title: Adaptation of a literary work for a different culture
312.abstract: An apparatus and method for adapting a literary work for a different culture. The invention relates to an apparatus (100) comprising at least one processing unit (102, 104), which is programmed to perform the following steps: acquiring textual data from a literary work; identifying cultural elements contained in the textual data; classifying the identified cultural elements according to predetermined criteria; determining whether or not there are any unclassified cultural elements; if it is determined that there are no unclassified cultural elements, generating adapted textual data by substituting non-cultural elements with other non-cultural elements within the textual data; and outputting the adapted textual data. If it is determined that there are unclassified cultural elements, storing the textual data including the unclassified cultural elements as well as the adapted textual data.

313.content: Chang also stripped the prisoner from the waist down and situated a bucket under his organs of elimination. In so doing he happened to expose the only actual injury that the prisoner would suffer during this entire procedure: a tiny, neat scab in the base of the spine, where the court physician had thrust in the spinal tap the previous afternoon, and introduced a set of nanosites—nanotechnological parasites—under the supervision of Miss Pao. In the ensuing twelve hours, the 'sites had migrated up and down the prisoner's spinal column, drifting lazily through the cerebrospinal fluid, and situated themselves on whatever afferent nerves they happened to bump up against. These nerves, used by the body to transmit information such as (to name only one example) excruciating pain to the brain, had a distinctive texture and appearance that the 'sites were clever enough to recognize. It is probably superfluous to mention that these 'sites had one other key feature, namely the ability to transmit bogus information along those nerves.
313.title: Method and apparatus for extracting information from a human being
313.abstract: A method of extracting information from a human being includes obtaining an image of the human being, wherein the image is obtained using at least one imaging device. The method further includes determining that the human being is wearing eyewear by analyzing pixels in the image corresponding to the eyewear. In response to determining that the human being is wearing eyewear, the method includes adjusting processing of the image according to characteristics of the eyewear worn by the human being. An apparatus for extracting information from a human being includes circuitry configured to obtain an image of the human being; determine that the human being is wearing eyewear by analyzing pixels in the image corresponding to the eyewear; and adjust processing of the image according to characteristics of the eyewear worn by the human being in response to determining that the human being is wearing eyewear. Various other aspects are contemplated.

314.content: Both ways are simple-minded—they are only for people who cannot cope with contradiction and ambiguity.” “Ah! Excellent!” the Constable exclaimed. As punctuation, he slapped the ground with his free hand, sending up a shower of sparks and transmitting a powerful shock through the ground to Nell's feet. “I suspect that Lord Finkle-McGraw, being an intelligent man, sees through all of the hypocrisy in his society, but upholds its principles anyway, because that is what is best in the long run. And I suspect that he has been worrying about how best to inculcate this stance in young people who cannot understand, as he does, its historical antecedents—which might explain why he has taken an interest in me. The Primer may have been Finkle-McGraw's idea to begin with—a first attempt to go about this systematically.”
314.title: Method and apparatus for educating a child
314.abstract: A method of educating a child includes providing the child with an electronic device, wherein the electronic device is programmed to present educational content to the child. The method also includes programming the electronic device to determine when the child has completed viewing the educational content presented by the electronic device. In response to determining that the child has completed viewing the educational content, the electronic device is further programmed to provide feedback to the child indicating that the child has completed viewing the educational content. Additionally, in response to determining that the child has completed viewing the educational content, the electronic device is further programmed to receive input from the child regarding whether the child understood the educational content provided by the electronic device.

315.content: The airship was a dromond, the largest class of noncargo vessel. It was divided into four classes.
315.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS)
315.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS) is disclosed. The UAV/UAS comprises one or more sensors configured to provide sensor data relating to the environment in which the UAV/UAS is operating. The method comprises comparing the sensor data with pre-determined thresholds, wherein if the sensor data exceeds at least one of the pre-determined thresholds then the UAV/UAS will be instructed to return to its home location. If the sensor data falls below at least one of the pre-determined thresholds then the UAV/UAS will be instructed to continue operation as normal.

316.content: From time to time they heard the thin whine of a pod going by, but they always kept on going, and before they knew it they were asleep. Mysterious souvenir from Dr. X; Hackworth's arrival in Vancouver; the Atlantan quarter of that city; he acquires a new mode of conveyance. Dr. X had dispatched a messenger to the Shanghai Aerodrome with instructions to seek out Hackworth. The messenger had sidled up next to him while he was addressing a piss-trough, greeted him cheerfully, and taken a piss himself. Then the two men had exchanged business cards, accepting them with both hands and a slight bow.
316.title: Getting there is half the fun
316.abstract: A method of determining an optimal route from a starting location to a destination location. A plurality of potential routes are determined between the starting location and the destination location, wherein each potential route comprises one or more waypoints that connect the starting location with the destination location. For each potential route in the plurality of potential routes, at least one characteristic associated with the potential route is determined. The plurality of potential routes are then ranked according to their respective characteristics so as to produce a ranked list of potential routes. An optimal route is selected from the ranked list of potential routes for traveling from the starting location to the destination location.

317.content: He had not noticed, before, the sheer maddening profusion of the place, each person seemingly an ethnic group of one, each with his or her own costume, dialect, sect, and pedigree. It was as if, sooner or later, every part of the world became India and thus ceased to function in any sense meaningful to straight-arrow Cartesian rationalists like John Percival Hackworth, his family and friends. Shortly after passing the Aerodrome they reached Stanley Park, an unruined peninsula several miles around, which had, thank God, been forked over to Protocol and kept much as it had always been, with the same Douglas firs and mossy red cedars that had been growing there forever. Hackworth had been here a few times and had a vague idea of how it was laid out: restaurants here and there, paths along the beach, a zoo and aquarium, public playing fields. Kidnapper took him for a nice lope along a pebbly beach and then somewhat abruptly bounded up a slope, for that purpose switching into a gait never used by any real horse.
317.title: Systems and methods for managing an apocalyptic event
317.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing an apocalyptic event. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method is provided that includes obtaining data associated with a plurality of geographic locations; identifying at least one location from the plurality of geographic locations in response to detecting an occurrence of an apocalyptic event; determining whether there are any survivors located within the at least one location; responsive to determining that there are no survivors located within the at least one location, removing the at least one location from the plurality of geographic locations; and transmitting information related to the removal of the at least one location from the plurality of geographic locations.

318.content: Most of King Coyote's books had to do with the secrets of atoms and how to put them together to make machines. Naturally, all of them were magic books; the pictures moved, and you could ask them questions and get answers. Some of them were primers and workbooks for novices, and Princess Nell spent a few days studying this art, putting atoms together to make simple machines and then watching them run. Next came a very large set of matched volumes containing reference materials: One contained designs for thousands of sleeve bearings, another for computers made of rods, still another for energy storage devices, and all of them were ractive so that she could use them to design such things to her own specifications. Then there were more books on the general principles of putting such things together into systems.
318.title: Systems and methods for creating and controlling virtual worlds
318.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for creating and controlling virtual worlds. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an input from a user to create a new virtual world; determining that the user is authorized to create the new virtual world; in response to determining that the user is authorized to create the new virtual world, transmitting information about the new virtual world to at least one computing device associated with users who are authorized to participate in the new virtual world; receiving acceptance of the new virtual world by each of the at least one computing device; associating each of the at least one computing device with the new virtual world; and providing access to the new virtual world to each of the at least one computing device. Other implementations are also described herein.

319.content: But perhaps more pressing matters prevented them from noticing this.” Judge Fang let the unspoken accusation hang in the air: that the Shanghai authorities were themselves not out of reach of CryptNet influence. PhyrePhox visibly tried to look ingenuous. “A day later, during a routine investigation of organized crime activity in the Leased Territories, we placed a surveillance device in an allegedly vacant apartment thought to be used for illegal activities and were startled to hear the sound of many small infants. Constables raided the place immediately and found twenty-four female infants, belonging to the Han racial group, being cared for by eight young peasant women, recently arrived from the countryside. Upon interrogation these women said that they had been recruited for this work by a Han gentleman whose identity has not been established, and who has not been found. The infants were examined. Five of them were on your boat, Mr. PhyrePhox—the biological records match perfectly.”
319.title: Systems and methods for detecting and preventing unauthorized access to data
319.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting and preventing unauthorized access to data. In one implementation, an apparatus includes a memory that stores instructions; and a processor that executes the instructions to facilitate performing operations. The operations can include receiving, from a first user device associated with a first user account, a request to provide access to content stored in a second user device associated with a second user account different than the first user account; determining whether the request is authorized by comparing information included in the request against at least one authorization rule; and responsive to determining that the request is not authorized, providing notification indicating that the request is not authorized. Other implementations are also contemplated.

320.content: A few moments later, a blaze of fiery red could be descried bouncing rapidly across the moor beyond the wall. Fiona clambered up a small outcropping of rocks that marked the beginning of the moor, and beckoned excitedly to her companions. “The secret passage is found by Nell, but she is cautious and patient.
320.title: Method and apparatus for determining a location of a vehicle in a parking facility
320.abstract: A method is provided for determining a location of a vehicle in a parking facility. The method includes receiving, by a mobile device carried by an occupant of the vehicle, one or more radio frequency (RF) signals transmitted from at least one RF transmitter disposed within the parking facility; measuring, by the mobile device, signal strengths of the one or more RF signals received by the mobile device; processing, by the mobile device, the measured signal strengths of the one or more RF signals to determine distances between the mobile device and the at least one RF transmitter; and determining, by the mobile device, the location of the vehicle with respect to the parking facility based on the determined distances between the mobile device and the at least one RF transmitter. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

321.content: Hackworth unclipped a small optical device from his watch chain, a nanotech telescope/microscope that frequently came in handy, and used it to look over one girl's shoulder. She was looking at a diagram of a small nanotechnological device, working her way through a tutorial that Hackworth had written several years ago. The column went past much faster than Hackworth had feared; they moved down the highway like a piston. Each battalion carried a banner, a very modest thing improvised from a painted bedsheet. Each banner bore the number of the battalion and a crest that Hackworth knew well, as it played an important role in the Primer.
321.title: Nanofabrication systems and methods for nanofabrication
321.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include apparatuses, systems, computer-implemented methods, and/or the like for fabricating structures. In one implementation, an apparatus includes a substrate having a first surface and a second surface opposite the first surface; a plurality of nozzles extending through the substrate from the first surface to the second surface, wherein each of the plurality of nozzles is configured to eject a droplet of a liquid onto the first surface of the substrate; and a heater coupled to at least some of the plurality of nozzles, wherein the heater is configured to selectively heat any of the plurality of nozzles in response to receiving a control signal that indicates which of the plurality of nozzles should be heated.

322.content: “In any case, returning to your previous statement, we have established that over the next eight years, Node 178 did a prosperous business—as you said, processing tuples. During this time you worked your way up the hierarchy to the tenth level. Then you claim to have severed your connection with CryptNet and gone into business for yourself, as a mediagrapher. Since then, you have specialized in war zones. Your photo, cine, and sound collages from the battlegrounds of China have won prizes and been accessed by hundreds of thousands of media consumers, though your work is so graphic and disturbing that mainstream acceptance has eluded you.”
322.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized use of copyrighted material
322.abstract: A method includes obtaining, by one or more processors, an image from a user device. The method also includes determining, by the one or more processors, at least one portion of the image that is likely to be altered in order to conceal identifying information associated with the user device. The method further includes generating, by the one or more processors, a fingerprint comprising data indicative of the at least one portion of the image that is likely to be altered in order to conceal the identifying information associated with the user device. The method additionally includes transmitting, by the one or more processors, the fingerprint to a remote server. The method further includes receiving, by the one or more processors, a response from the remote server indicating whether the received fingerprint matches a previously stored fingerprint.

323.content: At one end was a raised building open to the square on one side, covered with a sweeping tile roof whose corners curved high into the air and whose ridgeline was adorned with a clay frieze portraying a couple of dragons facing off with a large pearl between them. Hackworth realized, dimly, that this was actually the stage of an open-air theatre, which enhanced the impression that he was the sole spectator at an elaborate play written and staged for his benefit.
323.title: Method and apparatus for generating a three-dimensional holographic image from a two-dimensional image
323.abstract: A method of generating a three-dimensional (3D) holographic image from a two-dimensional (2D) image is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: obtaining an input image, wherein each pixel in the input image corresponds to one or more pixels in the 2D image; converting the input image into a plurality of patches by dividing the input image into a plurality of non-overlapping patches using a predetermined threshold value; determining whether there are overlapping patches among the plurality of non-overlapping patches; if there are overlapping patches among the plurality of non-overlapping patches, merging the overlapping patches until no overlapping patches remain within the input image; extracting feature vectors corresponding to each of the plurality of non-overlapping patches; training a convolutional neural network

324.content: As this territory belongs to a nation-state that recognizes the Common Economic Protocol, you are entitled to a hearing of any such charges within the judicial framework of the nation-state in question, which in this case happens to be the Chinese Coastal Republic. This nation-state may or may not grant you additional rights; we will find out in a very few moments, when we present the situation to one of the relevant authorities. Ah, I believe I see one now.” A constable from the Shanghai Police, legs strapped into a pedomotive, was coming down the street with the tremendous loping strides afforded by such devices, escorted by a couple of power-skating Ashantis.
324.title: Method and apparatus for resolving disputes
324.abstract: A method of resolving a dispute between two or more parties is provided. The method includes receiving, from each of the two or more parties involved in the dispute, at least one piece of evidence relating to the dispute; analyzing the received pieces of evidence using an artificial intelligence (AI) model that has been pre-trained with training data comprising other pieces of evidence related to previous disputes resolved by the AI model; determining whether any of the received pieces of evidence are indicative of fraudulent activity; and if it is determined that any of the received pieces of evidence are indicative of fraudulent activity, flagging those pieces of evidence as potentially fraudulent and disregarding those pieces of evidence when resolving the dispute. Corresponding systems and computer program products are also provided.

325.content: She spread the stew thinly over screens to draw out the water and flattened it with a great hand-cranked press to make paper, thick and rough-edged and subtly colored from the thousands of tiny fibers wending through it. When she had a stack of paper made, she would take it next door to a shop with a sharp oily smell, where a bearded man with a smudged apron would run it through another big hand-cranked machine. When it came out of this machine, it had letters on the top, giving the name and address of a lady in New Atlantis.
325.title: Systems and methods for creating and delivering personalized greeting cards
325.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for creating and delivering personalized greeting cards. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an input from a user to create a customized greeting card comprising at least one image selected by the user among a plurality of pre-stored images stored in a database associated with a computing system. The method further includes retrieving the at least one image according to the input received from the user; displaying the retrieved at least one image as part of the customized greeting card; transmitting the customized greeting card including the displayed at least one image to a recipient email address provided by the user; and printing the customized greeting card using a printer connected to the computing system. Other implementations are also contemplated.

326.content: Then, in a tight voice, she said, “Nell, you should ask your book the meaning of the word discretion.” They came across a riding-trail dotted with great mounds of horse manure, and began following it uphill. Soon the trail was hemmed in between dry stone walls, which Rita said that one of her friends in Dovetail had made. Forest gave way to pastures, then lawns like jade glaciers, and great houses on hilltops, surrounded by geometric hedges and ramparts of flowers. The trail became a cobblestone road that adopted new lanes from time to time as they rode into town. The mountain kept rising up above them for some distance, and on its green summit, half veiled behind a thin cloud layer, Nell could see Source Victoria. From down in the Leased Territories, the New Atlantis Clave had always looked clean and beautiful, and it was certainly those things.

If this system is working properly, and if the girl does not take the book out of her building, then she should go unnoticed by these.” The Judge drew a streak through the dust on the book's cover and smeared the toner between his fingers. “Speak with the landlord of her building, and let him know that his air-filtering system is due for an inspection, and that this is genuine, not just a solicitation for a bribe.”

329.content: “There are only two industries. The industry of things comes first. It keeps us alive. But making things is easy now that we have the Feed. This is not a very interesting business anymore. “After people have the things they need to live, everything else is entertainment. Everything. This is Madame Ping's business.”

During her trip from the campsite of the Mouse Army to the first of the castles, Nell had to use all the wilderness skills she had learned in years of traveling around the Land Beyond: She fought with a mountain lion, avoided a bear, forded streams, lit fires, built shelters.

331.content: Lord Finkle-McGraw glanced at her and saw pain in her face, quickly masked. He understood the rest of her sentence without hearing it: . . . and my husband is here with us. A pair of riders, a man and a woman, trotted up a gravel path that ran along the edge of the gardens, through a pair of wrought-iron gates in the stone wall, which opened for them. The man was Lord Finkle-McGraw's son Colin, the woman was his wife, and they had ridden out onto the moor to keep an eye on their daughter and her two little friends. Seeing that their supervision was no longer required, Lord Finkle-McGraw and Mrs. Hackworth turned away from the window and drew instinctively closer to a fire burning in a stone fireplace the size of a garage.

339.content: She thought that the subject of CryptNet was closed; but a quarter of an hour later, as Kidnapper carried them swiftly through the trees down toward Seattle, her father spoke again, picking up the sentence where he had left it, as if he had merely paused for breath. His voice was slow and distant and almost trancelike, the memories percolating outward from deep storage with little participation from his conscious mind. “CryptNet's true desire is the Seed—a technology that, in their diabolical scheme, will one day supplant the Feed, upon which our society and many others are founded. Protocol, to us, has brought prosperity and peace—to CryptNet, however, it is a contemptible system of oppression. They believe that information has an almost mystical power of free flow and self-replication, as water seeks its own level or sparks fly upward—and lacking any moral code, they confuse inevitability with Right. It is their view that one day, instead of Feeds terminating in matter compilers, we will have Seeds that, sown on the earth, will sprout up into houses, hamburgers, spaceships, and books—that the Seed will develop inevitably from the Feed, and that upon it will be founded a more highly evolved society.” He stopped for a moment, took a deep breath, and seemed to stir awake; when he spoke again, it was in a clearer and stronger voice. “Of course, it can't be allowed—the Feed is not a system of control and oppression, as CryptNet would maintain. It is the only way order can be maintained in modern society—if everyone possessed a Seed, anyone could produce weapons whose destructive power rivalled that of Elizabethan nuclear weapons. This is why Protocol Enforcement takes such a dim view of CryptNet's activities.”
339.title: Method and apparatus for preventing unauthorized access to data

Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

In many places the traffic was so dense that greater speed could be attained on foot. A few half-lane vehicles sat motionless, polished boulders in a sluggish brown stream.

344.content: There followed a good deal of muffled commotion upstairs. After a few minutes, Amelia ventured as far down as the landing and encouraged Hackworth to make himself comfortable in the parlor. He did so, noting that in his absence, Gwendolyn had been able to consummate all of the long-term furniture-buying strategies she had spent so much time plotting during the early years of their marriage. Wives and widows of secret agents in Protocol Enforcement could rely on being well cared for, and Gwen had not allowed his salary to sit around collecting dust. His ex-wife descended the stairway cautiously, stood outside the beveled-glass parlor doors for a minute peering at him through the gauze curtains, and finally slipped into the room without meeting his gaze and took a seat rather far away from him.

345.content: Faint clouds of diaphanous black oozed between the towers and stockades, and as Princess Nell drew closer, she saw that they were actually regiments of ravens going through their military drills. They were the closest thing King Coyote had to an army; for as one of the ravens had told her, after he had stolen the eleven keys from around her neck, Castles, gardens, gold, and jewels Contentment signify, for fools Like Princess Nell; but those Who cultivate their wit Like King Coyote and his crows Compile their power bit by bit And hide it places no one knows. King Coyote did not preserve his power by armed might but by cleverness, and sentinels were the only army he needed, information his only weapon. As she galloped the final miles to the gate, wondering whether her legs and back would hold out, a thin steam of black issued from a narrow portal high in one of the floating stockades, thickened into a transparent ball, and dove toward her like a plunging comet. She could not help flinching from the illusion of mass and momentum, but, a stone's throw above her head the cloud of ravens parted into several contingents that whirled around and struck from several directions, converging on her, passing around her so closely that the wind from their rattling wings blew her hair back, finally reforming into a disciplined group that returned to its stockade without a look back.
